loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes H. C. es una cliente muy responsable y muy conocida por la institución, es propietaria de una pensión restaurante y su esposo es propietario de dos radio taxis.
Son una pareja muy joven y con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo duro lograron todo lo que tienen ahora, el crédito desembolsado lo invertirán en mejorar la imagen de su pensión restaurante con la compra de sillas y mesas nuevas.
Tiene tres niños pequeños a su cargo y pensando en su bienestar y futuro es que ellos se esfuerzan y trabajan duro, con el tiempo piensan en ampliar su pensión y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes H. C. is a very responsible client and our organization knows her well. She owns a pension-restaurant and her husband owns two radio-taxis. They are a young, strong couple who have worked very hard to get where they are. They plan to use their loan to upgrade the look of the pension-restaurant with new tables and chairs. They have three children to care for, whose well being and futures are their reason for working and trying so hard. In time they plan to expand the pension so they can earn more.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es: Auxiliadora V. Martínez tiene 58 años de edad, y está casada. Auxiliadora tiene cinco hijos, y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Su propósito es incrementar su pulpería con nuevos productos, ya que esta la única manera en la que puede trabajar. Auxiliadora estableció la venta de golosinas porque necesitaba una manera de gastar plata, y mantener este negocio ha sido uno de los desafíos más difíciles. Auxiliadora tiene 20 préstamos con Fundación y su record crediticio es el mejor. Por lo que le gustaría invertir más en su producto. Ella va a pagar la cantidad de 10.000  a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora V. Martínez is 58 years old and married. Auxiliadora has five children, who now all work independently. Her goal is to expand her grocery store with new products, since this is the only way that she can work. Auxiliadora established the sale of snacks/sweets because she needed a way to earn money. Maintaining this business has been one of her most difficult challenges. Auxiliadora has a 20-loan history with Fundación. Her credit record is the best, which is why she would like to invest more into her products. She is going to pay an amount of 10,000 Nicaraguan over a term of 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Graciela es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Graciela tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, frutas, útiles escolares, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Graciela junto a su esposo tiene un taller de carpintería.
Graciela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera.
Los sueños de Graciela son tener una ferretería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Obreras Village Bank. She is 40-years-old, and married with 2 children. She has a store in her house, where she sells groceries, fruits, and school supplies on a daily basis. In addition, she and her husband have a carpentry workshop. Graciela needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of wood. Her dreams include having a hardware store, and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Madame Djeneba Traoré est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mère de (3) trois enfants et vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son époux et  ses enfants. Cette femme est  installée au quartier Guegneka dans la ville de Fana relevant de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro république du Mali.
Madame Djeneba Traoré na pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons d’ordre familiale. Elle aidait sa maman dans les activités domestiques et économiques. Après plus de 13 ans au service de sa mère, elle décida de s’installer  à son propre compte et cela dans la vente de poisson fumé (qu’elle a apprise auprès de sa belle mère) et du miel. Elle est installée sous un grand hangar dans le grand marché de Fana.
 Pour obtenir des ressources financières complémentaires et supporter la concurrence de plus en plus rude, elle a décidé d’intégrer le programme de microfinance   Soro Yiriwaso.   
Après  8 prêts  de groupe avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son quatrième prêt individuel et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle se propose d’acheter avec ce prêt : 400 kg de poisson fumé  à partir de Mopti pour être revendu à Fana au comptant ou en crédit, en gros ou en détail à une clientèle  constituée d’hommes et de femmes. 
En partance pour Mopti pour son réapprovisionnement elle achète du miel à Fana pour le revendre au comptant à Mopti aux grossistes. Cela lui permet non seulement d’éviter le transport de l’argent liquide mais aussi de diversifier son activité afin d’avoir plus de bénéfice.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 40 000F CFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour  aider son mari.
texts.en:
Mrs.Djeneba Traoré is 47 years old. She is the mother of three (3) children and lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children. Djeneba is located in the Guegneka neighborhood of the city of Fana, prefecture of Dioila, in the region of Kouilikoro, Republic of Mali. Mrs.Djeneba Traoré did not have the opportunity to attend school due to reasons of priority, within her family. She assisted her mother in domestic and business activities. After 13 years of assisting her mother, she decided to set up her own business selling smoked fish (an activity she learned from her mother-in-law) and selling honey. She set herself up in the large open hanger at the central market in Fana. Facing increased competition and to secure additional financial resources, she decided to join the micro-finance program at Soro Yiriwaso. After completing eight group loans, with a neighborhood loan group, she is now on her fourth individual loan. All these loans have been duly repaid. With this loan she wants to buy; 400 kg of smoked fish to be purchased at Mopti and resold in Fana for cash or credit. She will sell in either wholesale or retail lots, to a clientele of both men and women. When she travels to Mopti to replenish her provisions, she buys honey in Fana to be resold for cash to the wholesales in Mopti. This allows her to carry less cash during the trip and also diversifies her business activity to earn additional profit. She expects to realize a monthly profit of 40,000 CFA which she will use to assist her husband.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of smoked fish

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Norma es casada, tiene 47 años y 3 hijos, Norma vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, para lo cual cuenta con una carretilla, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos en sus tiempos libres. 
Norma necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de galletas, caramelos, chocolates.
Los sueños de Norma son educar a sus hijos y tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Obreras ('Workers') community bank. She is 47-years old and married with three children. She sells candy from a wheelbarrow as a street vendor near the center of Ayacucho city. Her children help her in their free time. Norma needs a loan of 800 PEN to invest in cookies, candy, and chocolate. Norma's goals are to have her children complete school and to have a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cookies, candy, and chocolate.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace E. is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a photographer.  She attended school until junior high. Grace sells plastic products and saucepans at the Nyankumasi market near Cape Coast, which she has done for 4 years.  

Grace uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Grace will use the loan to expand her business.  She is going to buy plastic products and saucepans in larger quantities for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to continue reinvesting in her business to further expand.

loans.use: Grace will use the loan to buy more plastic products and saucepans in larger quantities for sale.

loans.name: Eugenia Faustina

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Eugenia es casada, tiene 51 años y 2 hijos, Eugenia tiene un restaurante en su vivienda, prepara desayuno y almuerzo, actividad que realiza todos los días y cuenta con la ayuda de 4 personas. Además Eugenia alquila su local para diferentes eventos y compromisos.
Eugenia necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vitrinas para exhibir sus productos.
Eugenia sueña con tener una galería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Banco Comunal Obreras community bank. She is 51, married, and has 2 children. She has a restaurant in her house where she serves breakfast and lunch every day, with the help of 4 people. Eugenia also rents out her premises for events and celebrations.

She needs a loan of 1400 sol to invest in a display counter to exhibit her products.

Her dream is to have a store and for her children to have a profession.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a display counter for her products

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca F. D. M. se dedica a la venta D. chompas en un pequeño puesto que tiene en el centro D. la ciudad, está casada con el señor Miltón M. que es garzón, tienen tres hijos D. los cuales uno sigue a su cargo. El resto son mayores e independientes.
La señora M. comenzó con un pequeño capital y ahora tiene un puesto fijo, con mucho sacrificio pagó los estudios D. sus hijos los cuales ahora son profesionales y ayudan con los gastos familiares. Ella espera que con el tiempo y con su trabajo mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia, por ahora viven humildemente en un hogar feliz.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca F. D. M. earns her living selling sweaters in a small stall in the center of the city. She's married to Mr. Miltón M., who is a waiter. They have three children, one of whom is still dependent. The others are older and independent. Mrs. M. started out with a small amount of capital and now has a permanent stall. Through great sacrifice she paid for her children's schooling, and now they're professionals and help out with the household expenses. She hopes that over time she can work to raise her family's standard of living; for the time being they live modestly in a happy home.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Alejandrina es casada, tiene 47 años y 3 hijos, Alejandrina tiene una bodega en su casa, en donde vende abarrotes, frutas, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos en su tiempo libre. Además tiene maquinas de tragamonedas.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Alejandrina son progresar mas en su negocio y construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the Banco Comunal Obreras community bank. She is 47, married and has 3 children. Alejandrina has a shop in her house, where she sells groceries, fruit and drinks. Her children help out in their spare time. She also has gaming machines.

Alejandrina needs a loan of 800 sol to buy rice and sugar.

Her ambition is to expand her business and build a second floor on her house.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Teresa es viuda, tiene 47 años y 5 hijos, Teresa venD. frutas, golosinas D. manera ambulatoria en una calle concurrida, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Teresa compra frutas D. la ciudad D. Huanta y lo comercializa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Teresa necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. golosinas.
El sueño D. Teresa es tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of Banco Comunal Fe community bank. She is 47, a widow and has 5 children. Teresa sells fruit and candy from a stall in a busy street; she works every day.

Teresa also buys fruit in the city of Huanta and sells it in the city of Ayacucho. She needs a loan of 600 sol to buy candy.

Teresa's dream is to have a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candy

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Tous mariés, les membres du groupe Benkadi ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et de 6 enfants .Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales élargies traditionnelles avec les sœurs, frères, enfants et époux dans le village de Coni dans la sous préfecture de Fana dans la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, république du Mali. 
Unies par des relations familiales, elles font le ramassage des noix de karité et l’achat vente des noix de karité.
 Dans le souci de développer leurs activités génératrices de revenu, elles ont décidé intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après deux prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Les membres du groupe comptent acheter en plus de leur propre quantité ramassée,  4 tonnes de noix de karité auprès de leurs camarades de Coni pour les revendre au comptant aux grossistes venant de grandes villes telle Fana,  Ségou, Sikasso etc. Leur clientèle est composée essentiellement d’hommes.
 Avec ce prêt elles  comptent obtenir un bénéfice de 15 000 FCFA  chacune et se proposent d’utiliser ce bénéfice dans l’épanouissement de leur activité.
texts.en:
All married, the members of the Benkadi group have an average age of 33 and, on average, 6 children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families with sisters, brothers, children and husbands, in the village of Coni, in the Sous-prefecture of Fana, Prefecture of Dioïla, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali.

United by ties of family, they collect "karité" nuts (out of which shea butter is made) and buy and sell those nuts. Wishing to develop their businesses, they decided to become members of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After two group loans (solidarity loans) they are on their third solidarity loan with the two preceding loans correctly reimbursed.

The members of the group intend to buy more nuts than they themselves can collect: 4 tons of karité nuts from their colleagues in Coni, to re-sell them for cash to wholesalers who come from the big towns such as Fana, Ségou, Sikasso, etc. Their clientele is composed essentially of men.

With this loan they expect to make a profit of 15,000 F CFA each and intend to use this profit to expand their business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of karité nuts for re-sale

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Julia es casada, tiene 56 años y 7 hijos, Julia venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en una calle adyacente al mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días con apoyo D. sus hijos.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. una cocina a gas.
El sueño D. Julia es tener un local estable y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Banco Comunal Morenita II community bank. She is 56, married with 7 children. Julia sells food from a stall in the street besiD. the Magdalena market; she works seven days a week, and her children help her.

Julia needs a loan of 750 sol to buy a gas cooker.

Her ambition is to have a stable premises and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis A. Quisbert es fabricante de calzados de cuero y ya lleva trabajando 20 años en esta actividad, tiene un hijo a su cargo y una esposa que se dedica a la venta de los calzados que él mismo fabrica. Aprendió el oficio de su papá y comenzó como ayudante para luego con sus ahorros comprar su propio equipo y máquinaria, ahora trabaja solo y piensa en sacar  más créditos para hacer crecer su negocio. Don Jose Luis A. trabaja con la institución desde el 2007 siempre ha sido puntual con sus pagos, y responsable con su trabajo.
texts.en:
José Luis A. Quisbert makes leather shoes and has worked in this activity for 20 years. He has a son to support and a wife who sells the shoes that he produces. He learned this profession from his father. He began as an apprentice and later used his savings to buy his own equipment and machinery. Now he works independently and is thinking about taking out more loans to grow his business. Don Jose Luis A. has worked with the institution since 2007. He has always been punctual with his payments and responsible with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Cándida Rosa Martínez tiene 61 años, está soltera, y tiene una hija de 14 años. Sus propósitos son mantener activo su negocio, y antes de empezar con este negocio Doña Cándida se dedicaba a la costura. En sus momentos libres realiza la elaboración de prendas de vestir para comercializarlas, y con el fin de obtener más ingresos, establecerá una librería en su casa. Hace más de 17 años que tiene de poseer este negocio y poco a poco ha logrado mejorar su negocio. Cándida necesita financiamiento para realizar la compra de más productos para el negocio.  Sus sueños son de establecer un negocio para su hija y así podrá independizarse por sí sola. El monto a total es de 9.000 córdobas y el plazo mensual es de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Cándida Rosa Martínez is 61 years old, is single, and has a 14 year old daughter. Her goal is to keep her business active. Before starting this business Cándida worked as a seamstress. In her free time she makes items of clothing to sell, and with the goal of obtaining more income, she runs a bookstore from her house. She has owned this business for more than 17 years, and little by little she been successful in improving the business. Cándida needs this loan to buy more products for the business. Her dream is to establish a business for her daughter, so that her daughter can become independent. The total loan sum is 9.000 cordobas, to be repaid in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Yovana es soltera, tiene 35 años y 1 hija, Yovana tiene una tienda en su casa, en donde vende abarrotes, útiles escolares, servicio de fotocopiado, Yovana tiene proyectado vender utiles escolares en la campaña escolar.
Yovana necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra cuadernos, pinturas, plumones.
Los sueños de Yovana son construir su casa, surtir su negocio y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
Yovana is a member of the Morenita Communal Bank II. She is single, 35 years old, and has one daughter. Yovana has a store in her house where she sells groceries, school supplies, and photocopying service. She is planning to sell school supplies during the school year and needs a loan of 1050 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of notebooks, paints, and markers. Yovana's dreams are to build her house, supply her business, and have her own resources.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of notebooks, paints, and markers

loans.name: Main De L'eternel Group

texts.en:
Albert D. operates a roadside pharmacy and boutique. He is forty years old, a father of three children between the ages of 5 and 10, who all go to school. He has been in his business since 2000. He began with a capital of US$ 50 which allowed him to start a kiosk of soaps, biscuits, canned goods, matches, candles, etc.

From 2000 to 2002, with hard work, good management, and a profit of around US$ 10 per day, Albert’s business prospered and he increased his working capital to US$ 1000. He bought a plot of land in a good area for his business and he decided to stay there with his family and make his business permanent there. From the profit gained over time, he extended his business by adding clothing and children’s shirts, some of which he sent to the Kasai province in DRCongo for sale.

From 2004 to January 2008, Albert stabilized his business until he joined one of Hope’s groups called “La Main de Dieu” which means “God’s Hand” in English. Today, his business makes US$ 30 per day. Currently, his working capital is US$ 700. He has training as a nurse, and his dream is to open clinic in his area. The group consists of 27 members. He lives and sells in Masina, the most populated area of Kinshasa, located in the northern area of the city.

loans.use: To purchase medicines in order to add new products to his pharmacy

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Nancy es soltera, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Nancy tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, bebidas, también elabora chupetes, actividad que realiza todos los días con el apoyo de sus hijos.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz.
Los sueños de Nancy son surtir su negocio y que sus hijos continúen estudiando.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Morenita Communal Bank II. She is single, 35 years old, and has three children. Nancy has a shop in her house where she sells groceries, vegetables, and beverages. She also makes lollipops, an activity she undertakes every day with the help of her children. Nancy needs a loan of 1050 Peruvian soles that will be invested in the purchase of sugar and rice. Nancy's dreams are to supply her business and insure that her children continue studying.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sugar and rice

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. sells fish which she buys from fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and than resells them at the market. She also prepares a local meal popularly known as 'konkonte' for sale at jukai Odumasi near Cape Coast. She has been involved with this business for 14 years.

Cecilia has been educated to junior high education level. She is married and has 4 dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Her loan will be used to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and resale, and buy cassava and other ingredients for the food production and sale. She will use the new profits from her business for further expansion of her trade in the food preparation and fish processing.

In the photograph above she is seen preparing 'kokonte'.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities for processing and resale and buy cassava and other ingredients for the food production and sale.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont tous des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et de 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les frères, sœurs, enfants et époux. Elles résident tous dans le village de Coni sous préfecture de Fana région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
Par des relations de mariage, ces femmes se sont connues et font majoritairement l’achat vente des condiments alimentaires. 
Dans l’intention d’agrandir la taille de leur commerce elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur quatrième prêt après avoir remboursé tous les trois prêts précédents.
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 100kg de sel de cuisine, 10 boites de 2 kg de concentrée de tomate  et une grande quantité de condiments divers. 
Elles s’approvisionnent dans le marché de Marka-Coungo et viennent revendre sur le marché local de Coni et ses environnants. Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice de 25 000 F CFA chacune et se proposent d’utiliser ce bénéfice pour assurer une bonne alimentation  de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are all married women with an average age of 29 and on average, 5 children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, children and husbands. They all reside in the village of Coni, Sous-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali.

These women are acquainted with each other because they are in-laws and for the most part, they buy and sell condiments.

With the intention of increasing the size of their businesses, they joined the micro-finance institute Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth loan, after having reimbursed the three preceding loans correctly.

With this loan they intend to buy 100 kg of cooking salt, 10 cans of 2 kg of tomato concentrate, and a large quantity of various other condiments. They do their buying in the market of Marka-Coungo and come to sell their merchandise in the local markets of Coni and its surroundings. They expect to make a profit of 25,000 F CFA each and intend to use this profit to nourish their children well.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments for re-sale

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Consuelo es casada tiene 55 años y 3 hijos, Consuelo tiene un restaurante llamado Don Jose en un local alquilado, prepara desayuno, almuerzo y cena, Consuelo cuenta con 8 personas que se encargan D. la cocina y atención al publico.
 Consuelo necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite.
Los sueños D. Consuelo son tener un multiservicio en su casa y descansar.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a member of the Morenita Communal Bank II. She is married, is 55 years old, and has three children. Consuelo has a restaurant called Don Jose in a rented location where she prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Consuelo relies on eight people in charge of the kitchen and serving the customers. She needs a loan of 1500 Peruvian soles which will be invested in buying rice, sugar, oil. Consuelo's dreams are to have a multi-service business at home and to rest.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Miriam Marleny

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Miriam junto a su mama tienen un restaurante llamado Don José, actividad que realiza todos los días, durante todo el día, para lo cual cuenta con 8 personas que se encargan de la cocina y atención.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Miriam son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y tener un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Miriam is a partner of the Banco Comunal Morenita II. Miriam lives with her significant other; she is 30 and has two children. She, along with her mother, have a restaurant called “Don Jose”; activity that Miriam does every day, all day long, helped by 8 people who take care of the kitchen and customer attendance. Miriam needs a loan of 600 soles which will be used to buy rice and sugar. Miriam’s dreams are for her children to finish school and to have her own business.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is 40 years old. She is widowed with six children. The eldest is a commercial driver, one child is a  hairdresser and the rest are still in junior high school. Rose is a local manufacturer of palm oil and has sold fruits like bananas and oranges for the past eight years to take care of her family. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruit. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil.  Palm oil is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale due to lack of capital to buy machines for the processing.

In addition to the palm oil business, she also sells fruits like banana and oranges etc. in the community where she lives. She says this has also slowed down due to current food prices in the world market. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She wants the loan to purchase bananas and oranges etc. so that she can produce daily and supply to her customers on regular bases.

Rose believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to provide food and finance her children's education. Rose belongs to a village bank called Chance. She hopes to receive GH¢700 to make her business grow by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts, fruits, bananas, and oranges to restock her inventory.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Rafael Antonio R. S. tiene 51 años, está soltero, y tiene dos hijos de 27 y 30 años respectivamente. Don Rafael comienza con este negocio hace 12 años, por lo que inicia con la venta de pocos mariscos. Logra aprender este oficio convirtiéndolo en su medio de supervivencia, con las ganancias obtenidas ha logrado establecer una pulpería en su vivienda. Por lo que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita proporcionarle mantenimiento a su bote de pesca, y así podrá ofrecerles a sus clientes los diferentes tipos de productos. Sus sueños son de establecer un lugar para vender sus productos. El va a pagar el monto de 20.000 Córdobas el plazo es de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio R. S. is 51 years old, is single, and has two children who are 27 and 30 years old respectively. Rafael started his business 12 years ago, with the sale of a small quantity of seafood. As he has learned the fishing trade he has converted this into his main source of income, and with the earnings he has established a small grocery store in his home. He is seeking a loan for working capital, for the maintenance of his fishing boat, so that he can offer his customers different types of products. His dream is to establish a place to sell his products. He is going to repay the loan of 20,000 córdobas over 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cledy Pilar

texts.es:
Cledy es socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua.
Cledy es casada, tiene 18 años y esta embarazada de su primer hijo, Cledy es panificadora, se dedica a la elaboración de todo tipos de panes los cuales son horneados en el horno de sus padres.
Cledy necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina por sacos.
Los sueños de Cledy son tener una tienda de ropa, ampliar su panadería y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Cledy is a partner of Banco Comunal Corri Ayllu which means “Golden Family” in Quechua language. Cledy is married; she is 18 and pregnant with her first child. She is a baker; she elaborates all kinds of bread which are baked in her parents’ oven. Cledy needs a loan of 1,600 soles which will be invested in purchasing sacks of flour. Cledy’s dreams are to have an apparel store, expand the bakery and build a house.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour sacks

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
En majorité des femmes mariées, les membres du groupe Dembagnouma ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les époux, sœurs et frères. Elles résident dans le village de Coni sous préfecture de Fana région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des relations commerciales. En effet elles exercent toutes le commerce de céréales.
Dans le souci de développer leur commerce ces femmes ont intégré le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Les membres du groupe comptent acheter avec les paysannes et paysans  producteurs du village de Coni 800kg de maïs, 300kg de sorgho pour les revendre au comptant et en détail sur le marché de Coni aux revendeurs et consommateurs venant d’ailleurs.
Elles espèrent réaliser 17 500 FCFA de bénéfice  chacune avec ce prêt, qui servira à aider les époux à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mostly married women, the members of the Dembagnouma group have an average age of 26 and on average, 3 children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families with their husbands, sisters and brothers. They reside in the village of Coni, Sous-prefecture of Fana, region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali.

They met through their businesses, since in fact they all sell cereals. With the intention of developing their businesses, these women joined the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). Both the preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

The members of the group intend to buy, from the women and men of the village of Coni who farm the crops, 800 kg of maize and 300 kg of sorghum which they will re-sell, for cash, at the market of Coni and also to retailers and consumers who come from other places.

With this loan, they each expect to make 17,500 F CFA in profit , which will be used to help their husbands support their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals for re-sale

loans.name: Felomina Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica es  socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua.
Angélica es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Angélica se dedica a la venta de aves como pericos, palomas, loros, sus ventas lo realiza en la feria de las Américas los días domingos, también vende jaulas.
Angélica necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de aves.
Angélica sueña con ampliar su negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Angélica is a partner of Banco Comunal Corri Ayllu which means “Golden Family” in Quechua language. Angelica is married; she is 30 and has 3 children. She sells birds such as parakeets, doves, and parrots at the “Feria de las Americas” on Sundays and she also trades cages. Angelica needs a loan of 1,000 soles which will be invested in buying more birds. Angelica dreams on growing her business and building a house.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy birds

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce B. is a 34 year-old woman, married with two children, one of whom is currently schooling and the last born is breastfeeding. Joyce works very hard to provide for herself and her children.  She is into the sale of ladies slippers by hawking (door to door sales). With her good customer relations, Joyce believes she would make more sales if she purchases the right quality of goods demanded by her loyal customers. She says this would help her make more profit to expand her business and also finance her kid’s education. She also sells gari and fried fish at the main road of Koforidua where she currently lives. Gari is prepared from milled cassava. It has been her wish to restock her inventory with raw materials but she is constrained with adequate funds to make business progress.  Joyce again believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her husband to provide food and finance her children education.  Joyce belongs to a village bank called God will provide. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more slippers and cooking oil, gari and fresh fish.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua.
Maria es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene un puesto en el mercado Las Américas en donde vende ropa variada, su mercadería lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Maria trabaja en un hotel como personal de limpieza.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de buzos, pantalones Jean.
Los sueños de Maria son ampliar su negocio, terminar de construir su casa y tener una bodega.
texts.en:
Maria is a partner of Banco Comunal Corri Ayllu which means “Golden Family” in Quechua language. Maria is married; she is 30 and has two children. She has a stall in the market “Las Americas” where she sells assorted clothing; she buys her merchandise in the city of Lima. In addition, she works in a hotel as a cleaning lady. Maria needs a loan of 800 soles, which she will invest it in buying sweatshirts and jeans. Maria’s ambitions are to grow her business, finish to build her house and have a warehouse.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jeans and sweatshirts.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A. is a 50-year-old woman. She is married and has six children. Two of her children are learning a trade and the rest are in school. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home at Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is an achiever and a resourceful woman. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living.

Akosua has been buying and selling bananas and cassava in Koforidua market for more than ten years now. She treks to surrounding villages near Abofour to purchase bulk stocks of bananas and cassava from the farmers and retails them to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick up enough stock from the farmers to make enough profit to support her family. She wants to use part of the profit to support her children's education.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a bulk supply of bananas and bunches of plantains to enable her to scale up her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her business growth. Akosua belongs to a village bank called ‘Fawohoma Nyame’. She hopes to receive GHS 700 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to help her husband in taking care of the household.

loans.use: To purchase bulk bananas and plantains

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 50 years old. She is a wife and mother of eight kids. Currently all her kids are in school. She lives with her husband and the children at Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her daily source of livelihood.

She has been selling bags of maize, peppers, onions, and tomatoes for eight years to support her family. Maize is one of the favorite cereal foods that supply carbohydrate components in diets. She takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with a direct supply. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and re-sell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy bulk supplies of maize, peppers, onions, and tomatoes to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to keep her kids in school.

Mary believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to help her husband to provide food and finance her children's education. Mary belongs to a village bank called Chance. She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, peppers, onions, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Alma Ileana

texts.es: Alma Ileana O. C. tiene 48 años, está soltera, y tiene dos hijos, los cuales estudian y dependen de ella. Los propósitos de Doña Ileana con su negocio son de invertir en mercadería, y ofrecerles a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, y dio inicio ofreciéndoles: camisas, pantalones y bolsos a personas que poseían un trabajo estable. Durante este tiempo, su negocio ha mejorado gracias a los préstamos realizados. Con el financiamiento podría realizar la compra de más mercadería. Sus sueños son establecer una distribuidora y así proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda. El monto de Doña Alma es de 18.000 córdobas a un plazo de 18 meses.
texts.en:
Alma Ileana O. C. is 48 years old, single, and has two children who are still studying and dependent on her. Ms. Ileana’s intentions with regard to her business are to invest in merchandise and be able to offer customers a variety of products. It has been more than 8 years since she dedicated herself to this business, which she started by offering shirts, pants, and purses to people who enjoyed stable employment. During this time, her business has grown thanks to the loans realized. With this financing, she will be able to buy more merchandise. Her dreams are to establish a distribution company and that way have the ability to make improvements to her home. The amount for Alba is 18,000 córdobas for a term of 18 months.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua N. is 60 years old, widowed, and the mother of eight children. All her children are independent. She decided to learn a trade to earn a living when she was in her mid-thirties. Her husband died some few years ago after a prolonged sickness. Currently she lives at Koforidua in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

She now runs a clothing business and has been selling clothing and slippers over the last eight years. She mostly sells through hawking done door-to-door. She has insufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality and a larger quantity of clothing to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for your assistance

Akua belongs to a village bank called ‘Eye Nyame’ which means "Is God". She hopes to receive GHS 1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and slippers for re-sale

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer La Rinconada Group

texts.es:
Este banco NUEVO AMANECER LA RINCONADA, se fundó el día 05 de febrero de 2009; esta conformado por 10 socias mujeres y 01 socio varon, Este banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, provinvia de Quispicanchis, departamento del Cusco.

Las socias del banco comunal son mujeres trabajadoras y comparten sus actividades domésticas con dicha actividad, ellas viven en zona rural y aquí no existe la banca comercial por lo que valoran y aprecian mucho el crédito otorgado para la compra y venta de nuevos y mayor número de animales menores, para apoyar con este ingeso en su hogar, en la zona rural donde ellas viven nunca antes contaron con algún tipo de ayuda, por lo que no podían desarrollar su pequeños proyectos y no producian, esto generaba retrazo a la zona, ahora ellas tienen la oportunidad de incrementar su economía.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer La Rinconada bank was founded on February 5, 2009 by ten women and a man. The bank is located in the Andahuaylillas district of the Quispicanchis province in the Cusco department in Peru. The communal bank members are working women that share all the work activities. They live in a rural area where there are no commercial banks from which they can obtain credit to buy and sell a greater number of small animals in order to earn money for their households. In the rural area where they live, there has never been this type of help before, and so they have not been able to develop their small businesses. As a result, the area is still underdeveloped, but now they have the opportunity to grow their economy.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell small animals

loans.name: Johana Dominga

texts.es: Johana Dominga C. tiene 29 años, está casada, y tiene una hija de 6 años. Doña Johana inicia este negocio hace más de 9 años, y sus propósitos para su negocio son de ofrecer una variedad de comidas para obtener más afluencia de clientes. Doña Dominga no poseía conocimiento de este negocio pero gracias a su Mama es que logra obtener ingresos. Decide empezar con la venta de gallo pinto y enchiladas, y poco a poco, es que logra que su negocio mejore. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos de granos básicos: arroz, aceite, frijoles ya que es la que la única manera más favorable para realizar las compras de estos productos. Sus sueños son de mejorar su calidad de vida para su familia. El monto solicitado es de C$11.000 a un plazo de 18 meses.
texts.en:
Johana Dominga C. is 29 years old, married, and has one 6-year old daughter. Joahna started this business more than 9 years ago, and her intentions are to offer a variety of foods to attract more customers. Ms. Dominga was not familiar with this type of business but, thanks to her Mom, she has managed to generate an income from it. She decided to start with the sale of gallo pinto (a traditional Nicaraguan dish comprised of fried rice, onion, sweet pepper and beans) and enchiladas. Little by little, she managed to improve business. The financing she is seeking is for working capital to buy basic ingredients such as rice, cooking oil, and beans. Her dream is to improve the standard of living for her family. The amount requested is 11,000 Nicaraguan over a term of 18 months.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Loboko Group

texts.en:
Monique sells beverages, salted and smoked fish, and mushrooms. She has been in business off and on since 1981. She started by selling rolled cotton. Her beginning capital was US$ 7. Her first business prospered but lasted only for six months due to the lack of goods on the market. 

Monique had to change businesses. She started selling rice and soaps at the market, but was severely impacted when the Congolese Franc lost its value in 1981. She lost all of her capital and went to take care of her family until 2003.

Monique launched another business in 2003. She started selling beverages, cakes and waffles until 2007 when she joined one of Hope’s groups called “Loboko” meaning “Hand” in English. Through her sales, Monique makes about US$ 70 per week. Monique plans to use her loan from Hope to diversify her business and sell salted and smoked fish and mushrooms. In order to increase her income, Monique has various points of sale within her community. She dreams one day of putting up a large business building that she can rent out for additional income.  

Monique is 64 years old, married, and a mother of twelve children between the ages of 22 and 46; two of her children are sick and stay with her. The rest of her children are independent. In spite of her age, Monique likes selling because it gives her the opportunity to make contact with many different people, and once they become permanent customers, she is able to offer them quality products at a better price and they keep coming back.

loans.use: To purchase some bags of salted and smoked fish and mushrooms

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Tomasa del Carmen C. F. tiene 51 años, esta soltera, y tiene 12 hijos los todos que trabajan. Hace más de 16 años que Tomasa se dedica a este negocio; aunque no fue fácil por lo que tenia vender sus productos de manera ambulante. Da inicio con  productos como: pantalones, camisas, cosméticos y perfumes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de productos variados para ofrecer a sus clientes. Sus deseos son de establecer su propio negocio en el mercado y proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día. Ella va a pagar la cantidad de C$ 5.000 córdobas a un plazo de 8 meses.
texts.en:
Ms. Tomasa del Carmen C. F. is 51 years old, single, and has 12 children, all of whom currently work. For more than 16 years Tomasa has been in this business; although it wasn't easy because she had to sell products on the streets. She started with pants, shirts, cosmetics and perfumes. The loan is to finance working capital because she needs to offer a variety of products for her customers. Her wishes are to establish her own business in the market and to be able to provide her family with their daily bread. She will pay C$5,000 cordobas over a period of 8 months.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Brenda Irene

texts.es: La señora Brenda es madre de familia de 3 hermosos niños, ella trabaja como ama de llaves de un prestigioso hotel, su esposo trabaja para una empresa realizando las conexiones eléctricas, a Brenda le acaban de entregar su casita pero antes de mudarse desean proporcionarle mas seguridad mediante las protecciones en puertas y ventanas y la construcción de una barda lateral; es por ello que están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brenda is a mother of three beautiful children. She works as a housekeeper at a prestigious hotel. Her husband performs electrical repairs for a business. Brenda just bought her house, but before moving in, she would like to improve its security by building a fence and installing door and window security. That is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of fence, door and window security

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: El señor Arturo R. es albañil independiente, profesión a la que se dedica desde hace 15 años, brindándoles a sus clientes la calidad en su trabajo, su esposa la señora Erika labora como empleada domestica de una residencia, personas cercanas a ellos como son sus familiares, amistades y jefes inmediatos especifican que son personas muy responsables y de mucha confianza, el señor Arturo R. esta solicitando este crédito para la construcción de un segundo cuarto de baño ya que su familia ha ido creciendo y requieren de mas espacio.
texts.en:
Mr. Arturo R. is an independent construction worker, and for 15 years he has given quality work to his clients. His wife, Erika, works as a housekeeper. People close to them, such as their family members, friends and immediate supervisors, specify that they are responsible and trustworthy people. Mr. Arturo R. is requesting a loan for the construction of a second bathroom because his family is growing and needs more space.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bathroom construction

loans.name: Blanca Zorayda

texts.es: La señora Blanca Zoraida es propietaria de una tienda de abarrotes, que se llama “ “Abarrotes N. “ negocio que tiene establecido 3 años, con muy buena clientela ya que tiene una gran variedad de productos, es por ello que están solicitando este crédito para realizar el pago de unos proveedores y seguir invirtiendo en el negocio para tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca Zoraida is the owner of a grocery store called "Child Groceries". She began the business 3 years ago and now has a good customer base and a variety of products. Since she has expanded her product variety, she is requesting a loan to pay her suppliers and continue investing in the business to earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the suppliers of her grocery store

loans.name: Elizabeth Benita

texts.es:
La Sra. Elizabeth D. Z. comenzó con el negocio de la venta de ropa y zapatos a crédito, y con el grupo Sureñas, en el cual se encuentra en su décima séptima secuencia conjuntamente con la Sra. Juana Gomez. 
Posteriormente y a la par de su primera actividad instaló una tienda de venta de material de construcción particularmente de pintura y otros productos relacionados con ese rubro, es así que solicita un crédito para incrementar su capital.
La Sra. Elizabeth vive con sus padres y sus dos hijas pequeñas, porque se separó de su esposo hace más de tres años, ella solventa gastos de educación y otros gastos familiares que comparte con sus padres. Desde el año 2004, continúa siendo nuestra cliente responsable y comprometida con la Institución.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth D. Z. started off with a business selling clothing and shoes on credit, and with the Sureñas group, where she’s in her 17th sequence jointly with Mrs. Juana Gomez. Afterward, and along the lines of her first activity, she opened a shop selling construction materials; primarily paint and related items, and she is asking for a loan to increase her working capital. Mrs. Elizabeth lives with her parents and two young daughters, since she separated from her husband 3 years ago. Her expenses include schooling and other household expenses, which she splits with her parents. She has been a responsible and committed client of our institution since 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint

loans.name: Hectro Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Héctor labora para una reconocida empresa a nivel mundial de refrescos cuenta con varios años de antigüedad, el esta solicitando este crédito para el enjarre interior de su vivienda ya que le quiere proporcionar a su familia un hogar mas cómodo y agradable.
texts.en:
Héctor works for an established, well-known global beverage company. He is requesting a loan to purchase plaster for the interior walls of his house because he wants to provide his family with a more comfortable and pleasant home.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior remodel (plaster for the interior walls)

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El señor Roberto E. trabaja para una empresa en el área de producción desde hace mas de 5 años el junto con su esposa la señora Margarita son una familia estable y muy unida, están solicitando este crédito para la construcción de la losa de concreto de un cuarto.
texts.en:
Robert E. has been working for a company in the production industry for over 5 years. He lives with his wife, Margarita, and they have a close, stable relationship. They are requesting a loan to build concrete flooring in a room.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct concrete flooring in a room

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
El Sr. Simón P. T., ingresó a la Institución por recomendación de su Sra. Madre doña Rosa T. cliente antigua, el se dedica al manejo de un transporte de Radio Taxi, su esposa es Empleada del hogar en la casa de su madrina, ambos se colaboran en los gastos del hogar. Aunque no tienen hijos, los gastos que ocasiona el mantenimiento de su movilidad, hace que ambos trabajen.
Él trabaja con Emprender desde hace tres años, inició sus ciclos con montos pequeños de 200 dólares y así sucesivamente, en algunas ocasiones solicita créditos mayores, tiene un historial bueno, considerándolo un cliente muy responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mr. Simón P. T. joined the institution as a recommendation by his mother, Mrs. Rosa T., a long time client. He operates a Radio Taxi, his wife is a housekeeper in her godmother’s home, and together they split their household expenses. Even though they do not have children, the expense of maintaining his vehicle forces them both to work. He has been working with Emprender for 3 years, where he began his loan cycles with small sums of $200 successively, and on occasion requests larger loans. He has a good payment history, making him a very responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New motor

loans.name: Virginia Inés

texts.es:
La Sra. Virginia Ines B., desD. muy niña era una persona dedicada y con vocación al cuidado D. las plantas, es así que con el tiempo ella ve como una forma D. vivir y trabajar con la venta D. diferentes variedades D. plantas.
Al inicio ella compraba semillas, tierra, abono y hacia el cuidado D. las plantas durante todo el tiempo D. su crecimiento, pero esto le tomaba tiempo e inversión para el cuidado.
Es así como conoce a su esposo el Sr. Lucio G. que se dedicaba a la venta D. plantas especiales llamadas Árboles Enanos o Bonsái, y ambos dedican su tiempo a  vender este tipo D. plantas, ella ya compra las plantas grandes y formadas a precio económico y las revenD. a un precio mayor, y el esposo sigue con su actividad.
Los préstamos que solicita son D. montos bajos, destinando exclusivamente estos fondos a su capital D. trabajo.
Es una cliente puntual y responsable con sus pagos, también hay que destacar la seriedad y responsabilidad que inspiran como personas.
texts.en:
Ever since her youth, Mrs. Virginia Ines B. has been a very dedicated person, with a strong inclination towards plant care. With time, she began to see working with and selling plants as a way to make a living. At first she’d purchase seeds, dirt, and fertilizer and would care for plants during their growth period. However, this took much time and investment. This is how she met her husband, Mr. Lucio G., who sold specialty plants called Bonsai trees. Now they both dedicate their time to selling these plants. She buys the fully-grown and formed plants at a reduced rate and resells them at a higher price, while her husband continues with his activities. The loans she requests are of small sums, and the funds are used specifically for working capital. She is a responsible client, prompt in her payments. We also admire the seriousness and responsibility that they inspire as people.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various plants

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato es socio del Banco Comunal Fe.
Fortunato es casado, tiene 53 años y 5 hijos, Fortunato junto a su esposa se dedican al naturismo, realizan curaciones a través de hierbas, actividad que realizan en su casa. Además Fortunato tiene una peluquería en su casa. Fortunato tiene proyectado comprar un carro para realizar taxi.
Fortunato necesita un préstamo de 3300 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de un carro.
Los sueños de Fortunato son comprar un carro y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Fortunato is a member of Faith Communal Bank. He is 53 years old, married, and has five children. He and his wife practice natural medicine, offering herbal cures in their home. Fortunato also has a hair salon in his home. He plans to buy a car to use as a taxi. Fortunato needs a loan of 3300 soles that will be serve as a partial payment on a car. Fortunato's dreams are to buy a car and improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partial payment for a car

loans.name: Jose Enrique

texts.es:
José es socio del Banco Comunal Fe.
José es soltero, tiene 49 años y 2 hijos, José tiene un taller de carpintería en su casa, realiza diferentes trabajos dependiendo del pedido que hagan sus clientes, actividad que realiza solo.
José necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera.
Los sueños de José son comprar todas las maquinarias necesarias para implementar su taller.
texts.en:
José is a member of Faith Communal Bank. He is 49 years old, single, and has two children. Jose has a carpentry workshop in his home where he does a variety of jobs, depending on what his customers request. He works alone. José needs a loan of 3000 soles to purchase wood. Jose's dream is to buy all the machines necessary to equip his workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Exaltación Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Zonia M. está dedicada a su kiosco, ya que ella vende  variedad de productos, temprano empieza con el desayuno y una variedad de sándwich, al medio día ofrece almuerzo a unos pocos clientes que tiene y por la tarde ofrece té, café, pasteles, y otros.
La Sra. Maruja G., es una cliente que ofrece otra variedad de productos como por ejemplo, empanadas, ensaladas de fruta, sándwich y otros, los cuales ofrece a sus clientes del Puesto policial que esta a media cuadra.
Ambas trabajan en sus kioscos ubicados en la calle 8 de Calacoto sus puestos son lado a lado y ellas tienen una muy buena relación de amistad y compañerismo entre si.
Este grupo trabaja desde Marzo del año 2002 con nuestra institucion y el miembro más antiguo de este grupo es la Sra. Maruja G. quien es fundadora del grupo. La Sra. Zonia M. trabaja en el grupo 3 secuencias mostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zonia M. operates a food stand where she sells various products. Early in the day she begins by selling breakfast and a variety of sandwiches. Midday she offers lunch to a few customers, and in the evening she sells tea, coffee, cakes and other items. Mrs. Maruja G. is another client of ours who offers different products, such as empanadas, fruit salads, sandwiches and other items. She sells these to customers from the police station half a block away. Both operate their food stands on Calle 8 in Calacoto side by side, and have a friendly working relationship. This group has been working with our institution since March 2002, with Mrs. Maruja G. being the founding member and our long time client. Mrs. Zonia M. has been through 3 loan cycles with the group, demonstrating responsibility in her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the purchase of soft drinks, sugar and fruit

loans.name: Mariela Doris

texts.es:
Doris es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Doris es madre soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Doris tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Doris necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, azúcar y aceite.
Los sueños de Doris son aumentar su negocio y tener otra tienda en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of Faith Communal Bank. She is a a 27year-old single mother with one child. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries daily. Doris needs a loan of 1200 soles which she will use to buy milk, sugar, and oil. Doris dreams of growing her business and having another store in the center of the city.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase milk, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es:
Odilia es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Odilia es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Odilia se dedica a la agricultura de papa, además compra y vende papa, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Odilia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa por sacos.
Odilia sueña con mejorar su negocio, sembrar y producir en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Odilia is a member of Faith Communal Bank. She is 21, lives with her partner, and has a child. Odilia is a potato farmer. She also buys and sells potatoes daily. She needs a loan of 1050 soles to purchase sacks of potatoes. Odilia's dream is to improve her business, planting and producing in greater quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Julia es casada, tiene 58 años y 7 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda en su casa que esta ubicado en el barrio de Andamarca, en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, licores, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Julia son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of "Banco Comunal Amauta" (a community bank). Julia is married, 58 years old, and has 7 children. Julia has a store in her house, which is located in the neighborhood of "Andamarca." She sells general groceries, such as vegetables, fruit and liquor. She makes this business a reality with the help of her daughter. Julia needs a loan of 1500 soles (monetary unit of Peru) that she will invest in rice and sugar. Julia's dream is to give a good education to her children and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: José Felipe

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Felipe Guerrero le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior e interior de la casa. 
  Esta solicitando un crédito para poder realizar  su mejora lo más pronto posible, ya que por la humedad que hay en su vivienda su hijo se le enfermo. Planea pagar este préstamo con los ingresos de su trabaja como chofer de una paquetería. (En la foto aparece su esposa la señora Elda Izquierdo ya que el se encontraba en horario de trabajo).
texts.en:
Mr. José Felipe Guerrero's house needs interior and exterior finishing. He is requesting a loan to perform the improvement as soon as possible, since his son became ill due to the humidity in his home. He intends to repay the loan with his income as a package delivery driver. (Pictured is his wife Mrs. Elda Izquierdo since he was at work at the time.)

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior and exterior finishing

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Hermelinda es separada, tiene 42 años y 1 hijo, Hermelinda venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Grau. Además Hermelinda compra tuna D. los productores y luego lo venD. al por mayor.
Hermelinda necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar por sacos.
Los sueños D. Hermelinda son tener casa propia y tener un restaurante en un local estable.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of Banco Comunal Amauta. She is separated, 42 years-old, and has one child. Hermelinda sells food (on foot) in the Grau market; also, she buys prickly pears from local growers and sells them in wholesale. Hermelinda requests a loan of 1500 soles ($475 dollars) to purchase (sacks of) rice and sugar. Hermelinda dreams of owning both her own house and a permanent restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Marisol es soltera, tiene 33 años y 1 hija, Marisol tiene un cafetín en el aeropuerto de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de una persona. Además Marisol implementará un restaurante pollería.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de un horno.
Los sueños de Marisol son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa, mejorar su negocio y tener otra pollería.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of Banco Comunal Amauta. She's single, 33 years-old, and has one daughter. Marisol owns a small cafe in Ayacucho's airport where she works everyday with the help of one other person. Additionally, she is about to open a rotisserie chicken restaurant. She requests a loan of 2000 soles ($625 dollars) to purchase an oven. Marisol dreams of buying land so she can build her house, improving her businesses, and eventually owning another rotisserie chicken restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an oven

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio S. está muy agradecido con todos ustedes por el gran apoyo que recibió en le préstamo anterior. Su negocio a crecido bastante a podido comprar dos puestos mas que están ubicados en el centro de la ciudad. También ha podido darles trabajo a dos personas más. 
  Está solicitando su cooperación para comprar mercancía y acondicionar un puesto que acaba de adquirir. Su deseo es seguir desarrollándose en las  ventas de comida.
texts.en:
Mr. José Antonio S. thanks you for the great support he received from the last loan. His business has grown a lot, and he's been able to buy two more locales in the city's downtown area. He has also been able to provide employment to two more people. He is requesting your cooperation to buy merchandise and to equip a recently-purchased locale. His goal is to continue developing his food sales business.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply merchandise and equip a new locale

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
Giovana es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Giovana es soltera, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Giovana tiene una botica llamada Jhomar, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza hace 3 años, la atención es todos los días. Además vende artículos de regalo.
Giovana necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos y regalos.
Los sueños de Giovana son comprar un terreno y tener otra sucursal.
texts.en:
Giovana is a member of Banco Comunal Amauta. She's single, 38 years-old and has two children. Every day for the past three years, Giovana has run a pharmacy called Jhomar (on a rented premises) where she also sells gift items. She requests a loan of 3000 soles (925 dollars) that she will use to purchase additional medicine and gift items. Giovana dreams of purchasing a plot of land and owning another pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medicine and gift items

loans.name: Alberta

texts.es:
Alberta es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Alberta es soltera, tiene 41 años y 2 hijos, Alberta vende ropa, calzados, sus ventas los realiza en la feria de San Juan y también reparte a amigos y conocidos, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Alberta necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados.
Los sueños de Alberta son construir su casa y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alberta is a member of Banco Comunal Amauta. She's single, 42 years-old, and has two children. Alberta sells clothing and footwear in the San Juan fair, and she also acquires products in Lima that she distributes to friends and acquaintances. Alberta requests a loan of 1500 soles ($475 dollars) to purchase additional footwear for her store. Alberta dreams of building a house and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase footwear for her store

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo R. está muy agradecido con todos ustedes por el gran apoyo que recibió en el préstamo anterior. Su negocio ha crecido bastante ya que es la fuente de ingresos de el y su esposa.  
  Está solicitando su cooperación para este nuevo crédito ya que desea invertirle al negocio mercancía de Carnes y lácteos, ya que sus clientes se lo están solicitando que tenga estos productos. Así tendrá más ingresos a su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Alfredo Rodriguez is really grateful with all of you for the great support you gave him for his previous loan. His business has really grown, as it is his and his wife's source of income. He is asking for your cooperation for this new loan because he wants to invest in the business of meat and diary products, since his customers are asking for these products. This way he will have more revenue for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar Mercancía

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Reyna es soltera, tiene 31 años y 1 hijo, Reyna tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de licores, arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Reyna son que su hijo sea profesional y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the Amauta Communal Bank. Reyna is single, 31 years old, and has one son. She has a store in her house where she sells groceries and drinks every day. Reyna needs a 1500 soles loan which will be invested in the purchase of liquor, rice and sugar. Reyna's dreams are that her son learns a profession and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de licores, arroz y azúcar.

loans.name: Charo Miluzka

texts.es:
Charo es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta.
Charo es soltera y tiene 30 años, estudiante de Obstetricia, Charo vende ropa de niños al por mayor y menor, sus ventas los realiza en la feria de Huanta y también en la ciudad de Ayacucho, además viaja a otras ferias.
Charo necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos.
Los sueños de Charo son realizarse profesionalmente, ampliar su negocio y tener una tienda en la ciudad de Huanta.
texts.en:
Charo is a member of the Amauta Communal Bank. Charo is single, 30 years old, and is studying to become an obstetrician. Charo sells children clothing in bulk and individually. She sells in the Huanta market and also in the city of Ayacucho, and she also travels to other markets. Charo needs a 1000 soles loan which will be used to purchase polo shirts. Charo's dreams are to fulfill her professional goals, to expand her business, and to have a store in the city of Huanta.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of polo shirts

loans.name: Geraneos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Geraneos  inicia su segundo  ciclo con  17 socias.
 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. frutas, pescado, lacteos, panes, cereales, quesos, comida, verduras, leña, abarrotes, brindan servicio D. carpintería.

Como es el caso D. Rufilia que es casada, tiene 53 años y 10 hijos D. los cuales 3 viven con ella, Rufilia viaja a las ferias los días sábados y domingos en donD. venD. abarrotes y D. las ferias compra cereales.

Por otro lado Juana es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Juana los días sábados y domingos venD. comida en su casa, además los días particulares venD. camote horneado en diferentes lugares.

Mientras que Rosa es casada, tiene 57 años y 4 hijos, Rosa se dedica a la compra y venta D. leche, que adquiere en la comunidad D. Alpachaca, sus ventas los realiza ambulatoriamente.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 10,800 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. trigo, haba, maíz, frutas variadas, camote, leche, azúcar, arroz, naranja, manzana, quesos, zanahoria, tomate, cebolla, trigo, cebada, maíz.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, construir su casa con material noble, sus hijos sean profesionales y comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
The Geraneos Bank begins its second cycle with 17 members. The members work in different businesses like selling fruit, fish, diary products, bread, cereal, cheese, food, vegetables, wood, groceries, and they also perform some carpenter work. One case is Rufilia, who is married, 53 years old, and has 10 children, 3 of which live with her. Rufilia travels to the markets every Saturday and Sunday where she sells groceries and buys cereal. Another is Juana; she is 27 years old and lives with her partner and has 2 children. She sells food Saturdays and Sundays from her house, and during weekdays she sells baked sweet potato in different places. Meanwhile Rosa is married, 57 years old and has 4 children. Rosa buys milk from the Alpachaca community and sells it in the streets. The members need different loan amounts of around 300 soles, 600 soles, or 900 soles for a total of 10,800 soles in loans from the Communal Bank. Their loans will be used for the purchase of wheat, beans, corn, various fruits, sweet potato, milk, sugar, rice, oranges, apples, cheese, carrots, tomatoes, onions, and barley. The members’ dreams are to expand their businesses, to build a house with noble material, that their children learn a profession and to purchase land.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de trigo, haba, maíz, frutas variadas, camote, leche, azúcar, arroz, naranja, manzana, quesos, zanahoria, tomate, cebolla, trigo, cebada, maíz.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: SABINO VIVE SÓLO Y TIENE SU PEQUEÑO TALLER EL CUAL ESTA UBICADO E INSTALADO EN SU DOMICILIO.  SU PATRIMONIO ESTA COMPUESTO POR UN  INMUEBLE , UN TERRENO Y LAS MAQUINAS DE SU TALLER, SABINO CONFECCIONA ROPA Y PRINCIPALMENTE POLERAS, EN EL TALLER QUE TIENE INSTALADO EN SU DOMICILIO. POR OTRA PARTE, LOS FINES DE SEMANA PRESTA SUS SERVICIOS COMO PLOMERO A DOMICILIO, ACTIVIDAD A LA QUE SE DEDICA HACE MAS DE 12 AÑOS ATRÁS LA COMPETENCIA ES ALTA, PERO LA ANTIGÜEDAD, EXPERIENCIA Y CALIDAD DE LAS POLERAS CONFECCIONADAS, LE HA PERMITIDO SER MUY CONOCIDO EN LAS DIFERENTES FERIAS, POR LO QUE ACTUALMENTE TIENE MUCHA DEMANDA DE SUS PRENDAS EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA LA COMPRA DE UNA NUEVA MAQUINA DE CONFECCION DENOMINADA "COLLARETA" (CONFECCIONA CUELLOS Y MANGAS) TERCER CREDITO   AL QUE ACCEDE EL CLIENTE, CON BUEN CUMPLIMIENTO EN EL PAGO DE SUS CUOTAS. ACTUALMENTE TIENE OTRO PASIVO EN OTRA ENTIDAD FINANCIERA EL CUAL SE ENCUENTRA TAMBIÉN VIGENTE.
texts.en:
Sabino lives alone and has a small shop located in his home. He owns a building, land and the machines in his shop. Sabino makes clothing, primarily polo shirts, in the shop in his home. In addition, on the weekends he works as a plumber providing service to homes, something he has been doing for more than 12 years. While the competition is high, his longevity in the business, experience and quality of his shifts have enabled him to be well known in the different markets, resulting in great demand for his clothing. The loan will be used to buy a new “Collareta” sewing machine (which makes collars and sleeves). This is his 3rd loan, he has a good payment history. He also has another debit liability with another financial entity which is also current.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Gloria Eufemia

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Gloria Eufemia V. se dedica a su negocio de venta de mariscos los cuales son comercializados en su propio tramo con el propósito de mantener su núcleo familiar ya que requiere de su apoyo.

Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel por medio de un crédito para la compra de los mariscos y por este motivo es que espera que su crédito sea otorgado para de inmediato comprar dichos mariscos para continuar en su negocio en el mercado de Chinandega.
texts.en:
In the Central Market in the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Gloria Eufemia V. works selling seafood with the purpose of maintaining her nuclear family who now require her support. Today she has searched out support from Ceprodel by means of a loan to buy seafood and for this reason she hopes her loan is granted for the immediate purchase of wonderful seafood to continue in her business in the Chinandega market.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seafood

loans.name: Manrique Zamir

texts.es:
