El señor Manrique V. es originario de la ciudad  de Chinandega donde se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de pulpería atendido muy amablemente por él mismo.

Hoy en día con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para llevar a cabo la compra de la mercadería. Es importante destacar que con este crédito logra salir adelante ya que compra los productos para su respectiva venta.
texts.en:
Mr. Manrique V. is from the city of Chinandega where he works very hard as he himself kindly attends to his grocery store. These days, with a lot of effort, his business has been moving forward and for this he has come to Ceprodel to be benefited by a loan to carry out the purchase of merchandise. It is important to emphasize that with this loan he will be able to move forward since he buys products for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Lucrecia Eduviges

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia C. desde hace cuatro años se ha dedicado a su negocio de venta de electrodomésticos en su propia casa de habitación y en ocasiones vendidos ambulantemente en lugares donde ella piensa que puede realizar las ventas.

Se ha dedicado actualmente a su negocio con mucho esfuerzo y ha hecho uso de los crédito brindados por Ceprodel. Hoy en día una vez más ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando la aprobación del crédito para la compra de los electrodomésticos y así continuar mejorando en su negocio.
texts.en:
For four years Mrs. Lucrecia C. has worked at her business selling electrical appliances from her own home and sometimes works as a street vendor in places where she thinks she can make sales. She currently has been working very hard and has made use of the loans granted by Ceprodel. Now she has come once more to Ceprodel hoping for loan approval to buy electrical appliances to continue to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical appliances

loans.name: Nidia Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Nidia G. se dedica con mucho ahínco a su actividad de venta de frutas y verduras en su propio tramo en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se desempeña actualmente.

Es importante destacar que ella es una fiel comerciante que ha logrado salir adelante por su arduo trabajo y su entrega a su negocio. Es por esta razón que hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando la aprobación  de un crédito para la compra de las frutas y verduras para ofrecerlas a sus clientes que diariamente le visitan y así salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nidia G. works very hard selling fruits and vegetables from the stand she occupies in the Central Market in the city of Chinandega. It is important to point out that she is a faithful businesswoman and that she has been able to get ahead through hard work and dedication to her business. It is for this reason that she has come today to Ceprodel hoping for loan approval to buy fruits and vegetables to offer to her customers who visit her daily and then her business will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es: El grupo " Las Estrellas " esta representado por la señora Yerma Paolita e integrada por 15 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes rubros comerciales como a la venta D. ropa, comida, abarrotes, zapatos, cosmeticos, CDs., tarjetas , juguetes, medicamentos, pan y fruta seca . Dentro del ámbito laboral siempre existe la competencia pero ellas están concientes D. las obligaciones que cada una tiene, por lo que luchan día a día para obtener ingresos y para mejorar su calidad D. vida D. sus familias; es por eso que la Fundación Agrocapital les brinda la confianza D. un crédito destinado a la compra D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas para poder incrementar sus ingresos y darles a sus familias una mayor comodidad. La socias tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios y conocen D. la responsabilidad y honestidad que se requiere para formar parte D. un grupo integro y confiable
texts.en:
The "Las Estrellas" [Stars] group is represented by Yerma Paolita and is maD. up of 15 members who are involved in various commercial activities such as the sale of clothing, food, groceries, shoes, cosmetics, CDs, cards, toys, medications, bread and dried fruit. Within the workplace there has always been competition but they are aware of each person's obligations, for which they struggle day by day to gain income and to improve the quality of life of their families; It is for this reason that the Fundación Agrocapital offers them the confidence of a loan intended to purchase merchandise, supplies and tools in order to be able to increase their income and to improve their families' comfort levels. The partners have experience working in supportive groups and know the responsibility and honesty required to be part of an upright and trustworthy group.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Transactions

loans.name: Blanca Adriana

texts.es:
Blanca M. es una dama muy trabajadora cuya labor es la venta de alimentos vendiendo especialmente hot dogs preparados por ella misma y siendo vendidos en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Actualmente se ha destacado por realizar excelentes hot dogs el cual agradan mucho a sus clientes por lo que lo consumen esporádicamente. La razón por la que hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito parpa la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de dichos alimentos. Es por esta razón que espera en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con este crédito y así salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca M. is a hardworking woman whose work is selling food, especially hot dogs that she makes herself. They are sold in the central market of the city of Chinandega.

Actually, she has emphasized she has made excellent hot dogs which her customers like a lot, and because of this they eat them sometimes. The reason she has now come to Ceprodel is to obtain a loan for the purchase of quality material for the elaboration of the aforementioned foods. It's for this reason that she hopes that Ceprodel will provide her with this loan and she will move forward in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy quality material

loans.name: Mayra Damaris

texts.es:
Mayra A. es una dama muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de carne especialmente de cerdo en su propio tramo en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se ha desempeñado desde hace 22 años.

Es importante destacar que actualmente la señora Mayra es una fiel cliente de Ceprodel el cual ha hecho uso de los créditos para la compra de la carne para su comercialización. Hoy en día una vez más espera que su crédito sea otorgado para continuar con su actividad en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mayra A. is a hardworking woman who sells meat, especially pork, in her own space in the central market in the city of Chinandega, where she has been free of debt for 22 years.

It is important to emphasize that Señora Mayra is actually a loyal client of Ceprodel and has used her loans to buy meat for her business. She is hopeful that this time her loan will be granted for the continuation of her activity in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for buying meat

loans.name: Eltan

texts.es: La familia de Eltan esta compuesta por cuatro integrantes: su concubina, sus dos hijos de siete y tres años respectivamente y él.  Eltan se dedica al transporte de pasajeros con su propia moto taxi, en su domicilio cuentan con una tienda de barrio donde venden todo tipo de abarrotes. La competencia para Eltan es media ya que existen muchos con las mismas actividades pero paralelamente la demanda también es muy elevada. El crédito será destinado como capital de trabajo en su negocio de abarrotes. Esta es la cuarta operación de Eltan y en todo el tiempo de la relación somercial demostró ser un excelente cliente.
texts.en:
Eltan's family consists of four members: his partner, his two sons of seven and three years respectively, and him. Eltan works transporting passengers with his own motorcycle taxi. In his home he has a neighborhood store where all kinds of groceries are sold. Eltan's competition is medium, since there exist many others doing the same activities, but at the same time demand is very high. The loan will be used for working capital in his grocery business. This is Eltan's fourth loan and during all the time of his commercial relationship he has proved to be an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
LA FAMILIA DE ANTONIO ESTA CONFORMADA POR SEIS PERSONAS, LA ESPOSA SUS CUATRO HIJOS DE 16, 14,11 Y 7 AÑOS Y ÉL. ANTONIO VIVE JUNTO A SU FAMILIA EN UNA CASA QUE ES PROPIA. ES EMPLEADO FIJO DE LA INDUSTRIA DE ACEITE FINO CON MUCHOS AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA, ADICIONALMENTE CUENTAN CON LOS INGRESOS POR TRANSPORTES DE SU MOTO TAXI. LA COMPETENCIA EN SUS ACTIVIDADES ES MEDIA  YA QUE EN LA ZONA  EXISTEN OTRAS PERSONAS QUE SE DESEMPEÑAN EN EL MISMO RUBRO. EL CREDITO SERA DESTINADO PARA LA COMPRA DE UNA NUEVA MOTO TAXI.       
EL SOLICITANTE ES EXCELENTE CLIENTE DE LA INSTITUCION  ESTA  ES SU CUARTA OPERACION.
texts.en:
Antonio’s family is made up of six people: his wife, his four children ages 16, 14, 11 and 7, and himself. Antonio lives with his family in their own home. He is a full-time employee in the cooking oil industry with many years of experience. His family also depends on the income generated by his motorcycle taxi. There is some competition in the motorcycle taxi business because there are several other people in the area who provide the same service. The loan will be used to purchase a new motorcycle taxi. The applicant is an excellent client of the Kiva field partner. This is his fourth loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Motorcycle Taxi

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: HUMBERTO TIENE 42 AÑOS DE EDAD, EN SU CARNET FIGURA COMO SOLTERO , TIENE UN HIJO, TAMBIÉN TIENE UNA VIVIENDA QUE ES PROPIA UBICADA EN VILLA FATIMA. HUMBERTO TRABAJA EN LA GRANJA MROCHEK COMO PORTERO, ADEMAS TIENE INGRESO POR PELAR POLLO EN LA MISMA GRANJA, LA CODEUDORA TRABAJA COMO EMPLEADA DOMESTICA EN UNA CASA PARTICULAR. HUMBERTO TIENE BASTANTES AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO. LA COMPETENCIA ES BAJA PORQUE SI BIEN EXISTEN OTRAS GRANJAS, TAMBIEN HAY BASTANTE DEMANDA. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA COMPRA DE MOTO PARA TRANSPORTARSE A SU TRABAJO. EN LA CENTRAL DE RIESGO Y INFOCRED NO PRESENTA ASPECTOS NEGATIVOS Y EN AGROCAPITAL HA SIDO EXCELENTE CLIENTE CON MORA CERO.
texts.en:
Humberto is 42 years old, single, and has one son. He also owns a house in the town of Fatima. Humberto works as a caretaker on a farm, Granja Mrochek, and also earns an income plucking chickens at the same farm. The cosigner on this loan works as a domestic servant in a private home. Humberto has many years of experience in his area of work. Competition is low because even though there are many other farms, the demand is quite high for workers. This loan will be used to buy a motorcycle to use as transportation to and from work. He does not have any negative credit history according to the Risk Center and the INFOCRED Bureau. He has been an excellent client of AgroCapital and has never defaulted on a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Motorcycle

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles O. tiene 56 años, está casada, y no tiene hijos. Doña María es costurera y hace más de cuarenta años que tiene de poseer este negocio. Con el fin de obtener ingresos, decidió comercializar sus productos en los mercados. El lugar en donde se ubica su negocio está en su casa de habitación, por lo que sus clientes le realizan los encargos de prendas de vestir. Cuando inició este negocio, dio inicio con una pequeña máquina de coser, elaborando sencillas prendas de vestir como faldas y trajes para dama. Es así como su negocio logró a crecer. El financiamiento que necesita es para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus prendas de vestir. Sus sueños son de tener una fábrica de costura en la que pueda emplear a muchas personas que realmente quieren trabajar. El monto que solicita es de C$ 21.000 córdobas a un plazo de 10 meses.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles O. is 56 years old, married, and does not have children. María is a seamstress, and has had this business for more than forty years. With the goal of generating income, she decided to sell her products at the markets. Her business is located in her own home, where her customers realize their clothing orders. She started out with just one small sewing machine, making simple garments such as skirts and women’s suits. This is how she managed to grow her business. The financing she needs is to buy raw materials for making her clothes. Her dream is to have her own tailor shop, where she could employ a lot of people who truly want to work. The amount she is requesting is 21,000 Nicaraguan, over a term of 10 months.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rosa Masiel

texts.es: Rosa Masiel Meneces G. tiene 25 años, está casada, tiene un hijo. El propósito de su negocio es ampliarlo, ya que la ubicación de su negocio está en el mercado de Chichigalpa. Hace más de nueve años que posee este negocio y da comienzo con la venta de ropa y de cosméticos. Pero más tarde consiguió otro tipo de negocio como es la venta de granos básicos, como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar y frutas. Con los préstamos ha logrado aumentar su negocio, y ahora solicita financiamiento para comprar más productos y de esta forma satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Los sueños de Doña Rosa son que los países desarrollados sigan brindando el apoyo necesario. El monto solicitado es de C$ 3.000 córdobas a un plazo de 8 meses con cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rosa Masiel Meneces G. is 25 years old, she is married and has one son. The purpose of her business is to expand it since her location is at the market of Chichigalpa. She has owned this business for over 9 years and she started it by selling clothing and cosmetics. But later on she started selling basic food items like, rice, oil, beans, sugar and fruits. With the loans she has previously received she has been able to expand her business, and now she needs a loan to buy more products to sell. She will then be able to satisfy her customers even more. Rosa's biggest dream is that people in developed countries will continue giving the necessary help to people in underdeveloped countries. The amount that she is asking is for C $3,000 Cordobas, which she plans to repay over a period of 8 months by making monthly payments.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Qorilazo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal "QORILAZO" se fundó el día 09 de febrero del 2009; este banco alberga a 12 socios, 07 mujeres y 05 varones; con domicilio en el distrito de santiago, en la comnidad de cachona de la provincia del Cusco.

Los miembros de este banco se dedican a las actividades de comercio, en la modalidad de venta de productos agricolas de la época, vendiendo maíz, otros de ellos  estan dedicados a la panadería y a la venta de abarrotes.

Estos socios agradecen el apoyo brindado en estas zonas rurales, ya que no existe intituciones microfinancieras.
texts.en:
The community bank QORILAZO was founded on February 9, 2009. This bank is home to twelve members, seven women and five men, who live in Santiago district, in the region of Cachona , Cusco province. The members of this bank work in commercial activities, such as selling seasonal agricultural products, corn, and groceries. Others work running a bakery. These partners appreciate the support offered in these rural areas, as there are no micro finance institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of grains and seeds

loans.name: Ileana Maria

texts.es:
Ileana María O. M. tiene 48 años, su estado civil es acompañada, y tiene tres hijos 14, 12, y 10 años, respectivamente. La actividad económica de Doña Ileana es la venta y elaboración de repostería, como pasteles, cosas de horno y sopas de leche. Hace siete años que Doña Ileana ha operado este negocio en su propia casa, y lo inició por iniciativa propia por lo que necesitaba generar ingresos para su familia ya que siempre le ha gustado ser una persona responsable desde la edad de 18 años. Doña Ileana decidió ofrecer sus productos en la escuela donde estudiaban sus niños, ya que así le fue más fácil por lo que tenía que dejar a sus hijos a la escuela y al mismo tiempo dejaba sus productos.
Los propósitos de Doña Ileana son de mejorar la calidad de sus productos para que estos sean lo mejor y les agrade a los clientes por lo que esto le dará buena fama. Por esta razón, el financiamiento de Kiva será para capital de trabajo ya que lo necesita para la inversión de materia prima como huevo, harina, y mantequilla levadura, ya que estos productos están muy caros. Después de ganar las ganancias para reembolsar el préstamo, sus sueños son de establecer un negocio de repostería en su casa de habitación y así podría generar más empleos ya que no podría realizar todo el procedimiento solo.
texts.en:
Ileana María O. M. is 48 years old, partnered, and has 3 children ages 14, 12, and 10. Ileana makes and sells pastries, such as cakes, baked goods, and ‘sopas de leche’ (bread soaked in sweet milk and sprinkled with cinnamon). Ileana has been managing her business in her own home for the past 7 years; she began this business by her own initiative given that she needed to generate income for her family and has always been a responsible person since the age of 18. Ileana decided to offer her products in the school where her children were studying, as it was easier for her because she had to drop of her children at school and at the same time dropped of her products. Ileana intends to improve the quality of her products so that they are the best and her clients enjoy them, which will give her a good reputation. For this reason, the Kiva loan will be used as work capital given that she needs it to invest in basic materials such as eggs, flour, butter, and yeast, since these products are very expensive. After earning the profits to pay back the loan, her dream is to establish a pastry business in her home, and in that way she could generate more jobs given that she will not be able to carry out all work on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic pastry making materials such as eggs, flour, butter, and yeast.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Juana del Carmen R. C. tiene 49 años, está soltera, y tiene dos hijos. Sus hijos estudian y tienen 14 y 16 años, individualmente. La actividad económica es mercadería en general como: camisas, bolsos, pantalones, termos y falda, y hace más de doce años que tiene este negocio. La idea de este negocio surge por la necesidad de una fuente de ingresos. Con el paso del tiempo es que ha logrado aumentar en más productos para que su negocio siempre este activo. El financiamiento es lo que necesita para garantizar estabilidad a su negocio, y a fin de que el negocio crezca, Doña Juana espere que pueda ampliar su negocio en otro lugar. El monto solicitado es de C$ 15.000 córdobas a un plazo de 14 meses.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana del Carmen R. C. is a 49-year-old single mother with two children, ages 14 and 16, who are currently in school. Ms. R. sells general merchandise, such as: shirts, handbags, pants, and skirts. She has been in business for over 12 years. She came up with the idea to start this business out of the need for a source of income. With the passing of time, she has been able to increase her inventory so that her business can always remain active. This loan will be used to guarantee business stability, and as the business grows, Ms. R. hopes to be able to expand and move to another place. She is requesting a loan for C$15,000.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 14 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Trinidad Antonio

texts.es: Trinidad Antonio U. S. tiene 66 años, está casado, y tiene un  hijo. Hace más de trece años que Don Trinidad tiene de poseer este negocio, pero anteriormente, laboraba como albañil. Además, debido a la edad es que no pudo seguir laborando en este tipo de oficio. Más tarde, decidió establecer una pulpería en su casa de habitación, y con la ayuda de los préstamos realizados a fundación, Trinidad Antonio ha podido realizar avanzar. Al final, sus deseos son proporcionarle mejoras a su humilde vivienda. El monto que solicita Don Trinidad es de C$ 15.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Trinidad Antonio U. S. is a 66-year-old married father with one son. Mr. Trinidad has been in business for over 13 years. He previously worked as a bricklayer, but was unable to continue with that trade due to his age. He later decided to set up a general store in his house. With the help of loans made to him by the foundation, Trinidad Antonio has been able to get ahead. He now hopes to improve his humble home. Mr. Trinidad is requesting a loan for C$15,000.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.es: Jorge Enrique R. S. tiene 66 años, está casado, y tiene 3 hijos. Todos sus hijos trabajan y tienen 38, 25, y 23 años individualmente. El negocio da inicio con el dinero que ha ganado vendiendo lotería, es por medio de este trabajo que logra establecer una pulpería en su vivienda. Ya que la administración de cada uno de los financiamientos ha sido provechosa para sacar adelante su negocio. Es por eso que solicita el monto de C$ 4.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses. Sus sueños son de ampliar su negocio para que pueda más adelante pueda proporcionarle a su familia lo que ellos necesitan con la ayuda de las diferentes organizaciones.
texts.en:
Jorge Enrique R. S. is a 66-year-old married father of three children. His children are 38, 25, and 23 years old and are all currently employed. He started his business with the money he earned from selling lottery tickets, which is how he was able to set up a general store in his house. Each loan that he has received has been beneficial in helping his business thrive. For this reason, he is requesting a loan for C$ 4,000.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 12 monthly installments. He dreams of expanding his business in the future so that he can provide his family with everything they need with the help of different organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Mrs. Yen K. is a villager in Pram Bey Chhaum village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she owns a small grocery store. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more groceries for her business to earn more profits. Mrs. Yen K. is a 56-year-old widow.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her business to earn more profits.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha V. was born in 1981 and she now lives in Trapaing Pour village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a fish seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Nhan Met, is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock to re-sell later at a better price.

Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sokha V. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice for her husband’s business. She hopes to increase income and to improve her family living. She has two children, one of whom is attending the local school and the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her husband’s business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chanly

texts.en: Mrs. Chanly P. is a villager in Pram Bey Chhaum village in Kampong Chhnang province. She sells kitchen supplies in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more supplies to re-sell, to then earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Kong Phorn, is a teacher in the local school. Aside from this career, he is a farmer who can make a little rice revenue to support the family. Mrs. Chanly P. is a 52-year-old mother of three children. One is a farmer who helps his father, the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy kitchen supplies to earn more profits.

loans.name: Cham Reun's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Cham Reun S. is the group leader of four members who all live in Kroay Wat village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a cow breeder. Since his cow-breeding business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing one more cow for breeding. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Vong Sopha, is a grocer who makes a little income to support the family. Mr. Cham Reun S. is 25 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. 

Two members in this group loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are Kiva partner AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Mrs. Mai Sen Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank, which consists of nine members, is located in Lor village in the Kampong Chhnang province. The members plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Mai S. has been selected by the members to be the village bank president. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery goods to resell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Seth El, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Mai S. is 45 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom has immigrated to Korea to work as a laborer while another helps with the parents' work and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Mrs. Mom Pheng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people living in Trapaing Mortes village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Mom P., the 27-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from the plantation, she sells firewood. She is a widow with a child who is attending the local school. Mrs. Mom P. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to build a house, in order to better her living conditions.

One member in this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are Kiva partner AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add to her savings for building a house

loans.name: Mrs. Lun Phoung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people living in Tropaing Mortes village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Lun P., the 53-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a piece of land for cultivating rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a rice middleman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy more rice to earn income. Mrs. Lun P. is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. 

Two members in this loans group are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy more rice to earn income.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Through a long road divided from the main street live a widow and her family. Mrs. S., 45, lives in a small village in Pursat Province about 192 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She currently makes a living raising pigs in a stall behind her house, and she has operated this business for more than five years.

S. now has four children; all of them are single. To help a little more to feed their family, two of her children are employed: one is a pig raiser and the other one is a motorcycle taxi driver. Since pig-raising is S.'s main way to earn a living, she would like to ask for a loan as capital to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Mrs. Lam Chhun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people living in Toek Hout village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Lam C., the 61-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. In this plantation, she faces two problems because her field is infertile and she does not have enough money to buy fuel to support a pump for watering the field. In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Lam C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and fuel. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living situation. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is a farmer helping on the mother's plantation.

All the members in this loan group are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita B. started her business in 1995 with the capital of only PHP 9000. Everyday she sells various kinds of goods aside from the seaweed farm that she and her husband have been running to support their six children. The cost of school, food, electricity, water, clothes, and other needs are rising. Carmelita is willing to work very hard to increase the family income.

She was a former saleswoman in one of the most famous malls in Tagbilaran Bohol. Later on, when she decided to get married to Delio, her husband, Carmelita stopped working and started her seaweed farm and sari sari store business in their town.

Carmelita is now requesting a CEVI loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more products to sell. She believes that her loan will bring her good profits. She is also interested in looking for some other line of business for additional income. Someday, Carmelita could send all her children to college and help them achieve their individual dreams.

CEVI helps Carmelita with her business. Now, she availed the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage that CEVI offers.

loans.use: To purchase dry goods, vegetables, and other merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mr. Vuthea Chan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of ten members, is located in Lor village in Kampong Chhnang province and they plan to use the loan they obtain for different purposes. Mr. Vuthea C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a motor taxi driver. Aside from this career, he is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating both rice and vegetables. In his cultivating of vegetables, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy watermelon seeds and fertilizer to support the field to make his crop more productive. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan for these purposes. His wife, Mrs. Hoeun Sokny, is employed in a garment factory. Mr. Vuthea C. is 22 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. 

Nine members in this loans group are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy watermelon seeds and fertilizer to support the field to make his crop more productive.

TwenT. three people living in Ou Roung village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Na L., the 50-year-old village bank president, is a palm sugar seller. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more palm sugar to resell to earn income. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan. Her husband, Mr. Sam Lim, is a worker who earns a little salary to support the family. Mrs. Na L. has three children, one of whom sells firewood while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Krok Mom and Mr. So Sopheak who are group guarantees and are also presented with the village bank members in the picture. 

TwenT. members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more palm sugar to resell

loans.name: Gomez

texts.en:
Gomez A. is engaged in selling crabs. He is a 43-year-old father of three children and a fisherman. His own catch is what he sells to provide for all their needs. Every night Gomez goes out fishing, he throws his nets in the sea and hopes to have something to catch. He wants to work hard to send all of his children to college so that when they are older, they will have better lives for their future children. Now, Gomez sells crabs because he can earn more with this kind of endeavor. Aside from the fish he sells, he also markets crabs. 

Gomez is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase crab nets and repair the pump boats. In this way, the boat will be used for fishing, and he can deliver his catch to other places. 

CEVI helps fishermen sustain their livelihoods and businesses. Their being part of CEVI entitles them for easy access to CEVI credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase a crab net and repair the pump boat

loans.name: Mrs. Rin Cheng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of sixteen members, is located in Tang Kley village in Kampong Chhnang province, and they plan to uS. the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Rin C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she can earn a little income. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to add her savings to buy a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Khuon Veu, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Mrs. Rin C. is 38 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. 

Two members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product becauS. it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add her savings to buy a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn more income.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: A resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia, Mrs. S. earns a living by growing different kinds of vegetables for sale at the market. She currently runs her business on her own farmland behind her house which is located in a good place for sales. She is 25 years old and a widow who has given birth to one small daughter. To earn additional income and to grow the business, S. would like to ask for a US$ 100 loan to buy more vegetable seeds and fertilizer to help her in growing vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Saroeurn Chev Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people living in Tang Kley village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Saroeurn C., the 47-year-old village bank president, is a firewood seller. Her husband, Mr. Rol Phat, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Even though they try do work hard, they still earn inadequate income to support their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Saroeurn C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She has five children, two of whO. are employed in a garment factory while two are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

Seven members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mrs. Mirasol B. is 32 years of age, married, and a resident of Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a fisherman. Their business started when her husband worked on big fishing boats and earned a meager income. With the challenges of living as a couple, they have opted to run their business on their own. It's a matter of making a little sacrifice especially in the changes of weather, slow buying or availability of fish. Sometimes, they even get zero catch.

Both of them have to manage their business well and they work together to sell their catch at the nearest market. They wanted to apply for a Php 7,000 loan from Paglaum MPC. They want to improve their business and hopefully build a house of their own. Above all, Mirasol wants to save for their old age. She says thanks to Paglaum MPC for the continued support, not only for herself but for her family.

loans.use: Additional capital for fishing

loans.name: Mrs. Ren Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eight people living in Tang Kley village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. Ren C., the 43-year-old village bank president, is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Noem Noun, is a cow breeder. Since his breeding business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Mrs. Ren C. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow for breeding and she hopes to increase her income after she sells that cow. She has two children, one of whO. transports the firewood to sell while the other is attending the local school. Mr. Sophy C. does not come to take a loan but his wife is, so she is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy one more cow for breeding.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda M. is a 57-year-old fish vendor from Talibon Bohol. Everyday she sells the fish that her husband catches. She has been a fish vendor for four years now. Linda wants to work hard with her business in order to send her two children to school. Aside from the fish that she sells, Linda has a seaweed farm and she delivers the produce to her trusted buyers. She and her husband grow seaweed because they earn much from it.

Linda is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional boats for her business. She believes that her loan will help her catch more fish to sell. Then, Linda and her husband will earn more to support their children.

CEVI helps Linda sustain her fish business. Through credit assistance, trainings, and insurance services, more and more clients can expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional boats for her fish selling business

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Pat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of seventeen members, is located in Hang Chhouk village in Kampong Chhnang province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. Mrs. S. P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. She now faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy water melon seeds and fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan for her purpose. Her husband, Mr. Kam Mom, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. S. P. has two children, one of whom is attending the local school while other is too young to work or study. 

Thirteen members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Buy water melon seeds and fertilizer to increase crop production

loans.name: Meas' Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of three members, all residents of Kok Chork Commune, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Mrs. T. has been selected to be group leader by the group member. T. was born in 1982 and is a married woman who has given birth to two children; both of them are young and are enrolled in the local primary school.

T. currently earns an income by providing the national lottery service to villagers, and she can make around US$ 3 each day. To help provide more food for the family, her husband is working as a local electrician for a company located in Siem Reap Province. To reduce the cost of transportation, T. is asking for a loan to purchase a second-hand motorbike that will be used ride to work and for family needs.

The other two group members are:

S., 58, a domestic wedding decorator who needs a loan to repair her old house ( S. was not available for photographing so her father is in the photo instead);

C., age 27, who earns a living providing a lottery for neighbors. She is requesting a loan to enlarge her investment.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorbike

Nineteen people living in Hong Chhouk village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. S. Un C., the 48- year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns  land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. She is requesting a loan to buy water melon seeds and fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Pol Pich, is a farmer to help his wife’s work. Mrs. S. Un C. has three children, one of whom is employed in garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Mr. S., 38, and his wife Kheoun, 35, live together in a small village in Pursat Province. They have been married for a number of years, and they have four children; all four of them are students. S. presently drives a taxi motorbike for daily income through picking up passengers, whilst his wife is a grocery seller. S. now faces a problem that his old motorbike often is broken so he can't attract as many clients as before. Therefore, he would like to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike to replace his old one. The loan will help them have more income to sustain their family's living expenses adequately.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to use as a taxi

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Leng Suong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of twenty one members is located in Hong Chhouk village in Kampong Chhnang province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained in different purposes. Mrs. Chan L. S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Heng Phoeuk, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and water melon. In their water melon field, they face a problE. because they do not have enough money to buy water melon seed. In order to deal this problE., Mrs. Chan L. S. decided to request for a loan to purchase water melon seeds and she would use the rest of money to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. She is a 40-year-old mother of four children, one of whO. is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. 

Eight members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. loans.name: Mrs. Chheang Chhem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twelve people living in Phum Saeprambei village in Kampong Cham province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Chheang C., the 38- year-old village bank president, is a laborer who has a little salary. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is a laborer while the others are attending the local school. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Chheang C. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding to increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase a breeding cow

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda C. lives in Guindacpan, an island and fishing village in Talibon Bohol. People catch fish for a living and sell their fish to provide for their needs. Merlinda grew up on this island. She also met her husband there and later they raised a family together. She is now 31 years old and has four children. Merlinda and her husband sell fish and plant seaweed to pay for the education of their children who are studying in the mainland. They work hard to support their children and to buy food for the whole family.

Merlinda is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fishing materials like nets and fish bait. She will use the loan also to buy the seedlings for her seaweed farm. Merlinda believes that her loan will bring her good harvests and sales. She has been a member of CEVI for more than a year already.

CEVI helps seaweed farmers like her grow their businesses. Those who joined in the CEVI program were given credit assistance for their farms as well as trainings and insurance coverage to sustain their livelihoods.

loans.use: To buy nets and fish bait for her fish selling business

loans.name: Boeng's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three borrowers, all of whom live in Kok Chork Commune in Siem Reap Province. The group leader, Mrs. S., is 48 years old and has been running her business as a fruit seller at the market for five years. From the business, she can earn an income of approximately US$ 3 per day. She is married and the good mother of six children; four of them are married and live away from home and the other two are students, while her husband is a local rice farmer. S.'s business is going well, because she is skilled at attracting customers to buy her fruit. In order to make her business more successful, S. is asking for a loan to purchase more fruit to sell.

The other two borrowers are:

S., aged 36, makes income by selling porridge from home. She applied for the loan as capital to buy chickens to raise and later on re-sell for a profit.

N., 24, sells groceries and she is requesting a loan to buy grocery inventory for re-sale. (N.'s husband appears in the picture because she was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Ron Veurng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank which consists of seventeen members is located in Andoung Pour village in Kampong Cham province and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Ron V. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Voeung Sa Em, is a policeman. Mrs. Ron V. is requesting a loan to buy piglets and pig food to start breeding pigs. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school and the remaining is too young to work or study. 

Two members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Buy piglets and pig food to start breeding pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase some necessary things for his land

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is already 70 years old; but despite the age, she is still strong and able to do business in the community. Teresita is a seamstress and has become quite popular making good clothes for all her clients. People come to her house for their dress needs especially wedding and party dresses. Teresita has eight children and is already a widow. One thing she is happy about, however, is that all her children were raised with good values and high morals. She forgets when exactly she started her tailoring business. What she remembers is that she was still single when she learned how to tailor clothes. 

Teresita is now requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy accessories for dressmaking. Part of the loan will also be used to repair her sewing machine. In this way, she can run her dress shop more efficiently and have more sales.

CEVI provides their clients with the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance services that they need.

loans.use: To purchase more accessories for dress making and to repair her sewing machine

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora S. has a "sari-sari" store business. "Sari-sari" is a Filipino word meaning variety, and Dioscora sells a variety of goods in their town to provide for their needs. She is 32 years old and has three children. She previously worked as a market trader. Dioscora traded clothes in the flea market and was not happy about it because some of her goods were stolen, others were destroyed.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 from CEVI. Dioscora will use the loan to add to her merchandise, and she believes that this loan will bring her good profits. With the loan, she could attract more buyers because of the diversity of products that she displays.

CEVI helps Dioscora further grow her business. She has access to CEVI's credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage from joining the program.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Man's Group

texts.en: Mrs. P., 30, who is the mother of four teenage children that attend school. She currently sells groceries out of her home, selling items such as cooked ingredients, canned goods, and sweets for kid. She is married to Khon, 33, who makes a living by repairing boats for fishermen. Recently, Mrs. P. has sold all of her groceries from her store and she wants to buy more groceries but she cannot because she doesn't have enough money. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to purchase additional groceries to sell. She thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for sale

loans.name: Maria O.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Maria M. from Mbeya is 25 years old. She is married with 1 child, age of 4.  Maria has been running a crops selling business since 2006. Maria’s business is to purchase crops in whole sale bases from farmers and sell them in town in retail bases.

Maria works at her business between 9 to 12 hours per day, 3 days per week. Maria currently earns about $210 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $600 in order to purchase crops and eggs to resell. In the future, she plans to start new business. Maria thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops and eggs for reselling

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Pili M. is from Mbeya. She is 49 years old and married with seven children ranging from ages 24 to 31. Pili has been running a kuku business since 1997. 

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on Kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. Who or what are 'kuku,' you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space. So sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing, they produce eggs which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (Maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.
 
Pili works at the business for nine hours per day, seven days per week. She currently earns about $250 a month from her business. Pili is now requesting a loan of $375 in order to purchase feeds and to afford treatment expenses for her chickens. In the future, she plans to increase the number of chickens in her project. Pili thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed "non-creditworthy" by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and treatment expenses for her chickens

loans.name: Ahamad Sha

texts.en:
Ahamad sha lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with three children and lives with his family. Ahamad sha has a metal shop which he has owned for more than six years. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months as he needs some machines. Ahamad sha wants to buy these new machines and increase his stock to attract more clients and make a good income.

He is very happy that he has the opportunity to make a good income and help improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase new machines for the metal shop

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Mrs. Evelyn T. a hardworking 45 years old woman is married and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Mis. Occ. She has 7 children, and her husband is a carpenter. She desires to help her husband by opening a small grocery store to support her family’s needs. The store began as a snack vender for her neighbors & friends, but eventually grew into a prosperous business. In order to expand her business, Mrs. T. joined Paglaum Cooperative last July 2004. She was then able to begin and return her 1st loan. From then on, she had returned her loans as early as the 13th cycle. She was able to renovate her house because of the prosperity that Paglaum brought her.  Now, she is applying for a loan in order to buy basic commodities for her grocery store. In the future, she wants to expand her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities  for sari-sari store

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en: Mr. Juanito S., is 51 years old, single and lives at Casusan , Aloran Misamis Occidental. He started with just a small amount of capital, and his small grocery (sari-sari) store business has become a reality. With this venture, he can meet the daily needs of his family. He sells fresh fish in his sari-sari store and his primary customers are his neighbors, relatives and friends. Since he knows about Paglaum Cooperative, Mr. S. joined the organization last 2007 because of the benefits given to members, like savings, dividends & patronage refunds, insurances and credit facilities. He has already availed loans 4 times and was able to pay them all religiously. Presently, he applied to buy merchandise goods for the sale of kilos of fish. He plans to expand his business by selling sacks or even retail of rice.

loans.use: to buy merchandise goods for sale & kilos of fish for sale

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! Sauda N. is 31 years old and from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 3 and 14. Sauda has been running a retail shop business since 2006. Her business is purchasing basic home commodities and reselling them.

She works at the business 9 hours per day, and 6 days per week. Sauda currently earns about $120 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 525 USD in order to purchase items like sugar, soap, rice, and other basic home needs to sell in her shop. In the future, she plans to start a new business as well. Sauda graciously thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase items like sugar, soap,rice, and other home basic needs for reselling in her shop

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa A. is 66 years old. Though she is old, she is still strong and able to manage her own business. She sells fish at their place. Basilisa markets dried fish and fresh fish to augment her income in providing for her needs. She has been in CEVI's credit program for almost two years now. Basilisa keeps good repayment records with CEVI because she wants to avail more of the services that CEVI offers. Her business truly helps her sustain her family and her five children. 

She is requesting another loan of PHP 12,000. Basilisa will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. Since her husband knows how to fish, part of the loan will be used to buy fishing materials like nets and fish bait.

CEVI gives Basilisa credit assistance, trainings, and insurance services.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials and more fish to sell

loans.name: Moshi

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 26 years old Moshi M. from Mbeya. She is married with two children, ages 4 and 10. Moshi has been running a grocery business since 2001. Her business is to purchase soft drinks and drinks like beer and whisky for reselling in her business.

She works at the business for 13 hours per day, 7 days per week, and is assisted by 4 employees. Moshi currently earns about $300 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $675 in order to purchase more drinks for her grocery. In the future, she plans to expand her business by increasing the number and variety of drinks in her business. Moshi thanks you for your support!

The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.
