loans.name: Zaher Mohammad

texts.en:
Zaher M. is the son of M. A. and lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He needs money for his business to increase his inventory.

He requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for the term of 12 months. Zaher  wants buy necessary materials for his business which will increase his inventory and he wants to expand his business.

He is very happy with this process of obtaining a small loan in Afghanistan and wants to thank KIVA lenders around the world.

loans.use: he expand and progress for his business

loans.name: Wema

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 27 year old Wema S. from Mbeya. She is married with two children, who are 2 and 8 respectively. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two orphans.

Wema has been running a retail shop since 2005. Her business consists of buying things wholesale and reselling them retail.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Wema currently earns about 150USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375USD in order to increase various commodities in her business so as to expand her market. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Wema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing various commodities

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. R., 30, lives in a cute village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is married with four children who are all students. She currently sells groceries from her house. Her husband's name is Torng he is 38 years old and earns a living by cultivating rice crop. R.'s investment is running smoothly and she has gained a lot of  profit from her grocery selling. The grocery selling is an important source of income for R.. In order to make the business successful, R. has applied for a loan to purchase a variety of groceries to store and then re-sell.

loans.use: To purchase variety of grocery to store and then re-sell

loans.name: Jama Khan

texts.en:
Jama khan lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan and is married with three children. He owns a general store and is requesting a small loan for his brother’s business because it is a new business. Jama requested an individual loan of 50000 afghani for the term of 12 months and he wants to make his business larger and expand it. Also, he wants to complete his stocks of his business and buy necessary materials for his shop.

 Jama khan is really happy with this process of loans in Afghanistan. He wants to thank all lenders of Kiva and AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.use: he buy necessary materials for his shop

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor A. is just 23 years old and the father of three children. He sells fish in their village to provide for his family. Every night, he goes out to the sea, throws his nets and waits for a catch. His wife, Jessica, helps him market his catch to the people in their village. "As a father, I must provide the needs of my children," he said. "I am working so hard to send them all to school because I want them to have a good future," he added.

Melchor is requesting a CEVI loan of PHP 8,000 to buy new fishing materials. He believes that his loan will bring him more catch and more income. He is also willing to look for some other line of business to augment their income. In this way, Melchor would no longer have to worry where to get the money for his children's education.

CEVI helps him sustain his business and family. Through the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance services that CEVI offers, Melchor can make his business grow.

loans.use: To buy new fishing materials

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 28 years old Frola M. from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 4 and 14.  

Frola has been selling used bedsheets since 2002. Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam. Retailers then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost, and the general appeal of anything western or modern. Some argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress; however, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

Frola works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband.  Frola currently earns about 50USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375USD in order to increase the stock of used bed sheets in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Flora thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing bedsheets in bulk

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: K., 43, lives in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She earns a living selling different kinds of clothes, including lady clothes and man clothes, and has invested since 2005. She is widowed and currently takes care of two children: her second child is working in an organization with a suitable salary and the second child is attending school. K. works hard everyday and is a very responsible mother to her family. K. is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase more clothing to sell. The loan will help her increase extra income to sustain the family's expenses and to make sure her second child receives higher education.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Akhtar Mohammad

texts.en:
Akhtar Mohammad is the son of Wally Ziada and lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He owns a shoe shop in the city and needs a small loan for his business.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 16 months to increase his inventory and expand his business. Akhtar is very happy about this process of getting a small loan in Afghanistan and wants to thank Kiva lenders from around the world.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and expand the business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros N. is a fish vendor. She buys fish from the fishermen and then resells them to the villagers. Milagros is 24 years old and married to Arnelson N.. Their marriage has given them three children and they are all currently undertaking their studies. Aside from selling fish, Milagros is also an "Avon lady," authorized to distribute and sell Avon fashion products. From her earnings, she able to contribute well in the family income.

Milagros is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. She also plans to establish her own stall to display her fish. In this way, she can attract more buyers and earn larger profits.

CEVI provides Milagros the credit assistance that she needs. Aside from that, she receives trainings and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Mrs. Rebecca T., 40 years old, lives in Lumbayao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental with her husband and two children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack & food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viand & snack to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2004. Mrs. Raguda became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she applies for 14,900PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale on her sari-sari store

loans.name: Abia A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 46 year old Abia C. from Mbeya. She is widowed with 5 children, between the ages of 22 and 30. Abia has been running a retail shop and cosmetics business since 2007. She purchases her products wholesale and resells them retail.

She works at the business for 16 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Abia currently earns about 250USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 300USD in order to expand her business by increasing the quantity and variety of items in bulk. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Abia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing quantity of items and varieties of items in bulk

loans.name: Ma. Elna

texts.en:
Ma. Elna Gato is a "calamay" maker. She sells them for PHP 35.00 each in their barrio to have additional income for the family. "Calamay" is a special delicacy in Bohol. Everybody buys this kind of food because of its distinct taste. Coconut meat, sugar, and rice flour are the main ingredients of her "calamay." Due to its popularity, it's easy to market her products. She started her business in 2008 with PHP 4,000 capital. Since then, she has maintained the growth of her business and is doing well.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more ingredients for her calamay business. She believes she has a future in this kind of endeavor. Her loan will also enable her to help her husband support their children. 

CEVI helps "calamay" makers sustain their businesses. By joining in the CEVI credit program, each has the chance to avail CEVI credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage that it offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making "calamay"

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea H., 45, and her husband, Mr. Ra Seng, 48, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1987 and have only one daughter who is in grade nine.

Chea has been a silk weaver for twenty-eight years. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. Besides weaving, she also sells silk fabrics. She buys them from weavers in her village for re-sale in Por Sat province which is far away from her house. She taught her husband to be a silk weaver as well. Chea is requesting her second loan of US$ 300 to purchase silk fabric and scarves for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase silk fabric and scarves for resale.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
S., age 44, lives in a medium-sized traditional wooden house in a rural area of Banteay Meanchey province where she owns a plot of farmland and cultivates rice. She is married and has given birth to four children: one is married and the other three are single. Her husband's name is Em, 49, and he is a local teacher in a primary school.

In the past, S. always hired a cultivating machine from a neighbor to plow her farmland and she currently hopes to own a machine; thus, she would like to request a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a cultivating machine. Owning a machine, she can hire it out to other farmers for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase a cultivating machine to use and rent out

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mr. Phat P., 48, and his wife, Mrs. Somaly Kong, 35, married in 1992 and have three children: two sons who attend school and one daughter who has full-time employment in a plywood factory. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phat and his wife have been growing vegetables for 10 years. Beside farming, they also sell firewood at their house. The couple hopes to expand their firewood business, that's why Phat is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a wood-cutting machine and to buy firewood for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase a wood-cutting machine and to buy firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Phanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Phanny C., 43, and her husband, Mr. Sokny Un, 46, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1986 and have four children: one son who attends school and three daughters. One of their daughters is married and lives outside the family home and two daughters are silk weavers.

Phanny has been a silk weaver for 20 years. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for seven years. Phanny is requesting her first loan of US$ 200 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her weaving business

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mr. Samnang P., 28, lives with his wife and his mother on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. He married in 2007.

Samnang has been a farmer for 15 years. He grows many types of vegetables and other crops in his farmland near his village. His wife is a silk weaver. Beside farming, he also weaves silk at home. It’s a skill he learned from his wife. He sells his finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh.

Samnang is requesting a loan of US$ 150 to purchase silk materials for his weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora S. sells fish and also has a rice field. While waiting for the next harvest, her whole attention is mainly focused on how she will sustain her fish business. She is 59 years old and only has one child. Her husband, Marcelino is a fisherman. Together, they work hard to send their only child to college. Teodora started her business in 2006 using their small sail boat. Now, they are still using the same boat to catch fish for a living. 

Teodora is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy new fishing materials. She will also use the loan in buying fertilizers for her rice field. She believes that her loan will bring her a good harvest in her farm and more catch with her fishing boats. The loan will truly help expand her business.

CEVI helps Teodora sustain her business. Now, she enjoys having easy credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage that CEVI offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials for her fish selling business and fertilizers for her rice field

loans.name: Mrs. Savy Yen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people living in Andoung Pour village in Kampong Cham province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Savy Y., the 39-year-old village bank president, is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more goods to earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Em Chan, is a construction worker. Mrs. Savy Y. has five children, two of whom are employed in garment factory while the others two are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

Two members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase goods to expand grocery business

loans.name: Phu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phú Thị Huyền năm nay 57 tuổi, gia đình chị có 4 con đều đã trưởng thành. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998, hiện tại chị Huyền đang là chủ một cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa. Chồng chị là bác sỹ thú y đã nghỉ hưu, ngoài thời gian làm công việc tiêm thuốc thú y tại nhà anh cũng giúp đỡ chị rất nhiều trong công việc chăn nuôi, buôn bán. Với mức thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua  thêm hàng hóa phục vụ cho  công việc kinh doanh  của gia đình.
texts.en:
Phú Thị Huyền is 57 years old. She has 4 children, all grownup. She is a TYM fund member since 1998. She owns a grocery store. Her husband is a retired veterinary but still runs a pet pharmacy at home. He also helps her out a lot in his free time. Her family income is 2.000.000 VND a month and the living standard has improved. For this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 15.000.000 VND to buy more merchandise for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đỗ Thị Xuân năm nay 52 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai là công nhân tại huyện Kim Động tỉnh Hưng Yên. . Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004, hiện tại chị Xuân  đang chăn nuôi lợn, trồng trọt tại nhà còn chồng chị đi đóng gạch thuê. Đây cũng là những công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Trong thời gian tới chị Xuân dự định mua thêm 100 con lợn thịt về mở rộng chăn nuôi vì thế chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ
texts.en:
Đỗ Thị Xuân is 52 years old. She, her husband and their son live in Kim Động district, Hưng Yên province. She participates in TYM fund since 2004. Currently she raises pigs and cultivates, her husband is a brick layer. These are the sources of her family's income of 2.000.000 VND a month. She is planning to buy 100 piglets to raise for their meat and to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 15.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị hằng năm nay 22 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ tại huyện Kim Động tỉnh Hưng Yên. Năm 2007 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư thêm vào của hàng kinh doanh vật liệu xây dựng của gia đình. Hiện tại công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị đang phát triển thuận lợn và cho thu nhập ổn định. Ngoài nguồn thu nhập từ kinh doanh gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương làm công việc lái xe của chồng  với  tổng thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Hằng mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vốn vào  của hàng kinh doanh nguyên vật liệu xây dựng  của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi H. is 22 years old. She lives with her husband and two small children at Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. In 2007, she joined TYM Fund to borrow loans to invest in her construction material retail business. Her family's business is expanding and her income is stable. In addition to her business, her family also has the additional income of her husband's salary as a driver, totalling at 3,000,000 VND per month. She wishes to borrow 9,000,000 VND to invest in her family's construction material retail business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Cúc năm nay 45 tuổi,  chồng chị không may mất sớm, hiện chị đang sống cùng 3 con  tại huyện Kim Động tỉnh Hưng Yên. Năm 1997 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt.  Hiện tại  ngoài  trồng trọt gia đình chị C. đang chăn nuôi 200 con vịt, đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị Cúc  mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm vịt và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi C. is 45 years old. Her husband passed away early. She lives with three children at Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. In 1997, she joined TYM Fund to borrow loans for raising ducks. Currently, in addition to farming, Mrs. Tran raises 200 ducks, which, at 1,500,000 VND per month, is the main source of income for her family. She would like to borrow 12,000,000 VND to buy more ducks and feeds for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi: Chị Dương Thị Hiệp  năm nay 34 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 2 con còn nhỏ. Năm 2000 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán hoa quả . Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập  chính cho gia đình  chị  là  từ việc đi chở hàng thuê cho các đại lý  của chồng và buôn bán kinh doanh  hoa quả tại chợ gần nhà  của chị Hiệp  với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị Hiệp mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh doanh hoa quả của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Duong Thi H. is 34 years old. She has two small children. In 2000, she joined TYM Fund to borrow funds for investing in a fruit stand. The main source of income for her family, which totals at 2,000,000 VND per month, comes from her husband's salary as a driver delivering goods for local businesses and from her fruit stand. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in her family's fruit stand.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Djamadjigui Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djamadjigui sont tous des femmes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et de 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les sœurs, frères et époux  dans le village de Sirimou sous préfecture de Kenekou relevant de la préfecture de Koulikoro région de Koulikoro république du Mali.
 Par des relations de mariage ces femmes se sont connues et font toutes le commerce de condiments alimentaires (oignon, piment, tomates fraîches,  sel de cuisine, concentrée de tomate etc.).
 Dans le souci d’agrandir leur commerce et avoir assez de stock elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur sixième prêt de groupe et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Les membres du groupe  comptent acheter, 150kg de sel de cuisine, 300kg d’oignon, 14kg de boites de 2kg de  concentrée de tomate  et une grande quantité de condiments divers. 
Elles s’approvisionnent dans le marché de Kenekou auprès de grossistes pour  revendre dans le village de Sirimou et  environnants.
 Ces femmes comptent obtenir un bénéfice de 30 000 FCFA  chacune avec ce prêt qui sera d’utilisé pour augmenter leur fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the group Djamadjigui are all married women who average 26 years of age and two children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families with sisters, brothers, and spouses in the village of Sirimou (Kenekou sub-prefecture belonging to Koulikoro prefecture) in the Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. Through ties of marriage, these women got to know one another, and they do commerce in condiments (onions, chili peppers, fresh tomatoes, salt, tomato paste, etc.)

Concerned with expanding their commerce and with having enough inventory, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their sixth group loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The group members plan to buy: 150 kg of salt, 300 kg of onions, 14 kg of tomato paste (2 kg cans), and a large quantity of various condiments. The goods are gotten at the Kenekou marketplace from wholesalers and are resold in and around the village of Sirimou.

With this loan, the women each intend to obtain a profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to increase their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Liên năm nay 45 tuổi,  chồng chị không may mất sớm, hiện chị đang sống cùng 2 con  tại huyện Kim Động tỉnh Hưng Yên. Năm 1997 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hiện tại đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị. Ngoài nguồn thu nhập từ chăn nuôi hàng tháng  chị  còn có thêm nguồn hỗ trợ từ các con đã trưởng thành nên cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định và được cải thiện hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị Liên  mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm 100 con vịt giống về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi L. is 45 years old. Her husband passed away early. She lives with two children at Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. In 1997, she joined TYM Fund borrow funds for investing in raising pigs. This business is the main source of income for her family. In addition to that, she has financial help from her grown children so her family's life is very stable and is improving. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in buying 100 ducks for raising.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Mrs. Bunthen Em Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank which consists of thirteen members is located in Saeprambei village in Kampong Cham province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Bunthen E. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetables. She currently does not have enough money to grow yams. In order to deal this problE., she decided to request for a loan to cultivate yams. Her husband, Mr. Va Kim Yin, is a laborer. Mrs. Bunthen E. is 35 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: Cultivating yams

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi: Chị Vũ Thị T. năm nay 45 tuổi,  Năm 2000 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán rau. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi  cả hai vợ chồng chị  T. đều đang chăn nuôi bò, đây cũng là  công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị  với thu nhập 1.5000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị T.  mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm bò về nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vu Thi T. is 45 years old. In 2000, she joined TYM Fund to borrow funds for investing in raising pigs and selling vegetables. In addition to raising pigs, Mrs. Vu and her husband also raise cows, which, at the rate of 1,500,000 VND per month, is the main source of income for the two. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to buy more cows.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et de 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les sœurs, frères, enfants, époux et belles mères dans le village de Coni sous préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro république du Mali. Unies par des liens social et professionnel, ces femmes exercent les activités d’achat et de vente des sacs de charbon de bois.
 Dans l’objectif de développer leur activité, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter, 700 sacs de charbon (sac de 100 kg) auprès des paysans producteurs ayant une autorisation dans le village de Coni et environs. Elles effectuent leur vente généralement au comptant en détail et en gros  aux grossistes venant de Fana et d’autres grandes villes. Leur clientèle est composée des hommes aussi bien que des femmes. 
Elles comptent obtenir un bénéfice de 15 000 FCFA  chacune à la fin du cycle. Le bénéfice sera utilisé pour la prise en charge des enfants.
texts.en:
The women of the group Djekafo are all married and average 36 years of age and five children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families with sisters, brothers, children, spouses, and mothers-in-law in the village of Coni (Fana subprefecture) in the Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. United by social and professional ties, they do work involving the buying and selling sacks of charcoal.

With the goal of developing their business, they have become members of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The women plan to buy 700 sacks of charcoal (100 kg each) from rural producers authorized in and around the village of Coni. They make their sales general in cash, retail and wholesale, to wholesalers from Fana and other large cities. Their customers are composed of men as well as women.

They each intend to obtain a profit of 15,000 francs CFA at the end of the cycle. The profits will be used to care for the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền năm nay 45 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 10 năm. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhưng sau đó chị đã đầu tư đi học nghề may Hiện tại chị đang là chủ hiệu may tại nhà còn chồng chị đi làm thợ xây. Với mức thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Hiền đang ngày càng ổn định hơn Vòng vốn tới chị Hiền mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm vải về may quần áo phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 45 years old. She has been with TYM Fund for 10 years. In the beginning, she borrowed funds to invest in livestock raising, but after learning how to sew, she opened her own tailor business. Her husband works as a construction worker. At the income of 2,000,000 VND per month, her family's life standard is becoming more stable and improving. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in more fabric for sewing to meet the needs of her local customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Vân năm nay 49 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Trước khi tham gia quỹ chị Vân buôn bán hoa quả tại nhà,nhưng thu nhập không cao và thường xuyên phải đi xa lấy hàng. Sau khi tham gia quỹ chị được vay thêm vốn và chị đã  đầu tư  mở cửa hàng  buôn bán phân lân. Hiện tại công việc kinh doanh đang phát triển rất tốt mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị hiện nay  với thu nhập 2.5000.000đ/ tháng.
 Vòng vốn tới chị Vân mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh phân bón của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi V. is 49 years old. She has been with TYM Fund since 2003. Before joining the Fund, Mrs. Pham sold produce at home, but her income was not high and she had to travel far for produce to sell. After joining the Fund, she borrowed funds to invest in selling fertilizer. Her business is currently expanding and is bringing her family an income of 25,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to invest in her family's fertilizer business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les femmes du groupe Djiguiya  vivant  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les sœurs, frères, enfants et époux dans le village de Sirimou sous préfecture de Kenekou relevant de la préfecture de Koulikoro (région de Koulikoro république du Mali) ont en moyenne  24 ans et 3 enfants.
 Ces femmes unies par des liens de parenté exercent le commerce de  légumes et des condiments alimentaires.
Dans l’objectif de développer leur activité commerciale elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans problème. 
Les membres du groupe Djiguiya comptent acheter,  400kg de feuilles de baobab séchées (qui est très appréciés dans les sauces africaines), une grande quantité de légumes. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place dans le village Sirimou auprès des maraîchers. Elles revendent sur le marché du dit village et  environs au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
 Elles envisagent obtenir un bénéfice de 12000 FCFA  chacune qui sera utilisé pour la prise en charge des frais de scolarité et santé des enfants.
texts.en:
All married, the women of the group Djiguiya live in traditional extended conjugal families with sisters, brothers, children, and spouses in the village of Sirimou (Kenekou sub-prefecture, part of Koulikoro prefecture) in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. The women average 24 years of age and three children. They are united by family ties and do commerce in vegetables and condiments.

With the goal of developing their business, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The group members plan to buy: 400 kg of dried baobab leaves (which are highly valued for making African sauces) and a large quantity of vegetables. Their goods are gotten locally in the village of Sirimou from market gardeners and are re-sold in the marketplace of the previously mentioned village and surrounding areas, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of essentially women.

They each envision obtaining a profit of 12,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover the schooling and health care costs of the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and condiments

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Liên năm nay 29 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 6 năm. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhưng sau đó chị đã đầu tư đi học nghề may Hiện tại chị đang là chủ hiệu may tại nhà còn chồng chị làm nghề hàn xì. Với mức thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng cuộc sống của gia đình chị Liên đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị Liên mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ  một phần chị sử dụng để đầu tư mua thêm vải về may quần áo phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương, phần còn lại chị đầu tư mua thêm một số dụng cụ phục vụ cho công việc hàn xì của chồng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L. is 29 years old. She has been participated in TYM Fund for 6 years. Initially she borrowed money to invest in raising livestock, but afterward she invested in learning to be a tailor. She currently is a tailor working at home, and her husband is welder. With an income of VND2,000,000 per month, the condition of living of her family has been improved.

In this loan cycle, Mrs. L. would like to borrow VND15,000,000. She will use part of the loan to buy textiles to make clothes to serve the needs of the local community, and the remaining part to buy additional tools for the welding work of her husband.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy textiles to make clothes

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont en majorité  mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 23 ans et de 2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les sœurs, frères, enfant et époux dans le village Sirimou, sous préfecture de Kenekou, préfecture de Koulikoro région de Koulikoro république du Mali. Elles exercent exclusivement la vente de poisson notamment les poissons fumés.
Dans le souci de satisfaire la demande des consommateurs et augmenter leurs stocks, ces femmes ont intégré l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt. Tous les prêts précédents ont été  remboursés normalement. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter, 300kg de poisson fumé et de qualité différentes. Elles s’approvisionnent dans le marché du village de Kenekou village situé au bord du fleuve Niger et effectuent leur vente dans le village de Sirimou et environs en détail au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent obtenir un bénéfice de 13 000 FCFA  chacune à la fin du cycle qui sera utilisé pour aider les époux à subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The seven women of the group Djiguisseme are, for the most part, married and average 23 years of age and two children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families with sisters, brothers, children, and spouses in the village of Sirimou (Kenekou sub-prefecture, Koulikoro prefecture) in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. They work selling fish exclusively, notably smoked fish.

Concerned about satisfying consumer demand and about increasing their inventory, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. These women plan to buy 300 kg of smoked fish of different grades. Supplies are gotten at the marketplace of the village of Kenekou located on the banks of the Niger River. Sales are made retail in and around the village of Sirimou, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men and women.

The group members each intend to obtain a profit of 13,000 francs CFA at the end of the cycle. The funds will be used to help their spouses cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked fish

loans.name: Kelenya Group

texts.fr:
Elles sont toutes des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et de 4 enfants. Les femmes du groupe Kelenya   vivent  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les sœurs, frères, enfants et époux. Elles résident dans le village de Sirimou sous préfecture de Kenekou relevant de la préfecture de Koulikoro région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de voisinage et de commerce. Elles font en majorité le commerce de beurre de karité.
 Pour développer leur activité génératrice de revenu, ces femmes ont intégré le programme crédit de  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter, une tonne de beurre de karité auprès de leurs camarades vendeuses du village pour les vendre au comptant, en détail et à crédit aux grossistes venant de Fana. La clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles espèrent obtenir un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA  chacune à la fin du cycle qui sera utilisé pour l’habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
All these women are married and average 30 years of age and four children. They form the group Kelenya and live in traditional extended conjugal families with sisters, brothers, children, and spouses in the village of Sirimou (Kenekou sub-prefecture, part of Koulikoro prefecture) in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. They know one another by ties of community and commerce, and for the most part they do commerce in karité butter.

To develop their income-generating work, they joined the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The women plan to buy a tonne of karité butter from their fellow retailers in town, so as to sell the butter retail, cash or credit accepted, to wholesalers from Fana. Customers are composed of men and women.

The group members each hope to obtain a profit of 35,000 francs CFA at the end of the cycle. The funds will be used for clothing the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy karité butter

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Twenty-nine years old and married to a watchman, Sunday S. has two children, both attending school. She currently sells beer and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, all delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza D. is a rice grower. She tills and cultivates their small parcel of land, feeling the heat of the sun and touching the wet soil to provide for the needs of her family. Liza is 47 years old and has three children; one is in high school and the other two are still in elementary school. She and her husband work very hard to have quality harvests for the future of their children.

She is requesting a CEVI loan of PHP 12,000. Liza will use the loan to buy four sacks of urea and two sacks of triple 14 fertilizers. The loan will truly help make their farm more fertile. In this way, Liza believes that she will have better harvests, and thus, better sales. 

CEVI provides Liza not only with credit assistance, but also trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for the farm

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Lafia sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelle avec les frères, sœurs, enfants  et époux dans le village Coni sous préfecture de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
Grâce à des liens de mariage et de voisinage ces femmes se sont connues et exercent toutes le commerce de savon de fabrication traditionnelle appelé «  gabacourouni. » 
Dans le souci de développer leur commerce elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe et tous les précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Elles comptent acheter, 1500 morceaux de savons de fabrication locale avec les commerçants grossistes de Fana  pour les revendrent en détail au comptant ou en crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes dans le village de Coni.
Elles espèrent obtenir un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA  chacune, qui sera utilisé pour l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the group Lafia are married women who average 28 years of age and three children. They live in traditional conjugal families with brothers, sisters, children, and spouses in the village of Coni (Fana sub-prefecture, Dioïla prefecture) in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. Thanks to ties of marriage and community, they got to know one another. They all do commerce in soap called "gabacourouni" that is made in the traditional way.

Concerned about developing their commerce, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The women plan to buy 1,500 pieces of locally-made soap from wholesalers from Fana in order to resell them, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men and women in the village of Coni.

The group members each hope to obtain a profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used for educating the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.ru: Нарзулло отец двух дочерей ,возраст 40 лет, жена домохозяйка.Нарзулло работает в колхозе трактористом,его оплата труда не хватает на проживание,поэтому он имеет дополнительный доход с бизнеса скота.Каждые две недели он выезжает на рынок скота и ведёт куплю продажу скота.Он также имеет две коровы которые дают домашнее молоко.Весь их посёлок покупают молоко у его жены.Для увеличения своего бизнеса Нарзулло решил взять кредит.
texts.en:
Narzullo is a 40-year old father of two children. His wife is a homemaker. Narzullo is a tractor driver at a collective farm but his income is not enough to support his family. Therefore Narzullo has a livestock business. Every fortnight he goes to the market where he buys and settles livestock. In addition, he owns two dairy cows, and the whole village buys milk from his family. Narzullo is applying for a loan in order to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
En majorité des femmes mariées, les membres du groupe Sabougnouma ont une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans et de 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies  dans le village de Coni sous préfecture de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla région de Koulikoro république du Mali.  
Elles  sont liées  par des relations commerciales. Elles exercent le commerce de condiments alimentaires.
 Dans l’objectif de développer leur activité génératrice de revenu elles ont intégré le programme crédit de l’institution avec lequel, elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes  comptent acheter, 300kg de sel de cuisine, 200kg d’oignon, 50 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et une grande quantité de condiments divers. Ces produits sont achetés sur le marché du village de Marka-Coungo et revendus dans le marché local de Coni en détail à crédit ou au comptant. La clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Ces femmes comptent obtenir avec ce prêt, 40.000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune, qui sera utilisé dans l’épanouissement de leur activité.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabougnouma are, for the most part, married women who average 27 years of age and four children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families in the village of Coni (Fana sub-prefecture, Dioïla prefecture) in the Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali. The women are linked by commercial ties, and they do commerce in condiments.

With the goal of developing their income-generating business, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their fifth group loan. The preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The women plan to buy: 300 kg of salt, 200 kg of onions, 50 packets (100 count) of Maggi bouillon cubes, and a large quantity of various condiments. The goods are purchased at the marketplace of the village of Marka-Coungo and are resold at the local marketplace of Coni at the retail level, cash or credit accepted. Customers are composed essentially of women.

With this loan, the group members each intend to obtain a profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be put to work, so that their business may thrive.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian R. currently sells bread and tea and is requesting a loan to expand the business. She is 39 years old and divorced with three children, all in school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina K. currently sells juice in the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Thirty-nine years old and married to an electrician, she has two children, both in school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Norboi

texts.ru: Норбой мужчина в возрасте 44 лет , отец пятерых детей, жена работает в колхозе на хлопковом поле.Норбой молодости занимается откормом скота, через 5-6 месяцев когда скота готов к продаже  , т.е. к убою,Норбой выводит на продажу на рынок , а в замен покупает худой молодой скот.Сейчас у него дома 30 баранов.Узнав от друзей о выдаче кредитов на животноводство, он тоже решил обратится к нам.
texts.en:
Norboi is a 44-year-old married man and a father of five. His wife works at the cotton field of a collective farm. Since his youth, Norboi has been raising cattle. He sells the animals after raising them for 5-6 months and purchases younger ones. At present, Norboi has 30 sheep. He learned of this loan opportunity from his friends and decided to apply.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine R. currently sells beer from her home and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Twenty-eight years old and married to a businessman, she has three children, all in school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, 38, lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon. Ali has been working as a car repairer for 15 years. He also paints cars. Ali is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his business. This is his fourth loan, and he has always repaid his loans on time. His previous loans allowed him to improve his financiA. situation. Ali is very professionA. in his work. He started this business because he wanted to improve his family's living condition. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his business

loans.name: Krud

texts.en: S. is a 39-year-old mother of 8 children, all of whom are single. She lives in Siem Reap Province. She owns a small wooden house where she runs a grocery store. She sells groceries such as cookies, candies, and detergents. She started this business 3 years ago. She is married to Rom, who is 39 years old, and who is a wooden house builder. S.'s investment is going well that she has many regular customers who buy her wares. S. is seeking a loan to purchase merchandise to sell as well as some construction materials for her husband's business. The loan will help her to increase her income and manage her family's expenses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and construction materials

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 40, lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ahmad has owned a coffee shop for three years. He sells coffee as well as all kind of hot beverages (for example, tea and Nescafe) and “narguileh” (also known as “shisha” in Egypt). Narguileh is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Narguileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East, and is beginning to gain popularity in the US, Europe, and other countries. Ahmad is requesting a loan of $500 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase supplies for his shop. This is his second loan; he repaid the first loan on time. His previous loan helped him improve his coffee shop. Ahmad's shop is the only coffee shop in his village. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, the 2006 war in Lebanon had started which made him loose his savings. Thanks to A. Majmoua, he was able to restart his business after the war ended.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his shop

loans.name: Saiya

texts.en:
Saiya D. is currently in the business of selling beans and soya beans at the market and is requesting a loan to expand the business.  Saiya is 40 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business.  The profit will be used to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Inom

texts.ru: Ином мужчина 40 лет , отец четверых детей, жена домохозяйка.Сам Ином пастух собственных 40 голов коз.Он пасёт их далеко от своего дома на отдалённом пастбище.Козы целыми днями питаются там разными целебными травами. При помощи купли продажи скота Ином находит прибыль на проживание.Жена занимается продажей козьей шерсти,и пряжи. Ином хочет увеличить численность своих коз.Для чего и хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Inom is 40 years old and the father of four children. His wife is a homemaker. Inom has his own herd of forty goats, which he grazes in a distant pasture far from home. The goats spend their days eating various beneficial grasses. Inom has been able to make enough profit trading in livestock to earn a living. His wife sells the wool and yarn. Inom would like to increase the size of his herd, and would like to take out a loan for that purpose.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33 year old Lucy K. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child, who is 33 years old. Lucy has been running a milling machine business since 2007. Milling machines are used to grind up grains (maize) to get flour. She does this both for her customers and for herself. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Lucy currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more maize. In the future, she plans to buy another milling machine. Lucy thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing maize

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K., currently in the business of selling bread, is requesting a loan to expand her enterprise. Twenty-seven years old and married to a driver, she has two children, both in school. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 58, lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ahmad has owned a restaurant for a few years. He serves Lebanese food. Ahmad is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan. Ahmad's restaurant is well known in his region. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and tourists. In the future, he plans to renovate his restaurant by changing the decor.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en: Houssein, 33, lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Houssein has been working as a car electrician for ten years. He also sells cars batteries and spare parts. Houssein is requesting a loan of $500 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his business. Houssein has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always repaid his loans on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business as well as his family's condition. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Hussein decided on doing this business because he learned the business when he was young.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his business

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam, 45, lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Bassam has been a blacksmith for three years. He is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new tools for his work. This is the first time that Bassam has requested a loan. His clients can be anybody. Bassam decided on this business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his work

loans.name: Amuna

texts.en:
Amuna H., 30 years old and married to a carpenter, has four children, all attending school. Currently in the business of selling bread, she is requesting a loan to expand the enterprise.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa, 53, lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Issa has owned a fish shop for five years. He is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new refrigerator for his store and paint for his car. This is the first time that Issa has requested a loan. His clients can be anybody. Issa started this business because he had a problem with his back. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator for his store and paint for his car

loans.name: Khadidiatou Ibrahima

texts.fr: Khadidiatou Ibrahima M. est mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer son activité de vente de divers produits alimentaires au marché où elle un étal. Elle participe déjà aux charges familiales et compte ainsi améliorer leurs conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Khadidiatou Ibrahima M. is married and the mother of 7 children. With this loan she wishes to bolster her activity. She sells various foodstuffs at the marketplace where she has a stall. She already helps support her family and hopes to improve their quality of life.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of various foodstuffs

loans.name: Kifoyat

texts.en:
Kifoyat has a responsibility that makes her work hard for improvement. She is a mother and a widow, and she wants her daughter, who is under her care, to go to college so that she can have a better future. She has also two independent adult sons. To support herself and her daughter, Kifoyat has worked on farming for the last 20 years. 

Kifoyat is a woman of humble heart and position who works very hard every day in her fields to produce her family’s sustenance, planting and tending her potatoes, tomato and cucumber. Despite the losses Kifoyat and her family have suffered, they persevere, motivated by their desire for a better life, and that is why Kifoyat is asking for a loan to buy seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants to prepare one of her fields for cultivation. Show your solidarity with this noble but backbreaking cause!   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en: Fouad, 49, lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Fouad works as a car repairer. He repairs and sells tires. Fouad is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase oil for his work and new tires. This is the first time that Fouad has requested a loan. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Fouad decided to go into this business because he wanted to be independent and to improve his income. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase oil and new tires

loans.name: Paska

texts.en:
Paska A. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to expand the enterprise. Twenty-eight years old and widowed, she has four children, all in school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth G. has been selling plastic chairs, carpets, and building materials for about two years now at the Nyankumasi Market near Cape Coast. Elizabeth has received a senior high education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a baker. Elizabeth is responsible for financially supporting her husband with the rent, utility bills, and the other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy more plastic chairs, carpets, and building materials. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade items.

loans.use: To buy more plastic chairs, carpets, and building materials to sell

loans.name: Tolib

texts.en:
H. Tolib is 48 years old and lives in Istaravshan town with his wife works as a shopkeeper to help with the living expenses.Tolib has four sons who also help him. For thirty years Tolib has worked his land which produces potato, tomato and cucumber. His greatest dream is to be able to establish more crops to that he can leave equal parts to his children. He started farming as a child, with his parents teaching him. He is requesting financing to  buy supplies for his crops in order to get a good yield and sell more in the market.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Turgunboi

texts.ru: Тургунбой 60-тилетний мужчина, отец 6 детей, жена пенсионерка.Сам Тургунбой работает в энергосбыте своего  Б.Гафуровского района,электриком.Он опытный мастер своего дела, кроме своей работы он также подрабатывает на вызов своих соседей.Из-за проблем со светом всем необходима помощь электрика.Благодаря своей работе он прокармливает свою семью.Кроме этого Тургунбой занимается откормом скота.Для приобретения несколько голов баранов он хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Turgunboi is 60-years-old father of 6 children. His wife is retired. Turgunboi is an electrician. He works for the regional electric company. Turgunboi earns an extra income by servicing his neighbors. The money he makes as an electrician, Turgunboi spends to provide for his family. In addition, he raises cattle. Turgunboi needs this loan to purchase several sheep.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan K. is currently in the business of selling cold drinks such as sodas, milk, and juice, and is requesting a loan to expand her enterprise. Thirty-seven years old and married to a businessman, she has three children, all in school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.en:
Hidoyat devotes herself to the production of vegetables. For this reason she remains as long as possible on her lands, dedicating herself to the care and fertilizations of her fields: with all this effort it is possible to obtain a good harvest and sell the products, with the aim of offering her two children an education and personal development appropriate to their age. 

Hidoyat is thinking of opening a grocery store in her house to increase her family's income. This requires investment, so Hidoyat is asking for your help to purchase a larger quantity of manure and fertilizer. We hope to count on you, and appeal to your collaborative spirit.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna B. est célibataire mais a à sa charge 4 enfants. Elle souhaite poursuivre et fructifier son activité de restauration. Elle vend le repas du petit déjeuner au marché où elle tient un étal. Elle contribue à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Maïmouna B. is unmarried but supports four children. She would like to continue her restaurant business and yield a profit. She sells breakfast meals at the marketplace, where she has a stall. She helps to improve her small family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell breakfast at her eatery at the marketplace

loans.name: Kosim

texts.en:
Born in Istaravshan town in 1970, N. Kosim now lives with his wife and their three children. They are also responsible for caring of his aged mother. A teacher by profession, Kosim is also a farmer. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Kosim would like to expand his crop into a viable source of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of $1000 USD to buy fertilizer. This income will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and educate all his children with higher education. Kosim is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Mahkamboy

texts.en:
S. Mahkamboy is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of cultivated vegetables, which means that he can be around his family, helping to raise their quality of life and educate his three children. Mahkamboy has been characterized as a person who is hard working, since he has been working in agriculture since he was very young. This kind of work requires effort, dedication and above all, strength, as it can include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. In spite of this, Mahkamboy is determined to raise to the level of living in his family, and to improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates. For this reason, he is asking for help in order to be able to receive more credit from IMON International.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Manh

texts.en: L. is 47 years old and currently lives with her four nephews in a rural area of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a single woman and makes a living by catching fish to sell. All four of her nephews assist her in catching fish. The family normally fishes in and around Tunle Sap Lake. In the past, the family hired a boat from a neighbor for fishing. Right now, they hope to buy a boat. That is why L. is requesting a loan.

loans.use: To buy a new fish-boat to use for fishing

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah K. is single and has no children. She has completed an education through the junior high level. Dorah sells used clothing and artificial hair at Amoabin near Cape Coast, which she has done for about two years now. Dorah uses her income to pay the rent, utility bills, and other financial expenses. She will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing and artificial hair to meet the increase in demand from her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dorah plans to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade in used clothing.

In the picture are some of the wigs on the table.

loans.use: To purchase and resell more used clothing and artificial hair

loans.name: Mariétou

texts.fr: La dame Mariétou B. est une veuve avec 7 enfants en charges. Elle va s’adonner au commerce de pommes de terre, d’oignons et de divers produits alimentaires. Elle compte améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille avec les revenus générés par son activité mais aussi faire face à la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariétou B. is a widow with seven children to support. She is going to devote all her time to commerce in potatoes, onions, and various foods items. She intends to improve her family’s living conditions with the revenues generated from her work but also to address her children’s schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling potatoes, onion, etc.

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.en:
Yuldosh is 36 years old and lives with his wife and their three children. He has been familiar with agriculture since he was young. Thanks to his parents he knows how to work the land. Now he supports himself entirely from potato production. He works all day cleaning, irrigating and fertilizing his fields so that his production will be good. He has always liked cleaning his fields because it is important and is lighter work than many of his tasks. Yuldosh wants to improve his family's quality of life; that wish provides the motivation for his arduous work. He will invest the loan in the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants, with the aim to have the best production in his community in a few months.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Nazarkul

texts.en:
For the past 18 years, K. Nazarkul has put much effort into his agricultural activities in the town of Istaravshan in Northern Tajikistan. Despite the difficult economic situation, he has managed to support his family and provide an education for his two children who so desperately need his support. To develop his business, Nazarkul has made use of loans provided by IMON International, which he has used toward technical assistance for his crops. Once again, Nazarkul seeks loan support from IMON International to invest in his crops, later raise his harvest, and survive along with his family. With your help, Nazarkul will be able to get ahead.

In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Ogieva

texts.en: Ogieva O. is 38 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions which she uses to support her family. Her five children are in school and they are doing quite well. Ogieva plans to increase her stocks so as to make more profit to support her family. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva and all its lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Thérèse S. est veuve, mère de quelques enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle compte avec ce prêt poursuivre son activité de vente d’huile de palme. Elle s’approvisionne à Guinée Bissau pour revendre à Soutou. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Thérèse S. is widowed and the mother of a few children whom she supports. With this loan, she would like to develop her business, which consists of selling palm oil. She acquires her supply in Guinea Bissau to resale in Soutou. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire a supply of palm oil in Guinea for resale in Ziguinchor

loans.name: Primkul

texts.en:
K. Primkul has been a farmer for two years. He is married with three children. Through his many sacrifices he is characterized as a great worker who has helped maintain his household. Primkul's family has passed through some very difficult economic times. IMON Interantional has helped him with credits that have allowed him to improve his situation through the purchase of and investment in fertilizer for his crops. Once again Primkul asks for a loan to purchase fertilizers and other products to improve his crops. Your generosity can improve this family’s living.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
