Su deseo es educar adecuadamente a sus hijos y darles lo que a ella sus padres no le pudieron brindar. Beatriz se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con MFP, pero es el primero con su actual banco comunal, ella está dispuesta a pagar sin demora sus cuotas, para no perjudicarse y no meter en problemas a las demás socias. Con el dinero del solicitado planea comprar más lana, para incrementar su mercadería, por eso invertirá todo el préstamo en ello.
texts.en:
Beatriz, aged 29, is a woman very much concerned with the well-being and education of her two young children. She rents a home from her aunt and wants to make improvements to her business. With her young children by her side, Beatriz creates her beautiful handcrafted weavings which she sells to a middleman who later sells them in the Tupac Amaru market (an important marketplace in the city of Juliaca). Beatriz very much enjoys weaving which is why she always makes original weavings even though not all weaving is easy. Because she finds it difficult to always be weaving "chullos" (a typical Andean hat) which are the items which sell best to tourists, she is thinking that it would be best for the future of her business if she were to open her own store where she could sell her weavings herself. Her wish is to give her children a good education and give them what her parents were not in a position to give her. This is Beatriz' second loan with MFP, but it is her first as part of her current community bank. She is prepared to make her repayments on time so that she doesn't hurt her reputation and so as not to create problems for her fellow members. She will use this loan to buy more wool and to increase her stock of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool for weaving

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou G. est une femme mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle veut, avec ce prêt renforcer son commerce. Elle a une cantine au marché et y vend de la vaisselle. Avec cette activité, elle pourrait mieux contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou G. is a married woman and the mother of four children. With this loan, she would like to bolster her business. She has a little shop at the marketplace where she sells dishes. With this activity, she would be able to contribute more to the family's daily expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of dishes

loans.name: Adebayo

texts.en: Adebayo A. is a 40-year-old married man with four children.  To earn a living, he sells motor batteries, but he would like to expand his business.  Therefore, he is now requesting a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) in order to purchase more motor batteries for resale purposes.  He thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional motor batteries

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. is a 40-year-old married woman with three children.  To earn a living, she sells ogi (pap), which is a local food that can be eaten with beans and akara and which is derived from corn.  More specifically, to make ogi, one must soak corn for days, then grind and sieve the saturated corn, and finally prepare the ogi with hot water.  Janet explains that ogi is a popular delicacy in Nigeria and that it is typically eaten during breakfast or dinner.  Janet is now seeking a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more bags of corn in order to prepare more ogi for resale purposes.  She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional bags of corn and by subsequently preparing more ogi (pap)

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou W. est célibataire avec 02 enfants en charge. Elle s’active dans la restauration. Elle souhaiterait avec ce prêt renforcer son activité et augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Fatou W. is unmarried and has two children to support. She is active in the restaurant business. She would like to use this loan to enhance her business and to increase her revenues, so as to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her restaurant business

loans.name: Begilia

texts.es: Begilia es una mujer muy querida y admirada en su barrio, tiene 41 años y vive muy feliz con su esposo Raúl de 45 años y con sus dos hijos, Erika de 10 y Alex de 8 años, en la casa que sus padres le dejaron. Begilia siempre fue muy trabajadora y desde muy pequeña aprendió a tejer artesanalmente, ahora lleva ya 13 años en su negocio, donde trabaja todos los días sin descanso, para mejorar su producción de tejidos a contratado a personas que al igual que ella gustan de tejer y así de esta manera hace crecer su negocio. Begilia disfruta de tejer, pero su pasión es hacerlo artesanalmente, aunque le resulta muy dificultoso realizar los acabados a las prendas que teje, anhela posteriormente tener un local adecuado para realizar sus tejidos, ya que actualmente lo hace en su casa. Es el cuarto préstamo de Begilia en MFP, y se siente en la capacidad de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, es una socia muy alegre en su banco comunal y tiene pensado adquirir otros préstamos posteriormente. Begilia incrementará su mercadería con el dinero solicitado, gastará todo el dinero en comprar más cantidad de lana.
texts.en:
Begilia is a woman who is very loved and admired in her neighborhood. She is 41 years old and lives happily with her husband Raul, who is 45. They have two children, Erika who is 10 and Alex who is 8. They live in the house that her parents left them. Begilia has always been a hard worker and when she was young she learned how to weave handicrafts. Now she has been running her business for 13 years and works every day without rest. In order to increase production she has hired people who enjoy weaving, allowing her grow her business. Begilia enjoys weaving but her passion is to make handicrafts, even though it is very difficult to achieve the same finish as the garments she weaves. She would eventually like to have a proper location to make her textiles, which are currently made in her house. This is Begilia's fourth loan from MFP and she is confident that she will be able to make the payments on time. She is a very happy member of her community bank and has thought about obtaining more loans in the future. Begilia will increase her inventory with the money from the loan by using all of the money to purchase more wool.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool for her textiles

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. is a 25 year old single woman and mother with two children. One is in school and one is a baby.  Abena lives with her family in Abofour.  She sells home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates and she has  recently added the sale of bananas to her stock. She makes her sales by ‘hawking’, which is door to door sales in the community. Abena is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to pay for school fees to give her children a brighter future. Abena is asking for a loan of $450 to increase her stock of plastic materials, kitchen sets and bananas to serve her customers. She believes that with the loan she can save enough to rent a store from which to sell her wares. Abena belongs to a village bank called ‘Chance’.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of plastic materials, kitchen sets and bananas.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis es una joven muy entusiasta y alegre, a sus 23 años, ya tiene un negocio junto a su madre, vive con ella en una casa alquilada y trabaja duro para mejorar su actual situación económica. Son ya 3 años, los que Gladis viene trabajando duramente junto a su madre, vende ropa todos los fines de semana en el mercado dominical, le gusta mucho vender, sobre todo a sus clientes conocidos y es que es muy alegre y divertida y la ropa que vende es de muy buena calidad. Desea que su negocio prospere y que se vuelva más grande, lo que le causa mayor dificultas es conseguir la ropa, puesto que ella adquiere solo lo mejor y es que ya tiene una reputación ganada, la cual le ayuda a vender mucho más. Gladis está en su primer préstamo con MFP, es una de las socias más jóvenes de su banco comunal y por eso recibe todo el apoyo de las demás socias, para que le vaya bien en su negocio. Con este dinero planea comprar más mercadería, la cual le costará aproximadamente, 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gladis is young, enthusiastic, and happy. At 23 years old she already has a business, which she runs with her mother. She lives with her mother in a rented house and works very hard to improve her economic situation. It has been three years since Gladis began working hard with her mother. They sell clothes every weekend at the Sunday market. She really likes selling clothes, especially to her regular clients. She is very happy and fun and the clothes that she sells are good quality. She would like her business to prosper and grow. The most difficult obstacle is purchasing the clothes. She prides herself on buying only the best clothes to sell, which has earned her a good reputation and helped to increase her sales. This is Gladis' first loan with MFP. She is one of the youngest members of her community bank and has the support of the other members, all of whom would like to see her succeed. With the money from the loan she will purchase more merchandise, which will cost approximately 500 nuevos soles ($175 USD).

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Djekafo (Parlons Sur Le Même Ton) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Djekafo (quatre mariées et une veuve) ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier lafiala de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et pour la pratique de la même activité. Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente  d’habits  et de chaussures. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Djekafo a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son quatrième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des balles de pagnes wax, des tissus brodés et une quantité importante de chaussures à Bobo(Burkina Faso), Abidjan(république de la côte d’ivoire) et Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali). Les pagnes  sont vendus en détail, au comptant où à crédit au marché de Koutiala et dans les foires des villages environs. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 170 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
 Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenu telle que l’ouverture d’une boutique de prêt à porter.
texts.en:
The five members of the group Djekafo are composed of four married women and a widow who average 38 years of age and three children. They live in large traditional extended families in the Lafiala district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through community ties and the same work. They have almost the same business of selling clothing and shoes and are in high demand in this field.

In order to satisfy the ever-increasing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their fourth solidarity loan (group loan). All of the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The women plan to use this loan for buying: bales of Wax-brand pagnes (colorful West African cloth of high quality), embroidered fabrics, and a sizable quantity of shoes in Bobo (Burkina Faso), Abidjan (Republic of Cote d'Ivoire), and Bamako (capital of Mali). The pagnes are sold retail, cash or credit accepted, at the Koutiala marketplace and at the fairs of surrounding villages.

The women each hope to realize an average profit of 170,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The funds will be used to pay the loan interest, provide for the needs of the extended family, and to invest the rest in the businesses. Their ambition is to diversify their commerce by embracing other income-generating work, such as opening a shop for ready-to-wear clothing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes for resale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre de 55 años, vive solo en un cuarto alquilado, no tiene hijos, pero compensa esa falta dándoles mucho amor a sus dos pequeños sobrinos, los cuales son una alegría para él. Endulzando la vida de sus clientes con sus ricas golosinas, Juan pasa sus días sentado en una vieja banquita, pues tiene un pequeño puesto en un parque concurrido de la ciudad de Juliaca, a él le gusta bromear con sus clientes, es muy amable y divertido y desea tener una tienda de golosinas donde pueda vender sin miedo a que llegue la lluvia, ya que la temporada de lluvia es la más difícil para Juan, ya que no vende mucho. Son 6 años los que lleva en este negocio y  siente que ya es hora de crecer, Juan siempre saca unos dulces de su puesto, para dárselos a sus tiernos sobrinos, los cuales lo quieren como un padre. Es el primer préstamo al que Juan accede y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con el dinero solicitado pretende comprar más mercadería, invertirá todo en ello, ya que quiere que su negocio progrese.
texts.en:
Juan is a 55 year old man and lives by himself in a rented apartment. He does not have any children of his own but compensates for this absence by giving lots of love to his two young nephews, who are a source of joy for him. He sweetens the lives of his clients with his delicious sweets. Juan spends his days sitting on an old bench at his small stand in a busy park in the city of Juliaca. He enjoys joking with his clients and is very friendly and fun. He would like to have a sweets store where he can sell his sweets without fear of rain. The rainy season is the most difficult time for Juan as his sales are very low during this time. He has had his business for 6 years and feels that it is time to grow. He always takes some sweets from his stand to give to his beloved nephews, who love him like a father. This is the first loan that Juan has applied for and he is confident that he will be able to make the payments on time. He is one of the most active members of his community bank and is well loved and respected. With the money from the loan he will purchase more merchandise to help grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Vision Group

texts.en:
Bosco is 35 years old, married, and has two children between aged 3 weeks and 3 years. He also takes care of his younger brother who is a student. Bosco started his business in 1998 selling salted fish, sugar, milk, and charcoal in the Bandundu province in the DR Congo. His beginning capital was $20. From 1998 to 2002, with the profit generated and good management, Bosco increased his working capital to $150 and extended his business by adding smoked fish. The income generated from his business helped him to finish the first three years of higher education in the Bandundu.

In 2004, Bosco left the village for Kinshasa to finish the last two years of his higher education. He then began selling rings in Kinshasa in 2004 to support his studies. After his wife joined him in Kinshasa in 2005, they restarted selling salted fish, sugar, milk and charcoal which was generating $150 of profit per month. The monthly income generated from his business helped Bosco support his family in Kinshasa until October 2007 when he joined one of Hope’s groups called “Vision”. Bosco has been a faithful Hope client since then and his business has prospered. Bosco’s ambition is to open a pharmacy.

loans.use: To reinforce his working capital

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica K. is a 47 year old woman. She is divorced and the mother of four children. Currently, her eldest daughter is a qualified nurse; one has completed senior high school and is waiting for his test results and the others are in school. Monica lives with her family in Abofour. She is a food vendor who sells rice and stew in the community school where she lives. She started her operation about twenty years ago. Her food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business.

Monica is asking for a loan of $750  to buy more meat, vegetables, bags of rice and firewood to produce in larger quantities which will increase her efficiency . She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support and provide for her family and finance her children's education. Monica belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Nti, which means "Because of God".

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat and firewood etc.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar es un joven de 23 años, vive en un cuarto alquilado con su querida madre, la cual tiene la responsabilidad de cuidar, él quiere mejorar sus ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su mamá. Con la ayuda que le brinda su madre, Edgar culmina sus tejidos artesanales y los lleva a vender a su pequeño puesto en el mercado, para él trasladar la mercadería es lo más difícil, pero sabe que es parte de su trabajo, disfruta mucho de tejer y más si son artesanías, tiene ya 3 años en este negocio y  tiene planeado en el futuro alquilar una tienda más grande y mejor ubicada, donde pueda vender sus artesanías de manera más cómoda y  brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Aunque es muy joven, él es conciente que tiene una responsabilidad con su madre y es por eso que trabaja sin descansó, anhela darle una vida digna y feliz. Edgar se encuentra en su tercer préstamo, nunca ha tenido problemas en sus pagos, pues siempre ahorra para pagarlos a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy querido, pues siempre es muy puntual. Con el préstamo adquirido planea materiales para mejorar sus tejidos, invertirá todo el monto en ello.
texts.en:
Edgar is 23 years old and lives in a rented apartment with his beloved mother, whom he takes care of. He would like to increase his earnings in order to give his mother a better quality of life. With the help of his mother, Edgar makes handmade textiles, which he sells at his small store at the market. The hardest part is transporting the merchandise to the store but he realizes that it is part of the work. He really enjoys weaving, even more so if it is handicraft. He has been working in this business for 3 years and has plans to rent a larger store in a better location, where he will be able to sell his handicrafts in a more comfortable fashion and offer his clients better service. Although he is young, he is mindful of the responsibility to his mother and for this reason he works without rest. He would like to give his mother a life of dignity and happiness. This is Edgar's third loan and he has never had any problems making his payments on time. He is very loved at his community bank and is always punctual. With the loan he will invest all the money in materials to improve his textiles.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for his textiles

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia K. has been trading in the local market of Koforidua a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is a 60 year woman, married and the mother of ten children. Currently four of her children are in school.  
Afia  is a busy trader who sells rice, smoked fish, plantains, peppers, onions and other foodstuffs in the market. She does not have sufficient working capital. With a loan of $450, she wants to purchase more stock to revive her business. Afia  believes that increased profits will enable her to be able to pay for the educational needs of her children. She would be grateful for the loan assistance.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of palm oil, tin tomatoes, dried and smoked fish, onions, beans, maize, etc.

loans.name: Jiguitougou (L’Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Jiguitougou sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 3 enfants .Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier koko de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali).
 Elles se sont  connues  à travers des liens professionnel et de voisinage. Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente  de bois de chauffe et de légume. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité et sont équipées de charrettes. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Jiguitougou a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
 Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de  bois de chauffe auprès des paysans ayant une autorisation dans les villages de Beleso Sirakélé Karaba etc. Quant aux légumes il est acheté avec les grossistes au marché de koutiala. Le bois de chauffe est  vendu à la maison en détail et à bord de charrette de porte en porte. les légumes sont vendus au comptant  au marché de Dar-Salam  koutiala. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 50 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition  avoir la capacité d’acheter des chargements de camion en  bois  de chauffe pour revendre.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Jiguitougou are all married and average 32 years of age and three children. They live in large traditional extended families in the Koko district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through professional and community ties, and they do almost the same work selling firewood and vegetables. The women are in high demand in this business and are equipped with carts.

In order to satisfy the ever-increasing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their first solidarity loan (group loan). They plan to use this loan for buying a large quantity of firewood from rural farmers authorized in the villages of Beleso, Sirakélé, Karabam, etc. As for the vegetables, these are purchased from wholesalers at the Koutiala marketplace. The firewood is sold retail out of the house and off the chart going door-to-door. The vegetables are sold for cash at the Dar-Salam Koutiala marketplace.

The women each hope to realize an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The funds will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in businesses. Their ambition is to have the capacity to buy truck-loads of firewood for resale.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.en:
"Trabajando para el futuro" or "Working for the future" is a large group of 20 hopeful people trying to receive a loan. This group is a great example of the power of micro-credit, and the effects it can have on the poor. This group is all hoping to receive their 6th or 7th loans. All the previous loans have all been paid back in full and on time, and now they hope to receive an even larger loan. This group of 20 hardworking people have all started to realize that they have the ability to change their future, and have all started to experience some success. Receiving a 7th loan is not something that all borrowers end up getting to, and that is in it self a great testament to the character and hard work of this group.

Ynes J. is the group representative, and a perfect example to represent this group. Ynes is a very outgoing, hardworking mother to 3 children. She is an extremely loving mother and has done everything in her power to proviD. her children with everything she never had. Ynes has lived in extreme poverty her whole life, and decided a few years back that she wanted to change her future and the future of her family. She received her first loan from Esperanza International and started a small salon from her house. From there she kept working hard and kept increasing the services and products of her salon, and today she has a very successful business. She can finally afford to pay for all of life's basic necessities, and even some luxuries. She has never been happier than she is now, and feels like she can beat poverty. The best part is that she is a testament to her children that they don't have to accept poverty as part of their lives, and can create a better life. Ynes is very excited about the future and is happy with the changes SHE maD. in her life! She is on the right path, and ready to keep increasing her business.

Thank you for your support of Ynes, and the group.

loans.use: Buy products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama B. is a 39 year old trader who is married with two children. Her children are in school. She is a very resourceful wife and mother whose hard effort brings livelihood to the family. Ama supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing. Selling of used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive. Ama has been in this business for the past 9years. Presently she sells through hawking which means she walks from door to door  through the scorching sun all day to make ends meet. Ama is asking for a loan of $375 to buy more bales of used thing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would allow her to rent a store where she could sell the clothes and  to save for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba es una  mujer soltera, que a sus 34 años lucha por mejorar su futuro, vive en un cuarto alquilado, el cual comparte con su hermana. Ella viaja todos los fines de semana, de Juliaca a la ciudad de Moquegua, lleva sus artesanías para venderlas en la feria dominical, este traslado le es muy difícil y cansado, pero sabe que tiene que realizarlo, para vender sus productos, ella disfruta de ofrecer su preciada mercadería a las personas que pasan por la calle, tiene 12 años en este trabajo y su negocio es muy rentable ya que solo ella vende ollitas, platitos y otros utensilios de barro.
Pero no solo vende en Moquegua, ya que de lunes a viernes, vende en las ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca, Elba es muy trabajadora y desea tener su propia tienda de artesanías, para ello trabaja arduamente y sin descanso. Siendo este el cuarto préstamo al que accede, tiene ya buenos antecedentes en MFP de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y eso lo saben bien los miembros de su banco comunal, es por ese motivo que confían en ella. Elba comprará más implementos para fabricar más artesanías de barro, los cuales costarán alrededor de mil nuevos soles, invertirá todo en incrementar la cantidad de su mercadería
texts.en:
Elba is a single woman who at 34 years of age fights hard to create a better future for herself. She rents a room which she shares with her sister. Every weekend she travels from Juliaca to the city of Moquegua to sell her crafts at the Sunday market. This trip is both very difficult and tiring but she knows she must make it to sell her products; she also enjoys offering her prized merchandise to passers-by. She has been in this business for 12 years: it is very profitable as she is the only one selling pots, plates and other clay kitchen utensils. She does not only sell in Moquegua as from Monday to Friday, she also sells at the markets of Juliaca. Elba is very hard-working and wants to have her own craft store, which is why she works so very hard without rest. This will be her fourth loan; she has a good track record with MFP, having repaid previous loans on time as is well known to her fellow community bank members which is why they have vouched for her. Elba will buy more items to make more clay crafts; she estimates this will cost 1,000 soles. She will invest the entire loan in increasing the amount of goods she has for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her crafts

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 3 enfants  et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier koko de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali).
 Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et exercent presque la même activité  d’achat et de vente  de tasses super et de légumes. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Benkadi a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de  tasses super à Lomé (la capitale de la république du Togo) et quant aux légumes ils sont achetés chez les grossistes au marché de koutiala. Les tasses et les légumes sont vendus en détail, au comptant  au marché de Dar-Salam  koutiala.
 Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 50 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition l’ouverture d’un magasin de vente de tasses.
texts.en:
The women of the group Benkadi are all married and average 33 years of age and three children. They live in large traditional extended families in the Koko district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through community ties and work in almost the same field, buying and selling ‘super’ tubs and vegetables. The women are in high demand in their business.

In order to satisfy their ever-increasing number of customers, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their first solidarity loan (group loan). They plan to use this loan for buying a large quantity of ‘super’ tubs in Lomé (the capital of the Republic of Togo). As for the vegetables, these are purchased from wholesalers at the Koutiala marketplace. The tubs and vegetables are sold retail, for cash, at the Dar-Salam Koutiala market.

They each hope to realize an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. These funds will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in the businesses. Their ambition is to open a store for selling tubs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tubs and vegetables

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban de 34 años, es un padre de familia, muy dedicado, vive con su esposa Silvia de 24 años y sus dos pequeños niños, Rosemary de 4 años y Juan de tan solo 3 meses, en una casa alquilada hecha de adobe, es muy trabajador y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Manejando su motocarro, Esteban mantiene a su familia, sabe que tiene una gran responsabilidad con ellos, puesto que tiene que velar por su tranquilidad. Lleva ya 9 años en este negocio y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios, es muy amable con sus pasajeros, le gusta conversar con ellos, lo cual hace más ameno sus viajes. A él le gustaría tener más mototaxis, para formar una empresa y mejorar sus ingresos, ya que necesita ahorrar dinero para los estudios de sus aun pequeños hijos y es justamente dejarlos por las mañanas, lo más difícil de su trabajo, ya que tiene que madrugar para conseguir más pasajeros, Esteban quiere tener un futuro mejor y darle a su familia la vida que se merecen. Este es el tercer préstamo al que accede Esteban, siempre ha sido puntual en sus pagos, ya que no quiere crearle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual participa activamente y es un socio muy querido. El total del préstamo adquirido en MFP, será invertido por Esteban, en el arreglo de su motocarro, para brindarles a sus pasajeros una mejor atención.
texts.en:
Esteban, 34, is a dedicated father and family man. He lives with his wife Silvia, 24, and their two small children, Rosemary, 4, and Juan, 3 months. They live in a rented house made of adobe. He is a very hard worker and wants to get ahead in life. He drives a motocarro (a three-wheeled motorized vehicle used to transport passengers) to support his family. He knows what a big responsibility he has and prays for his peace for his family. He has been a driver for 9 years and always greets his customers with a smile. He is friendly to his passengers and likes speaking with them as it makes his trips more agreeable. He would like to have more mototaxis to create a company and increase his earnings, since he needs to save money to pay for his children’s studies. The hardest part of his job is leaving his family every morning, since he has to get up very early in order to serve his customers. Esteban wants to have a better future and give his family the life they deserve. This is his third loan and he has always been on time with his payments. He wouldn’t want to create any problems with the community bank that he has been an active part of. All of the loan money from MFP will be used by Esteban to fix up his motocarro in order to give his passengers a better service.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reparing his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba M. is a 54 year old woman. She is married and has four children. Two of her children are learning trades, and the others are in school. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home, in Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 
Abiba has sold fruits and vegetables like bananas, oranges, peas, and maize in the  Koforidua market for more than five years. She treks to surrounding villages in Abofour to purchase bulk stocks of these products from the farmers and then sells retail to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, Abiba is not able to buy enough stock from the farmers to make sufficient profit to support her family. She wants to use part of the profit to support her children's education.
  
With a loan of $500, Abiba wants to purchase bulk supplies of bananas, peas, oranges and plantains to enable her to increase her sales and her income. Abiba belongs to a village bank called ‘DaNyame ASE’ which means give "Thanks to God".

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of bananas, oranges, peas and maize.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P. is a 52 year old woman. She is married and has six children. Three are in school and the rest are traders in the market. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home in  Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Mary has traded in bananas, oranges and plantains in the Koforidua market for more than ten years. She treks to surrounding villages in the central part of Ghana to purchase bulk stocks of bananas, oranges and plantains from the farmers and then sells retail to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, Mary is not able to buy enough stock to make a sufficient profit to support her family. Mary is asking for a loan of $750. With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of bananas, oranges and plantains to enable her to increase her sales. She believes the loan would allow her to save more income which she could use for her children's education. Mary belongs to a village bank called ‘DaNyame ASE’ which means "Give thanks to God".

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of bananas, oranges and plantains.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde es una mujer de 31 años, muy persistente en sus objetivos, vive en un cuarto de manera independiente, el cual alquiló cuando se vino de su querido Huancané (Provincia de Puno). Su actividad principal es el tejido artesanal, ella se gana la vida haciendo chullos (Prenda de vestir para cubrir la cabeza), chompas, guantes, etc, es una tejedora muy ágil y rápida, vende sus artesanías en su propio cuarto, ya que esta ubicado cerca de uno de los mercado más grandes de Juliaca. Ella aprendió a tejer de su madre ya que es la actividad familiar a la que se dedicaban en Huancané. Matilde gusta de tejer, sabe que mientras más lo haga, sus tejidos serán mejores, pero le es muy difícil cortar las figuritas que usa para adornar sus artesanías, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado para no dañarlas, con los 12 años de experiencia en este trabajo, a decidido hacer crecer su negocio y espera para un futuro cercano, tener una tienda más grande, donde pueda vender sus tejidos con mayor comodidad. Es el quinto préstamo de Matilde en MFP, ella siempre ahorra dinero de sus ventas para poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, es una socia muy amable y alegre, que siempre trabaja por el bienestar de su banco comunal. Con este nuevo préstamo, Matilde ha decidido comprar más lana para hacer sus tejidos, lo cual le costara aproximadamente mil soles, con el resto del préstamo hará arreglar sus máquinas de tejer.
texts.en:
Matilde is a 31 year old woman who is very persistant with her goals. She lives independently in a room that she rented when she left her lovely city of Huancané (in the Puno Province). Her main job is as an artisan knitter and she earns her living making wool hats, sweaters, gloves, etc. She is an efficient and precise knitter and she sells her products from her home since it is located near one of the largest markets in the city of Juliaca. She learned to knit from her mother as this is what her family does in Huancané. Matilde likes to knit and knows that her products look better when she adds little figures as decoration. It is hard to cut out the little figurines and she has to be very careful not to damage them. With 12 years of experience, she is now dedicated to growing her business and improving her future. In the near future she would like to have a bigger, more comfortable shop to sell her products. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she always saves the money from her sales in order to make her payments on time. She is an active member of her community bank who is always friendly and happy. With this loan, Matilde will buy more wool for her products, which will cost about 1,000 soles. With the rest of the money she will make repairs to her weaving machines.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool and repair her weaving machines

loans.name: Honronya (La Dignité) Group

texts.fr:
Parmi les quatre femmes du groupe Honronya  trois  sont mariées et une est veuve, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et 2 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier lafiala de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues à  travers des liens   de voisinage et pour la pratique de la même activité à savoir l’activité de fabrication et vente du savon. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité et jouissent d’une réputation sans égale.
 Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Honronya a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son quatrième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des barils  de déchets d’huile et de  la soude caustique. Le savon ainsi fabriqué   est vendu en gros et en détail, au comptant où à crédit au marché de Koutiala et dans les foires des villages environnants.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 200 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier et d’ouvrir d’un atelier moderne de fabrication de savons.
texts.en:
Among the four women of the group Honronya, three are married and one is a widow. They average 26 years of age and two children and live in large traditional extended families in the Lafiala district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know one another through community ties and through work in almost the same business, namely making and selling soap. The women are in high demand in this field of work and enjoy an unparalleled reputation.

In order to satisfy their ever-increasing number of customers, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their fourth solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

They plan to use this loan for buying barrels of waste oil and caustic soda. The soap thus made is then sold wholesale and retail, cash or credit accepted, at the Koutiala marketplace and at the fairs of surrounding villages.

They each hope to realize an average profit of 200,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The funds will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in businesses. Their ambition is to diversify and to open a modern workshop for making soap.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy waste oil and caustic soda

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: A sus 29 años, Rosmery a incursionado en varios negocios, vive en la casa de sus padres, en un cuarto que comparte con su hermana. Siendo todavía joven, Rosmery a puesto en marcha diversos negocios, ahora ella esta trabajando en la venta de tejidos artesanales, tiene recién un año en esta actividad y le esta yendo muy bien, pero tiene muchas dificultades en conseguir los tejidos, ya que tiene que recolectarlos de varias tejedoras. En su pequeño puesto de venta, ella ordena los tejidos artesanales por grupos, es muy ordenada en su negocio y es que se divierte mucho vendiendo  y conversando con sus habituales clientes, desea que en el futuro su puesto prospere y sea muy conocido, para ello trabaja duro y sin descanso. Es el quinto préstamo al que accede Rosmery en MFP, no ha tenido problemas en pagar los anteriores créditos y espera esta ves tampoco tenerlos, en su banco comunal le tienen mucha confianza, ya que es una de las socias más serias y cumplidas. Con dinero solicitado incrementará su mercadería para surtir mejor su puesto, es por eso que invertirá todo el monto del crédito en comprar mas tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
At the age of 29, Rosemary has already been involved in several business ventures. She lives in her parents' house in a room which she shares with her sister. Even though she's young, Rosemary has had several businesses - the current one being the sale of knitted handicrafts. She has been doing this for about a year and things are going well, even though she has some problems obtaining the products to sell because they are made by a number of different people. Her stall in the market is well organized with the different products grouped together. She has a good time selling and talking with her regular clients. She hopes to prosper in this business and become well known. She is a tireless and hard worker. This is the fifth MFP loan to Rosemary. There have been no problems with the previous loans, and she is confident there will be none with this one. She is well regarded by the community bank as one of their most serious and responsible members. This loan will allow her to order more articles to sell, and in a wider variety. The full loan amount will be used to purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth es madre soltera, tiene 32 años y vive con sus dos queridos hijos en un cuarto alquilado, ella trabaja duro, para poder brindarles más comodidades. Ella vende ropa para pagar los estudios de sus 2 menores hijos, se levanta todos los días muy temprano y lleva su mercadería hasta la ciudad de Puno, donde la vende en un puesto que tiene en la feria sabatina, le gusta mucho vender ropa y ganar dinero, con el cual pueda cuidar a sus hijos, anhela poner una tienda grande de ropa, donde pueda vender prendas surtidas y accesibles para sus clientes. Para ella trasladar su mercadería hasta Puno es lo más difícil de su trabajo, ya que siempre lleva gran cantidad y a veces los carros no la quieren recoger, pero ha sabido arreglárselas sola en los 10 años que tiene en este negocio, lo que más quiere es brindarle a sus hijos unos buenos estudios, para que sean grandes profesionales. Es el tercer préstamo que Ruth saca en MFP, no quiere fallar en el pago de sus cuotas, porque sabe que eso le traería problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual ella es una de las socias más antiguas. El dinero solicitado le servirá para comprar más mercadería, invertirá mil soles en ello,  con el resto del dinero arreglara su puesto de venta para que se vea mas elegante.
texts.en:
Ruth A. I. is a single mother, 32 years old, who lives in a rented room with her two dear children. She works very hard to provide a comfortable life for her children. In order to allow her children to attend school, Ruth sells clothing. Every day she gets up quite early in the morning to carry her merchandise to the city of Puno where she has a stall in the Sabatina Market. She very much likes being able to sell the clothing and earn money which allows her to provide a good life for her children. Her dream is to enlarge her business and sell ever more clothing and a wider variety of accessories for her clients. One of the most difficult parts of her business in the transporting her merchandise - often quite substantial - back and forth to Puno. Many time the local buses won't stop for her because of her load of merchandise. But she has been able to work it out during the ten years she has had her business, and this helps her achieve her goal of getting a good education for her children so they can become professionals. This will be Ruth's third loan from MFP, and doesn't want to miss any payments, knowing that doing so would create a problem for her with this community bank. She is one of their earliest members. The money from this loan will be used in part to buy more merchandise (1,000 Soles) and the rest used to improve the appearance of her sales location.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Julia De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Julia O. se ha dedicado a su actividad de venta de frutas  y verduras las que son comercializadas por ella misma en su propio tramo que ha logrado surtir mucho en el mercado.

Diariamente ella es visitada por varios clientes que le visitan con el propósito de obtener las frutas y verduras para su uso. Es importante destacar que hoy en día la señora Julia ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de estos perecederos. Es por este motivo que espera confiadamente que su crédito sea otorgado y así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia O. has a stand in the central market of Chinandega, Nicaragua where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has done well with this venture. She is visited daily by clients who look to her for the fruits and vegetables they need. She has made a request to the local Nicaraguan agency Ceprodel for a loan to be used for the purchase of the perishable items she sells. She is hopeful that the loan will be made available to her so she can continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es:
Sandra G. es una dama muy esforzada cuya labor es la actividad de pulpería que posee en el mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se dedica a atender vendiendo todo tipo de productos desde comestibles, personales hasta productos del hogar.

Es importante destacar que hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de los productos y por este motivo es que espera que su crédito le sea otorgado para continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Sandra Gomez is a strong woman who works in the general store she owns. Her store is in the main market of the city of Chinandega. She is dedicated to serving her clients and offers all kinds of products, from food and personal items to products for the home. It is important to note that she is seeking financial help from Ceprodel in order to purchase more products for her store. She hopes she will be awarded this loan in order to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy products for her store

loans.name: Digna Mercedes

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Digna Mercedes se dedica a su ardua actividad de sastrería y costurería el cual atiende en su propio local donde a diario es visitada por los clientes que solicitan de su trabajo.

Es importante destacar que actualmente ella ha logrado desarrollar su actividad a raíz de sus esfuerzos y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel y hoy en día ha solicitado un nuevo crédito  esperando que sea otorgado para la compra de materiales de trabajo como hilos, tijera, botones, entre otros y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the main market in Chinandega, Mrs. Digna Mercedes works in the hard job of tailoring and clothes-making. She receives customers at her own place in the market, where she is visited each day by her clients. It is important to note that she has been able to develop her business through her efforts. She has approached Ceprodel for a loan that she hopes will be awarded to her. With the loan she will buy thread, scissors, buttons and other materials. In this way she will be able to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase thread, scissors, buttons and other materials

loans.name: Margarita Verónica

texts.es:
Margarita es una dama originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega donde se dedica a su ardua labor de venta de electrodomésticos los cuales son comercializados en su propio tramo. 

Actualmente ella ha buscado la manera de como ampliar su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería y así continuar comercializando sus productos. Es por esto que ella espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y de esta forma saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Margarita is a lady who comes from the city of Chinandega where she works hard selling household appliances which she sells from her home. She is now looking into how to expand her business and for this has approached Ceprodel for a loan to buy merchandise and thus continue selling her goods. Because of this she is very confidently optimistic that her loan request will be granted and in this manner she will continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Adisa

texts.en:
Adisa S. is 41-year-old trader, married with six children--five are in the community school and the last-born is in school. She lives in her husband's family house with the children at Koforidua, which is a farming community in the Ashanti region. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and she is very serious with her business. She trades in cereals, like maize, and bananas. She started this business three years ago from Offinso but realized that business was slow. She then relocated to the next town, Abofour, and has remained in this business since then. Through this, Adisa has been very resourceful for her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize and bananas to serve her customers throughout the season. Especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country, she believes with the loan she can buy more bags of maize grains and bunches of bananas from the farmers, avoiding middlemen who sell to her at a high price.

Adisa belongs to a village bank called ‘Nhyira’, which means Blessing. She hopes to receive GH500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy larger supply of maize and bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Néné

texts.fr: Néné M. est une femme de 55 ans mariée, mère de 6 enfants. Elle souhaiterait s’adonner au maraîchage, activité qu’elle pratique depuis quelques années déjà et qui lui réussit bien. Elle vend elle-même ses produits, patate pour la plupart du temps. Elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille avec les revenus générés.
texts.en:
Néné M. is a 55 year-old woman who is married and has 6 children. She hopes to devote herself to market gardening, a business she has already engaged in for several years and which has served her well. She sells her products, for the most part potatoes, herself. She intends to improve her family's living conditions with the income generated from this business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To devote herself to market gardening and to sell her products herself

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr: Maïmouna D. est une femme de 53 ans, mariée avec 15 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle veut avec ce prêt poursuivre son activité de vente en détail de miel, huile de palme, jus de citron et poisson séché. Elle pourra ainsi subvenir aux nombreuses dépenses familiales dont elle fait face quotidiennement.
texts.en:
Maïmouna D. is a 53 year-old woman who is married with 15 children in her care. With this loan, she would like to pursue her business retailing honey, palm oil, lemon juice, and dried fish. In this way, she will be able to meet the numerous family expenses she faces everyday.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell honey, palm oil, lemon juice, and dried fish

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D. est une femme mariée, mère de 2 enfants. Elle participe grandement aux dépenses familiales et s’active au commerce d’huile de palme, de miel et de jus de citron pour y faire face. elle tient un étal au marché. Elle aimerait avec ses revenus assurer ses charges familiales.
texts.en:
Awa D. is a married woman and mother of 2 children. She is involved in a major way in her family's expenses, and engages in selling palm oil, honey, and lemon juice in order to meet these needs. She has a stall in the market. With her income, she would like to secure her family's financial needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell honey, lemon juice, and palm oil

loans.name: Aïssatou Mamadou

texts.fr: Aïssatou Mamadou B.  est mariée, mère de 3 enfants. Elle va avec ce prêt renforcer son activité de maraîchage. Elle vend elle-même ses produits. Les revenus qu’elle aura lui permettront d’assurer à sa famille la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
Aïssatou Mamadou B. is married and has 3 children. With this loan, she will strengthen her market gardening business. She sells her products herself. The income she will earn will allow her to provide for the feeding and health of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To engage in market gardening and sell her own products herself

loans.name: Mariama Siré

texts.fr: Mariama Siré D. est une femme de 66dans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont un scolarisé. Elle fait un petit commerce en détail de pâte d’arachide, de tomate et d’oignon. Elle compte ainsi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille en santé, nourriture et habillement.
texts.en:
Mariama Siré D., a 66 year-old woman, is married and has 8 children, one of whom is in school. She runs a small business retailing peanut butter, tomatoes, and onions. In this way, she intends to meet her family's health, food, and clothing needs

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell peanut butter, onions, and tomatoes

loans.name: Ternura Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Ternura  inicia su tercer ciclo con  15 socias, las socias menciona que les gusta las capacitaciones que reciben con respecto a la familia y como administrar su negocio.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, papa, carnes, medicina natural, pan, ropa, cereales, también realiza tejidos en telar y tejido chompas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles,  haciendo un total D. 8,450 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, papa, aceite, lanas, tintes, trigo, cebada, chompas, polos, pantalones

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Community Bank Ternura started their new cycle with 15 members, the members mentioned are liked for the family training that they received and for managing their business.

The members run different businesses that sell general groceries, such as potatoes, meat, natural medicine, bread, clothes and grain. They also make textiles in a loom and sweaters.

The members need different loan amounts: 300, 450 and 600 soles (Peruvian monetary unit), making a total of 8,450 soles of loans form the community bank.

Their loans will be used to buy rice, sugar, potatoes, oil, wool, dyes, wheat, barley, sweaters, polo shirts and pants.

Their dreams are to improve their businesses, build their homes and for their children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar, papa, aceite, lanas, tintes, trigo, cebada, chompas, polos, pantalones

loans.name: Edelisa

texts.es:
Edeliza es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Edeliza es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijos, Edeliza se dedica a la fabricación de ataúdes, actividad que realiza en su casa, es un negocio familiar, Edeliza se encarga de dar los acabados, sus ventas son en mayor parte a provincias.
Edeliza necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tiner y pinturas.
Los sueños de Edeliza son tener una fabrica grande y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Edeliza is a member of the “Morenita” Communal Bank. Edeliza is married, is 30 years old, and has 1 child. Edeliza makes coffins in her home. This is a family business and Edeliza is in charge of the doing the finishing. Her sales are primarily in the province. Edeliza needs a loan for 900 soles to invest in buying stain and paint. Edeliza dreams of having a large factory and for her children to become professional.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stain and paint

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
el grupo Luchadoras lo conforman tres mujeres que residen en la colonia 28 de marzo y se conocen desde hace varios años, Victoria Zenobia F. de 39 años de edad se dedica a la venta de nacatamales, cosmeticos, panes y tortillas, Lorena A. de 20 años de edad es la mas joven del grupo pero ella tiene un sentimiendo emprendedor heredado de su familia y se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y sandalias.
Maria O. de 34 años de edad tiene como fuente principal de ingresos la venta de tortillas, tambien vende ropa y cosmeticos, las tres integrantes son vecinas y se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que se respaldan entre ellas, todas son madres de familia, resposables que luchan por sacar adelante a sus hijos, ellas en este momento necesitan un credito para poder sacar adelante sus negocios y asi mismo poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Luchadoras" group is made up of three women who live in the 28 de marzo neighbourhood and have known one another for a number of years. Victoria Zenobia F., aged 39, sells nacatamales (a typical food), cosmetics, breads and tortillas. Lorena A., at 20 years of age is the youngest in the group, has inherited an entrepreneural spirit from her family; she sells cosmetics and sandals. Maria O., aged 34, makes most of her income selling tortillas but also sells clothing and cosmetics. The three members are neighbours and have known each other for a long time as they are supportive of each other; they are all mothers, responsible women who work hard to give their children a good start in life. They now need a loan to bolster their businesses and as a result give their children a good start in life.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, cornflour, salt, lime, cosmetics and breads.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Maruja es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 1 hijo, Maruja tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, regalos, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Maruja vende cosméticos por catálogos. 
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Maruja son mejorar su negocio y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the “Morenita” Communal Bank. Maruja is married, is 33 years old, and has 1 child. Maruja has a store in her home where every day she sells groceries, vegetables, gifts. In addition Maruja sells cosmetics via catalog. Maruja needs a loan for 1050 soles to invest in buying rice and sugar Maruja dreams of improving her business and have a stable economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Paola Elizabeth

texts.es:
Paola es socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua.
Paola es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Paola tiene una bodega en la casa de sus padres en donde también vive, vende abarrotes, bebidas y licores. Además Paola los días sábados y domingos vende cebiche.
Paola necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche gaseosa, cerveza.
Los sueños de Paola son ampliar su negocio, tener una bodega grande y surtida.
texts.en:
Paola is a member of the “Corrí Ayllu” Communal Bank, which means Golden Family in Quechua. Paola is married, is 23 years old, and has 1 child. Paola has a store in her parent’s home where she also lives. She sells groceries, beverages and alcoholic beverages. In addition on Saturdays and Sundays Paola sells ceviche. Paola needs a loan for 1000 soles to invest in buying milk, soda pop and beer. Paola dreams of expanding her business and having a large, well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk, soda pop and beer.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua.
Catalina es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Catalina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, cerveza, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Catalina realiza tejidos de chompas de acuerdo al pedido de sus clientes.
Catalina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Catalina son mejorar su negocio y tener una bodega surtida.
texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the “Corrí Ayllu” Communal Bank, which means Golden Family in Quechua. Catalina is married, is 35 years old, and has 3 children. Catalina has a store in her home where every day she sells groceries and beer. In addition Catalina knits sweaters according to her client’s requests. Catalina needs a loan for 1000 soles to invest in buying rice and sugar. Catalina dreams of improving her business and having a well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Delia es casada, tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, Delia vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa que queda a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Delia compra tuna en su comunidad y luego lo vende en la ciudad de Lima. Además Delia vende comida y bebidas los días domingos en el estadio de su pueblo.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tuna.
Los sueños de Delia son mejorar su negocio y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Delia is a partner with Banco Comunal Estrella (Star Community Bank). She is 44 years old, married, and has five children. Delia lives in the community of Huayllapampa, 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Delia buys tuna (a type of local fruit) in her community and then she sells it in the city of Lima. Moreover, Delia sells food and drinks on Sundays in the stadium in her town. Delia needs a loan of 1000 soles ($325) that she will invest in the purchase of tuna. Delia's dreams are to improve her business and buy a car to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of tuna (a type of local fruit)

loans.name: Ana Melva

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Ana es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Ana tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, regalos, licores, útiles escolares. Además Ana junto a su esposo tienen una fabrica de carrocerías.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles escolares.
Ana sueña con ampliar su bodega y equipar su taller.
texts.en:
Ana is a partner with Banco Comunal Estrella (Star Community Bank). She is 35 years old, married, and has two children. Ana has a shop in her house where she sells general groceries, gifts, liquor, and school supplies. Moreover, Ana and her husband have an auto parts shop. Ana needs a loan of 1200 soles ($375) that she will invest in the purchase of school supplies. Ana dreams of expanding her shop and equipping her repair shop.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.es:
Gliceria es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Gliceria es casada, tiene 45 años y 10 hijos, Gliceria es feriante, viaja a diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Gliceria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo y frutas.
Los sueños de Gliceria son mejorar su negocio, techar su casa con material noble y comprar en mas cantidad.
texts.en:
Gliceria is a partner with Banco Comunal Estrella (Star Community Bank). She is 45 years old, married, and has 10 children. Gliceria is a market seller; she travels to different markets in the region where she sells fruits and at the markets she buys cereals that she sells in the markets of Ayacucho city. Gliceria needs a loan of 1000 soles ($325) that she will invest in the purchase of wheat and fruit. Gliceria's dreams are to improve her business, roof her house with a strong material, and purchase in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of wheat and fruit

loans.name: Juana Pilar

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Juana es casada, tiene 37 años y 1 hijo, Juana vende cosméticos por catálogos  que ofrece a amigos, familiares. Además Juana vende ropa, calzados, edredones, artefactos y todo cuanto le pidan sus clientes, productos que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima y Tacna.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatillas y ropa.
Juana sueña con tener un local estable en donde vende sus productos y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Estrella (Star) communal bank. Juana is 37 years old, married and has one son. She sells cosmetics by catalog that she gives to her friends and family. Furthermore, Juana sells clothes, shoes, quilts, devices y everything her clients ask for. She gets the products in the city of Lima and Tacna. Juana needs a loan of 2000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of shoes and clothes. Juana dreams of having a local shop where she can sell her products and of buying a car.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothing

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Bertha es casada, tiene 29 años y 4 hijos, Bertha vende condimentos al por mayor, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Huanta a donde viaja 2 veces por semana, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Bertha necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ajo por sacos.
Los sueños de Bertha son terminar de construir su casa, comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Estrella (Star) communal bank. Bertha is 29 years old, married and has 4 children. Bertha sells seasonings mainly. She sells in the city of Huanta where she travels twice a week. She buys her products in the city of Lima. Bertha needs a loan of 1000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of sacks of garlic. Bertha dreams of being able to build her house and buy a car to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of garlic

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Mercedes es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Mercedes vende verduras, frutas, carne, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria, para lo cual cuenta con un triciclo, por las mañanas se ubica en el mercado de San Juan luego vende de casa en casa.
Mercedes necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas y verduras.
Los sueños de Mercedes son tener una tienda en su casa y compra un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Estrella (Star) communal bank. Mercedes is 42 years old, married and has 3 kids. Mercedes sells fruits, vegetables and meat. She travels around selling on a tricycle. In the mornings, she travels to the market of San Juan and then afterwards she sells house to house. Mercedes needs a loan of 1200 soles that will be invested in the purchase of fruits and vegetables. Mercedes dreams of having a shop in her house and buying a car to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Julia es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Julia se dedica a la agricultura D. papa, quinua en sus tierras D. Chontaca, sus productos los comercializa en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Julia tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y para el pago D. los peones.
Los sueños D. Julia son que sus dos ultimas hijas sean profesionales, tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Estrella (Star) communal bank. Julia is 48 years old, married and has 4 children. Julia grows potatoes on her land in Chontaca. She sells her products in the markets of the city of Ayacucho. Furthermore, Julia has a grocery shop in her house. Julia needs a loan of 1200 soles that will be invested in the purchase of rice and the payment of her employees. Julia dreams of her two oldest children becoming professionals and that she will have a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and pay her employees

loans.name: Miriam Marleny

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Miriam se dedica a la agricultura de papa, maíz, haba en sus tierras de Tancayo, sus productos lo vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad. Además Miriam vende comida en su casa, su especialidad es el cebiche y el mondongo.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de los peones.
Miriam sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the "Estrella" community bank. Miriam is married common-law; she is 43 years old and has three children. Miriam grows potatoes, corn, beans on her land in Tancayo. She sells her crops in the wholesale food market of the town. In addition, Miriam sells food from her home; she specialties are cebiche (citrus-marinaded seafood) and tripe. Miriam needs a loan of 3,000 soles to pay her farm workers. Miriam dreams of giving her children a good education so that they can have a career and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her farm workers

loans.name: Marta Angélica

texts.es: Marta Angélica G. D. Z., habita en Atiquizaya, departamento D. Ahuachapán. Como toda madre soltera debe trabajar arduamente para poder sacar adelante a su familia, ya que vive junto a sus hijos y nietos, es por ello que día con día Marta venD. ropa en la Avenida Francisco Menéndez, una D. las calles más transitadas en Atiquizaya, esta actividad la ha venido realizando durante 16 años. Es por ello que a sus 60 años D. edad sueña con poder ampliar su negocio, poder surtirlo con mucha más ropa y D. esta manera, lograr mayores ingresos y D. paso poder brindar ayuda a otras personas, es por ello que Marta solícita un  préstamo a través D. cuál pueda ampliar su negocio y emplear a otras personas.
texts.en:
Marta Angélica G. D. Z. lives in Atiguizaya, in the department of Ahuachapán. Like all single mothers, she must work relentlessly to keep her family afloat. She lives with her children and grandchildren, and this is why, day after day, Marta sells clothes on Francisco Menéndez Avenue, one of the busiest streets in Atiquizaya. She has been doing this for sixteen years. Sixty-year-old Marta dreams of developing her business. She hopes to stock much more clothes, and in this way increase her income and be able to help others by giving them jobs. This is why she requests a loan; it will help her to develop her business and higher some people to work for her.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing new clothes and adding to the variety of her products.

location.town: Col. La Quinta  Dos, Atiquizaya, Ahuachapán

loans.name: Abdilia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Abdilia del carmen tiene la edad de 49 años,  habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad para apoyarle con los gastos de la familia ya que ellos tiene a su cargo una hija la cual actualmente estudia y trabaja .Doña Abdilia tiene quince años trabajando como comerciante en el mercado oriental su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras, a través del financiamiento que Afodenic le a brindado durante este ha mejorado su inventario. A veces tiene dificultad ya que las ventas actualmente  están bajas, con esta solicitud va a comprar productos variados y verdura para llenar el inventario y ofertar a sus clientes las frescas frutas para su consumo diario., espera que con la ayuda de Dios y el  apoyo de Afodenic saldrá hacia delante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Abdilia del Carmen is 49 years old, lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood of Ticuantepe municipality with her husband who works as a security guard to support her with the family’s expenses as they have a daughter who is in school and works. Abdilia has been working as a vendor in the western market for 15 years, selling fruits and vegetables. Through financing form Afodenic she has improved her inventory. Sometimes she has difficulty as her sales today are low. With this loan she is going to buy a variety of products and vegetables to fill her inventory and offer her customers fresh fruits for daily eating. She hopes that with God’s help and Afodenic’s support she will be successful in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits, vegetables, and othe products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Rosa es casada, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Rosa vende golosinas en un pequeño puesto ubicado en un centro comercial concurrido de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Además Rosa es concesionaria de los servicios higiénicos del centro comercial, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo y hermana.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el arreglo de los servicios higiénicos.
Rosa sueña con tener casa propia y tener un negocio grande.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “Juanito” Communal Bank. Rosa is married, is 28 years old, and has 2 children. Rosa sells candy in a stand located in a commercial mall in Ayacucho city. In addition Rosa sells hygienic (bathroom) services in the commercial mall, an activity she does with the help of her husband and sister. Rosa needs a loan for 1000 soles to invest in repairing her hygienic services facilities. Rosa dreams of having her own home and having a large business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair hygenic (bathroom) service facilities.

loans.name: Hugo Alfredo

texts.es:
Hugo es socio del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Hugo es soltero, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Hugo tiene un taller de servicio automotriz llamado El Bigote, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de 4 personas, el local es alquilado. Además Hugo se dedica a la compra y venta de carros.
Hugo necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos.
Los sueños de Hugo son tener un local propio e implementar una tienda de repuestos.
texts.en:
Hugo is a member of the Communal Bank of Juanito. He is single, 50 years old, and has 3 children. Hugo has a garage and repair shop called The Moustache, which he runs with the help of 4 employees. Hugo also buys and sells cars. . His garage is rented. Hugo requires a loan of 2,000 soles ($625), which he will invest in buying spare parts. His dreams are to own his own garage outright, and implement a spare parts shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy automotive spare parts

loans.name: Mauro Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén es socio del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Rubén es soltero y tiene 31 años, Rubén tiene una tienda en un local alquilado ubicado en una calle concurrida en donde confecciona y vende cortinas, también brinda el servicio de instalación de rieles, la confección de las cortinas lo realiza Rubén junto a su pareja.
Rubén necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de secadores, forros, toallas.
Los sueños de Rubén son tener casa propias, implementar un taller grande de confección y tener local propio.
texts.en:
