Rubén is a member of the Communal Bank of Juanito. He is single and 31 years old. He rents a shop located in a busy street where he designs and sells curtains. He also provides a service to install curtain rails. He completes the design of the curtains together with a partner. Rubén requires a loan of 1000 soles ($325), which will be invested in buying driers, linings and towels. Rubén's dreams are to own his own house, have a big design workshop and own his own premises.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy driers, linings and towels.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.es:
Aniceta es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Aniceta es casada, tiene 53 años y 7 hijos, Aniceta tiene un puesto en el mercado mayorista de frutas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende frutas variadas que adquiere en la costa y selva ayacuchana.
Aniceta necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plátano, naranja.
Aniceta sueña con comprar un terreno y construir más pisos en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Aniceta is a member of the Communcal Bank of Juanito. She is married, 53 years old, and has 7 children. Aniceta has a stand in the largest fruit market in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells a variety of fruit from the Ayacuchan coast and jungle. She requires a loan of 2500 soles ($775) which she will invest in the purchase of bananas and oranges. Aniceta's dream is to buy a plot of land and build more floors of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de plátano, naranja.

loans.name: Marita Luz

texts.es:
Marita Es socia del Banco Comunal Juanito.
Marita es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 3 hijos, Marita junto a su esposo tienen un Restaurante – Chifa que esta ubicado cerca de un terminal terrestre, actividad que realiza por las tardes y noches, con la ayuda de 2 personales. Su esposo es mecánico y tiene un taller mecánico.   
Marita necesita préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos.
Los sueños de Marita son tener un local propio  y viajar al extranjero.
texts.en:
Marita is a member of the “Juanito” Communal Bank. Marita is married, 29 years old, and has 3 children. Along with her husband Marita has a Chinese restaurant located near a bus terminal, a business they run during the afternoons and evenings with the help of 2 employees. Her husband is a mechanic and has a repair shop. Marita needs a loan for 1000 soles to invest in buy parts. Marita dreams of having her own locale and traveling abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Maria de la Concepción C. tiene la edad de 42 años habita en el barrio los Ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo, el trabaja como ebanista para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo un hijo  el cual le apoya con el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, doña Maria desde hace veinte años trabaja sus tierras y comercializa sus cultivos, ella esta muy contenta con el apoyo que le brindamos ya que ha podido establecer mas cultivos y ha mejorado las condiciones de la piña. Con esta solicitud va a comprar insumos agrícolas para los cultivos para tener una mejor cosecha y vender a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Maria de la Concepción C. is 42 years old and lives in the Ríos neighborhood of Ticuantepe with her husband, who works as a cabinetmaker to support her with the household expenses. They have a son who they support through their crops. For 20 years Maria has worked her land and sold her crops. She is very happy with the support we provide to her as she has been able to grow more crops and improve the condition of her pineapple crop. With this loan she will buy agricultural consumables for her crops in order to have a better harvest and sell at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural consumables for her crops

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es: Celestina R. M., reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, vive junto a sus hijos y nietos, los cuales son su principal apoyo. Celestina cose ropa desde los 15 años de edad, 45 años después, sigue realizando la misma actividad con la cuál logro salir adelante junto a sus hijos, con la misma dedicación de cuando empezó su negocio, Celestina atiende a sus clientes en su propia casa, pero en algunos casos debe realizar trabajos a domicilio. La meta de Celestina es poder comprar una nueva maquina de coser, ya que la que ella posee es bastante antigua, y de esta manera poder realizar su trabajo en menos tiempo. Debido a la gran competencia que posee, ella desea obtener un préstamo, a través del cuál pueda mejorar su servicio, con una máquina de coser moderna y más funcional y en consecuencia de esto poder mejor sus ingresos, y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Celestina R. M. lives with her children and grandchildren, who are very supportive of her. They live in the department of Ahuachapán. Celestina has been sewing clothes since she was fifteen. Forty-five years later, she is still sewing. This is how she has supported her children. Celestina serves her customers with the same dedication she had when she started her tailoring business. She does so from her own house, though in some cases she does have to make trips to other addresses. Celestina’s goal is to buy a new sewing machine, since the one she has now is rather old. This would help her business because a new machine would sew much more quickly. Due to her high level of competence, Celestina is requesting a loan with which to improve her service with the newer, higher-functioning sewing machine. This will increase her income and make her better able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a new sewing machine.

location.town: Colonia Altos de San José, departamento de Ahuacha

loans.name: Ivan De Los Santos

texts.es: E l señor Ivan de los Santos Guevara tiene la edad de 37 años habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa y hijos, la esposa trabaja como comerciante en el mercado, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, él desde hace diez años trabaja como taxista, con el financiamiento que le hemos brindado ha logrado mejorar su vivienda , ya que antes tenia muchas dificultades por que el techo tenia muchos orificios los cuales le afectaban en tiempos de lluvias , también ha logrado invertir en la división de cuartos de sus pequeños para que tengan mas privacidad . con esta solicitud va a comprar materiales de construcción para seguir arreglando su casa y poder vivir en una casa digna con su familia.
texts.en:
Ivan de los Santos Guevara is 37 years old and lives in the Ticuantepe municipality with his wife and children. His wife works as a vendor in the market. To support the household expenses Ivan has worked as a taxi driver for 10 years. With the financing we have provided he has made improvements on his home, as previously he had a lot of problems because the roof had many holes with impacted him when it rained. He also was able to invest in room dividers so his children would have more privacy. With this loan he is going to buy construction materials to continue improving his home and be able to live in a respectable home with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make home improvements

loans.name: San Juan De Orcasitas Group

texts.es:
El Banco San Juan D. Orcasitas inicia su tercer ciclo con  18 socias, las socias son D. la comunidad D. San Juan D. Orcasitas que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comidas, cosméticos, golosinas, bebidas, repuestos, abarrotes en general y fabricación D. ladrillos.

Como es el caso D. Agustina que es casada, tiene 42 años y 1 hijo, Agustina tiene un recreo llamado Valle Orcasitas en donD. venD. comida, bebidas, además su local cuenta con piscina y campo deportivo. Además Agustina se dedica a la compra y venta D. tara.

Mientras que Cirila es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Cirila compra tara en las diferentes comunidades y luego lo venD. a los intermediarios, además Cirila en época D. producción D. Tuna, compra tuna y lo transporta a la ciudad D. Lima para comercializarlo.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 9,450 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. tuna, tara, cuy, gallina, cochinilla, azucar, arroz, fideos, aceite y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, tener capital propio, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y trabajar para salir adelante.
texts.en:
San Juan D. Orcasitas Bank has started its third cycle with eighteen partners, all of whom are from the community in the area of San Juan D. Orcasitas – thirty minutes form the city Ayacucho. The partners are involved in different businesses, like selling food, cosmetics, sweets, drinks, replacement auto parts, groceries, and making bricks. In Agustina’s case, she is married, forty-two years old, and has a son. Agustina sells food, and beverages at a playground called Orcasitas Valley, and also at the local pool and a sports field. Agustina also buys and sells tara, a product from a kind of tree in Perú. While Cirila is married, thirty-nine years old, and the mother of three children, she purchases tara from different communities and then sells it between her suppliers. In addition, Cirila buys prickly pear when it is in season and transports it to Lima to sell it. The partners need loans of different sizes, like S/.300, S/.450, S/.600, S/.900, and totaling at S/.9,450 worth of loans from the communal bank. Their loans will be used to buy prickly pears, tara, guinea pigs, chickens, young pigs, sugar, rice, noodles, and oil, and to pay employees. These small businesspeople dream of improving their businesses, having their own financial resource, raising their children with a good education, and working to stay afloat.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying prickly pears, tara, guinea pigs, chickens, young pigs, sugar, rice, noodles, and oil, and paying employees

loans.name: Blanca Marina

texts.es: Blanca Marina O. D. M., habita en Atiquizaya, departamento D. Ahuachapán, vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos en casa alquilada. Blanca D. 55 años D. edad, trabaja en su propio negocio el cuál consiste en fotocopiar y anillar documentos, dicho negocio esta ubicado en la casa que resiD.. Debido a que los gastos D. su hogar son múltiples, ella necesita mejorar su negocio por ello solícita un préstamo, a través del cuál sea capaz D. invertir en capital D. trabajo y poder mejorar su negocio, debido a que Blanca genera una ganancia D. menos D. $30.00 dólares al mes, desea fortalecer su negocio y aprovechar al máxima el hecho se ser el único lugar en el que se brinda este tipo D. servicio en los alrededores D. su colonia, así D. esta manera ella podrá percibir más ganancias las cuales beneficiarán sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Blanca Marina O. D. M. lives in Atiquizaya, in the department of Ahuachapán. She lives with her husband and their three children in a house they rent. Blanca is fifty-five years old, and works in her own business -- a photo-copying and ring-binding business that she runs out of her home. Since she has numerous home expenses, she needs to improve her business. This is why she is requesting a loan to invest in her business and improve it. Since Blanca earns less than thirty dollars a month, she hopes to strengthen her business and make the most of the one place in her area that offers this type of service. In this way, she will be able to make more money, which will benefit her family income.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teodora Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Teodora C. habita en La concepción junto a su esposo , el esposo trabaja como comerciante en el M. de Masaya para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos no tiene a su cargo hijos ya que todos están casados y viven por cuenta propia , ella desde hace veinte años se dedica a la agricultura y se siente muy  contenta trabajando con Afodenic ya que le hemos brindado nuestro apoyo y a logrado tener mas cultivo.con este crédito es la tercera inversión que hace el cual va a comprar insumos agrícola para el cultivo de piña que espera tener una buena cosecha y vender a buen precio en el M.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora C. lives in La Concepción with her husband, who works as a vendor in the Masaya market to help her with the household expenses. They don’t have any children to support as they are all married and live on their own. For 20 years she has farmed and she is very content working with Afodenic as we have provided her our support and she has been able to grow more crops. With this loan, her third, she will buy consumable agricultural products for her pineapple crop. She hopes to have a good harvest and sell at a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy consumable agricultural products to fertilize her pineapple crop

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es: Reyna María Martínez R. tiene 32 años, está casada, y tiene tres hijos. El propósito para su negocio es que su negocio se mantenga activo. La actividad económica a la que Doña Reyna se dedica es el destace de cerdo. Doña Reyna inició este negocio hace cuatro años, y comenzó con dinero propio, además poseía la responsabilidad de mantener a su familia. Por lo que recorría las diferentes comarcas en busca del mejor cerdo para ofrecer a sus clientes calidad. Doña Reyna nunca ha dejado de soñar y como uno de sus sueños serían de obtener otra fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia. El financiamiento de Doña Reyna es de C$ 4.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Reyna María Martínez R. is a 32-year-old married mother with three children. Her goal is to keep her business active. Ms. Reyna butchers pork for a living. She started this business 4 years ago with her own money. She was also responsible for supporting her family, which is why she traveled to several regions in search of the best pork so that she could offer her customers high quality products. Ms. Reyna has never stopped dreaming, and one of those dreams is to acquire another source of income to support her family. Ms. Reyna is requesting a loan for C$ 4,000.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel Díaz B. tiene 28 años, está soltera, y tiene un hijo de tres años de edad. El propósito que Doña Reyna tiene para su negocio es construir un establecimiento en donde pueda comercializar su comida. El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de diez años. Doña Reyna dio inicio a esta actividad por que su hermano logró prestarle dinero y comenzó establecerse una mesa en la afueras de su vivienda. Reyna Isabel ofrece los productos como gallo pinto, huevo, maduro y queso frito, y más tarde decide realizar un financiamiento para invertir en su negocio. Sus deseos para el futuro son mejorar su nivel de vida para que su familia no se necesidades. Ella necesita C$ 4.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel Díaz B. is a 28-year-old single mother with a 3-year-old son. Ms. Reyna is planning to build a business space in which she can sell her meals. She has been running this business for 10 years. Ms. Reyna started the business because her brother managed to lend her money, so she set up a table outside her home to sell food. Reyna Isabel offers dishes like gallo pinto (a Nicaraguan dish that consists of rice and red beans), eggs, fried plantains, and fried cheese. She later decided to seek a loan in order to invest it in her business. Her goal for the future is to raise her standard of living so that her family will not lack anything. She needs a loan of C$ 4,000.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maura De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maura de los Ángeles C. F. tiene 46 años, está casada, y tiene 3 hijos. Todos los hijos trabajan y tienen 27, 25, y 23 años respectivamente. El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es más de 7 años, y ella inicia este pequeño comercio al vender unas vacas propias que tenía en su finca. Por lo que ella no podía cuidarlas y alimentarlas, decidió venderlas decidiendo establecer un negocio en su vivienda. Más tarde surge su negocio con la venta de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros. Sus deseos son de aumentar en la variedad de productos, y por lo que ahora necesita el financiamiento por que  precisa de compra mercadería. El monto que solicita es de C$ 8.800 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Maura de los Ángeles C. F. is 46 years old. She is married and has 3 children. All the children work. They are 27, 25 and 23 years old. She has been in this business for more than 7 years. She began this small business when she sold some of her own cows that she had on her farm. Since she couldn’t care for them or feed them, she decided to sell them and open a business in her house. Later on she started her clothing business with the sale of children, women and men’s clothing. She wishes to increase her product variety, which is why she needs financing now to buy goods. She is asking for the amount of 8.800 Córdobas (NIO) in a period of 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felipe De Jesús

texts.es:
A la casa del señor Felipe De Jesús G.  le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder llevar a cabo la mejora y así tenerla terminada, hay que por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario. 
  El planea pagar esté crédito con los ingresos de su trabajo como electricista en una compañía del Gobierno. (En la foto aparece su esposa la señora Blanco Estela Hernández y su hija).
texts.en:
Felipe De Jesús G. needs to finish his home’s exterior so he is asking for a loan to be able to complete this improvement and finish his home, and at the moment he doesn’t have enough money to do so. He plans to repay this loan with the income from his work as an electrician in a government company. (His wife Blanco Estela Hernández and daughter appear in the photo.)

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the exterior of his home

loans.name: Nidia Del Crarmen

texts.es: Nidia del Carmen Q. V. tiene 41 años, está casada, y tiene cuatro hijos. Todos sus hijos trabajan por cuenta propia. Sus propósitos con su negocio son de ampliar el local en donde pueda atender más clientes. El tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de dos años; ya que comenzar con este tipo de negocio no fue fácil ya que ella no poseía la experiencia. Por lo que en su negocio inicia con capital propio y con la ayuda de los préstamos de la Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amiga ha podido sacar adelante a su negocio. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para salir adelante. El préstamo solicitado por Doña Nidia fue de C$ 20.000 a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Nidia del Carmen Q. V. is 41 years old. She is married and has 4 children. All of her children are working on their own. She intends to expand the premises of her business to serve more customers. She has been in this business for two years. It wasn’t easy to start this type of business because she had no experience. She began her business with her own capital and was able to manage it with the help of loans from Fundación León 2000 and friendly organizations. Her dream is to expand her business to make ends meet. Mrs. Nidia applied for a loan of 20.000 Córdobas (NIO) in a period of 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Aura Elena

texts.es: Doña Aura tiene 48 años de edad, reside en Villa libertad,  con cuatro hijos de 2, 5,16 y 20 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosméticos al crédito como al contado, que inicio desde hace dieciocho años, con dinero propio y ayuda de su esposo, con la solicitud va invertir en compra ropa escolar como útiles escolares y cosméticos esta es su sexta solicitud que ha sido de muchos beneficios para su negocio como en su vida personal, con esto espera lograr mejorar las ventas como captar clientes. ya que la venta de uniformes es la prioridad de los estudiantes,  sus planes a corto plazo es invertir mas.
texts.en:
Aura is 48 years old, and she lives in Villa Libertad with her four children, ages 2, 5, 16 and 20. She is in the business of selling clothes and cosmetics on credit as well as for direct payment. She started her business eighteen years ago with her own money and help from her husband. With the loan she will invest in school clothes, school supplies and cosmetics. This is her sixth request. Her previous requests have greatly benefited her business as well as her personal life. With this loan she hopes to improve sales and gain more customers. Buying uniforms is a priority for students, so her short term plans are to invest more in them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and cosmetic products

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Sinoun is 25 years old and is married, with one child who is still young. She is a good homemaker and cooks delicious meals for her family and cares for her lovely young child. Her husband's name is Baiy, 34. He is a trailer-motorcycle (tuk tuk) driver. Sinoun's husband normally gets up early in the morning to work and will come back in the evening with his income. He is a very responsible man to his family, providing food, clothing, and medical care. Sinoun hopes to start a small business, and in order to make that possible, she is requesting a loan to start a new business selling food. She currently lives in Siem Reap Province and she was not available for photographing so her husband is shown in the photo instead.

loans.use: To start a new business selling food

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopha P., 56, and her husband, Mr. Vantha Ee, 65, live in a small village across Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1971 and have six children who stay with them: three sons and three daughters. Two of their daughters are silk weavers, one son has full-time employment and the other three children are in school.

Sopha used to be a silk weaver but she transferred her loom to her daughters. She sells their finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Mr. Vantha has been a farmer for over twenty years, he grows corns and tomatoes. Sopha hopes to support her children’s further education.

She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase silk materials, and will use the other part of the loan to buy blacksmith materials for her son-in-law to run his blacksmith business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and to buy blacksmith materials for son-in-law running his business.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Mrs. Sareth K., 43, and her husband, Mr. Vun Kuch, 42, live along national road number one about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1990 and have four children: two sons and two daughters, all of whom are in school.

Sareth and her husband have been selling flowers and bananas for the past twenty-seven years. The couple does farming as well; they grow vegetables and rice. Harvest season is coming soon, and Sareth needs to find a proper place to keep rice, which she can’t keep in the open-air space on the ground floor of her house.

Therefore, Sareth is asking for a loan of $1,200 to concrete her house foundation and build a concrete room under her wooden house to store her produce. In the past, she rented her relative’s house to keep her rice produce but it is not convenient.

loans.use: To build a storage space under her house to store rice

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun H., 37, and her husband, Mr. Chhunnat Khim, 39, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, married in 1994 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of their children are in school and the youngest one still stays home.

Since 1992, Savoeun has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her aunty. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Chhunnat has been a mason for 14 years. Savoeun is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Sophin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophin L., 34, and her husband, Mr. Thea Soem, 33, who live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, married in 1997 and have two children: one son and one daughter. One of their children attends school and the other one is still too young.

Sophin has been selling flowers for six years, a skill she learned from her parents. She buys them from villagers in her village for re-sale at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been driving a motor remorque taxi (a motor with a trailer at the back) for fifteen years. But, his motor remorque is broken very often and it upsets his business.

So, Sophin is requesting a loan of US$ 800 to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one; she will use part of her loan to purchase flowers on contract for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase: a new motorbike to replace her husband’s old one; flowers on contract for re-sale

loans.name: Och's Group

texts.en: This group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, Mrs. O., 41, is widowed and has seven children who are living in the family home. Most of them are employed as constructiO. workers. She is a domestic rice trader. She usually buys rice from the farmers and then re-sells it. O.'s business is profitable, and that motivates her to continue investing in it. In order to make her business successful and generate a stable income for her family, she is requesting a loan to purchase more rice. The other two members are P. and Y.. P. is a 43-year-old widow, who is a vegetable grower. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her crops. Y. is a 42-year-old widow and she is a traditional medicine maker who is requesting a loan to buy raw materials to make medicines with. The borrowers currently live in the Rolous Commune of Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase more rice

loans.name: Hou

texts.en: C. is a 32-year-old woman who has married with two children, both of whom are still young. They help with her work when they have free time from studying. She makes a living selling used goods. She normally uses her old motorbike to collect used goods from door-to-door in her community. She then stores them a while and re-sells them to make a profit. She is married to Yeout, 45, who works with her in the business. The family's living conditions are not so good because their house is too small for them. Therefore, C. is asking for a loan that she will add to her personal savings to build a new house. The loan will help the family to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Zena M. from Mbeya. She is married with three  children, between the ages of 9 and 15. Zena has been running a clothes business since 1997. She purchases and resells clothing.

She works at the business for 9 hours per day, 6 days per week. Zena currently earns about 250USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 750USD in order to purchase more clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Zena thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing in bulk

loans.name: Roida

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Roida M. from Mbarali. She is married with two children, between the ages of 4 and 7. Roida has been running a retail shop since 2005. She purchases various commodities wholesale and sell them retail in her shop.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Roida currently earns about 250USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 600USD in order to purchase more commodities. In the future, she plans to start another new business. Roida thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing more commodities

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 40-year-old married man with three children, living in Harat Hreik in the Beirut suburbs. In 2003, he started a very innovative business, which is the manufacturing of recyclable paper bags. Today, Mohammad wants to borrow $1,200 in order to buy a paper-bag pressing machine to improve his paper bags' quality.

loans.use: Buy a paper bag pressing machine

loans.name: Nohra

texts.en: Nohra is a 32-year-old musician living in Fourn Al Chebak in Beirut. He learned to play music ten years ago, and because music is his passion, he decided to embrace this profession and became a well-known DJ. Today, Nohra is requesting $1,000 to buy new sound equipment for his business.

loans.use: Buy sound equipment

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 35-year-old married man with two children, living in Ghaza in the Bekaa Valley. He has owned a small shop since 2000, where he fixes and sells tires in addition to engine oil. Today, Youssef has an opportunity to buy some engine oil for a very good price; therefore, he is requesting to borrow $1,200.

loans.use: Buy engine oil inventory

loans.name: Chhot

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She owns a medium-sized wooden house and has established a small family. She is a cleaner for a district hospital. She also sells groceries at a location near the hospital. She is married and has given birth to four children. Two of them are employed. One is a local construction worker and the other one is working as a security guard in Phnom Penh City. Her husband, Loin, aged 61, is a rice cultivator and helps her with selling the groceries. S. has currently sold all of her products so she wants to acquire more products to sell. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy more products to sell as well as to buy fertilizer for her husband's business. S.'s husband is pictured because she was not available that day.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 47-year-old married man with five children, living in Bourj Al Barajneh in the Beirut suburbs. He has owned a taxi since 2006 and he works between Beirut and the South. One year ago, Samir took his first loan from Ameen to change his old car, and today, he is requesting $800 in order to perform some maintenance on his taxi.

loans.use: Perform maintenance on his taxi

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Latifa K. from Mbarali. She is married with 2 children, between the ages of 7 and 13. Latifa has been running a beauty salon since 2007. Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by 1 employee. Latifa currently earns about 300USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 475 USD in order to purchase cosmetics and makeup for her salon. In the future, she plans to to start a new business. Latifa thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics and makeup

loans.name: Nader

texts.en: Nader is a 31-year-old married man living in A. Shwaifat in Mount Lebanon. He opened an internet café in 2004, where he teaches the village's children to operate PCs and surf the net. Today, Nader wants to borrow $1,200 in order for him to buy more PCs so he can expand his business and absorb more students in his computer courses.

loans.use: Buy new computers

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: Mr. Chanthy P. lives in Trapaing Pring village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a palm juice collector. Aside from this career, he is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he usually hires a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. He has decided to ask for a loan to buy a second ox of his own to plow the field and to reduce his expenses. His wife, Mrs. Sao Eng, is a rice soup seller. Mr. Chanthy P. is 52 years old father of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a driver and the other is attending the local school. His wife is presented on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a second ox to plow fields

loans.name: Naim

texts.en: Naim is a 23-year-old single man living in Maarakeh, southern Lebanon. He already took several loans from Ameen to improve his butcher shop. Today, Naim wants to borrow $1,200 in order to increase his inventory and to buy a new meat slicer.

loans.use: Buy meat inventory

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn K. is a villager in Trapaing Pring village in Kampong Chhnang province. She sells palm sugar. She is also a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she has a little income to support the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to buy a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Suos Ty, is a construction worker. Mrs. Thorn K. is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To help purchase a second plot of land for cultivating rice

loans.name: Byambagerel

texts.en:
Byambagerel N. is a divorced mother of one child who lives with her mother and daughter. They share a "ger", the traditional nomadic housing used by Mongolians for centuries, in the ger district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. For the last seven years, she has run a meat stall selling horse meat in the local market. Thanks to her cheerful, open and hard-working personality, she has many repeat customers. 

Byambagerel has borrowed from XacBank, Kiva's microfinance partner in Mongolia, many times in the past. With profit she earned from her previous loans with the bank, she has fully renovated her ger, which is located in a yard owned by her sister. Her dream is to graduate from  a university and become a professional person. She has been working hard and aspiring to buy her own land on which to build a ger. She is on the left, at the table.

loans.use: to buy horse meat to sell

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 34 year old Mwajuma N. from Mbarali. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 7 and 14. Mwajuma has been running a clothes and cosmetics business since 2005. 

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Mwajuma currently earns about 180USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more cosmetics in bulk. In the future, she plans to diversify by increasing the number and variety of items in her business. Mwajuma thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Sarn

texts.en: Mrs. Sarn K. is a 40-year-old widow and she lives in Trapaing Pring village in Kampong Chhnang province. She trades in rice and palm sugar, and since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more rice and palm sugar to resell. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Sarn K. has two children, one of whom is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: Expand rice and palm sugar resale business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 45 year old Asha N. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children, between the ages of 12 and 16. Asha has been running a grocery business. She works at the business for 13-16 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by one employee. Asha currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase grocery items. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and variety of the stock. Asha thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Laeah

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Laeah L. from Mbeya. She is married with one 3-year-old child. Laeah has been running a medical store business since 2008. She purchases human drugs and sells them in her medical store.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Laeah currently earns about $320 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $625 in order to purchase more drugs to expand her store. In the future, she plans to start a new medical store. Laeah thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more drugs to expand her store

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Choeurn S. is a farmer in Kouk Penh village in Kampong Chhnang province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Lout Try, is a firewood seller. Even though they try to do work hard, they still earn less income to provide a better house for their family living. Thus, Mrs. Choeurn S. has decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to build a new house for her family. She is 45 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a farmer who helps the mother work and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of photo.

loans.use: To help buy a new house for her family

loans.name: Phom's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers contains five members. Mrs. Y., 24, has been selected to be group leader by the members. She has four children who are studying at the primary school. She earns a living selling fruit and vegetables in the Rolous Market, and she can make around $2 per day. She is married to Seoun, 51, who works as a rice farmer. The dry season is coming and Mr. Seoun needs to cultivate the rice crop that he relies on, using the cultivating machine for plowing the land, but unfortunately the machine has broken. Therefore, he talked with his wife and they have decided to ask for a loan to repair their broken machine and to buy fertilizers. 

The other four members of the group are S., P., S. and S.. S. is a grocery seller who is widowed. She needs a loan to purchase grocery inventory to sell. P. sells Khmer noodles and she requests a loan to enlarge her business. S. is a widowed farmer and she is applying a loan to buy fertilizer. S. sells desserts from home and she seeks a loan to supply her business. The borrowers all live in the Meanchey Commune of Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To repair their broken machine

loans.name: Jiguiya (Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
Les huit femmes du groupe Jiguiya sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et 4 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens de voisinage et exercent presque la même activité  de restauration et  de vente de nourritures. De temps à autres, elles vendent des condiments alimentaires et sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Jiguiya a décidé de solliciter les services de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son septième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de haricots, des cartons de macaroni,  des bidons d’huile alimentaires  et divers condiments pour la restauration. Les nourritures sont vendues la nuit devant la porte de leur maison et le matin de bonne heure. Quant aux condiments, ils sont vendus chaque jour à la maison et au petit marché du quartier de Médine. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 55 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités. Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenus  telle que l’achat de congélateur pour la vente de boissons fraîches.
texts.en:
The eight women of the group Jiguiya are all married and average 44 years of age and four children. They live in large traditional extended families in the Hamdallaye district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). The women know one another through community ties, and they do almost the same work, selling prepared foods. From time to time, they sell condiments and are in high demand in this business.

In order to satisfy the ever-increasing needs of their customers, the group members decided to request the services of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their seventh solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The women plan to use this loan to buy sacks of beans, boxes of macaroni, drums of cooking oil, and various condiments for food catering purposes. The food is sold at night, in front of the door of their house, and in the morning at an early hour. As for the condiments, these are sold each day out of the house and at the small marketplace of the Médine district.

They each hope to realize an average profit of 55,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The funds will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the family, and to invest the rest in other businesses. Their ambition is to diversify their commerce by embracing other income-generating work, such as buying a freezer for selling cold drinks.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Asnath

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 49-year-old Asnath S. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with six children, between the ages of 15 and 26. Asnath has been running a bar since 1999. She works at the business for 12-16 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by five employees. Asnath currently earns about $600 from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase stock of beer and soda. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Asnath thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of beer and soda.

loans.name: Soutoura (La Protection) Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe Soutoura sont toutes mariées à part une célibataire. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier sogomougou de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali).
 Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et exercent presque la même activité de vente  d’habits  et de produits cosmétiques. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. Afin de satisfaire  le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Soutoura a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son troisième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des pagnes wax et de brodés à Lomé et Cotonou et une quantité importante de cosmétiques à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali).
 Les pagnes  et les cosmétiques sont vendus en détail, au comptant où à crédit au marché de Koutiala et de porte en porte à une clientèle constituée de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 110 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition d’élargir leurs activités avec   l’ouverture d’un magasin de produits de beauté.
texts.en:
The seven women of the group Soutoura are all married except for one who is unmarried. They average 34 years of age and three children and live in large traditional extended families in the Sogomougou district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). The women know one another through community ties, and they do almost the same work, selling clothing and cosmetics. The women are in high demand in this business.

In order to satisfy the ever-increasing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their third solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The women plan to use this loan to buy Wax-brand pagnes cloth and embroidered ones in Lomé and in Cotonou, plus a sizable quantity of cosmetics in Bamako (the capital of Mali). The pagnes and cosmetics are sold retail, cash or credit accepted, at the Koutiala marketplace and going door-to-door. Their customers are women.

The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 110,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. These funds will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in their work. Their ambition is to expand their businesses with the opening of a store selling beauty products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Somnang Yang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people living in Kor village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Somnang Y., the 30- year-old village bank president, is a Khmer noodle seller. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she she decided to ask for a loan to add her capital to make more Khmer noodles to sell. She hopes to increase income and improve her family living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Each Savoun, is a construction worker. Mrs. Somnang Y. has two children who are too young to work or study. She does not come to take a loan but her husband is, so he is presented in the picture instead her. 

Four members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Expand business making Khmer noodles

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Rahel C. from Dar es Salaam. She is divorced with one child who is 20. Rahel has been running a cloth business since 2005. She sells on the street, and most sales are credit sales. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by two employees. Rahel currently earns about US$500 from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional stock of cloth. In the future, she plans to open another business. Rahel thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cloth.

loans.name: Wanawake Na Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Aisha Naasor, age 30, is married with one child, aged 11. She sells fish and fabric from door to door. She started this business in 2000. She works from 7am to 6pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 481.

This will be Aisha’s eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock by buying more clothes and fish to sell and has paid the preceding loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase fish sales.

Aisha will share this loan with subgroup F of the "Wanawake na maendeleo" group. The subgroup has four members, who run a salon, sell food, and sell fish. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Aisha is second from left.

loans.use: To increase her  fish sales

loans.name: Kimsrean

texts.en: Mrs. Kimsrean C. is a villager in Ty Muoy village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a fish seller. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fish to resell to earn more profits. Her husband, Mr. Thang Hak, is a policeman. Mrs. Kimsrean C. is 56 years old mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is a motor taxi driver.

loans.use: Purchasing more fish to resell.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Mrs. Khun Y. is a villager in Trapaing Kdar village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a grocer. Her husband, Mr. Krouch Chhoem, is a village chief and a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. With this plantation, he earns a small income to support his family. Thus, Mrs. Khun Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn more income. She is 41 years old and the mother of four children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice

loans.name: Faina

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Faina K. from Mbarali. She is married with two children, age 2 and 5. Faina has been running a clothes and voucher business since 2005. She purchases clothes and vouchers from wholesale businesses and sells them at retail.

She works at her business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Faina currently earns about US$250 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$550 to purchase more vouchers and clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to increase number and varieties of items in her business. Faina thanks you for your support!

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans wit

loans.use: To purchase more vouchers and clothes in bulk for her business

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.fr: Anne Marie a 27 ans .Elle est mariée est mere de 2 enfants .Pour gagner sa vie et parciper aux charge de la maison ,elle fabrique des produits pour cheveux qu' elle vend aux filles .ces produits fait avec des produits naturels sont tres demandés par les filles.Pour renforcer son activité par une accroissement de sa production elle sollicite un pret.
texts.en:
Anne Marie, age 27, is married and the mother of two. To earn a living and to help with family expenses, she makes hair products that she sell to girls. These products, made from natural materials, are highly sought after by them. She is requesting a loan to enhancing her business by increasing her production.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mrs. Thy K. is a villager in Thnorl village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a rice middleman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to earn more profits. He husband, Mr. Ouk Sary, makes wells to sell. Mrs. Thy K. is 49 years old and the mother of five children. One of her children works while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more rice

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Eliza S. from Mbeya. She is married with three children children between the ages of 2 and 9. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are  orphans. 

Eliza has been running a clothing business since 2002. She purchases clothes from wholesale businesses and sells them at retail. 

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by four employees. Eliza currently earns about US$200 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase more clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open another business. Eliza thanks you for your support!

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes in bulk for her business

loans.name: Khun Thea's Group

texts.en: Mr. Khun Thea T. is the group leader of five entrepreneurs in Lor village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is firewood seller and a 47-year-old father of four children, one of whom works with him in the firewood business, while the others are either attending the local school or too young to work or study.  His wife, Mrs. Eng Vanleng, is a Khmer noodle seller. Even though they work hard, Mr. Khun Thea T. and his wife do not have enough money to provide a good house for their family.  To this end, Mr. Khun Thea T. is requesting a loan to pool with his savings in order to make repairs to the family house.

loans.use: House repairs

loans.name: Almasi Group

texts.en:
Mwanakombo I., age 37, is married with one child. She sells bricks. She started this business three years ago and works daily from 6am until 1pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 149.

This will be Mwanakombo’s sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to continue with the same business but make more money in order to achieve the aim of the firm.

Mwanakombo will share this loan with her loan group, "Almasi," which totals 18 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mwanakombo is seated on the right and is wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: Buying more bricks for re-sale

loans.name: Annety

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 58-year-old Annety K. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with six children between the ages of 22 and 39. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Annety has been running a grocery business since 2007. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Annety currently earns about US$500 from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional stock of grocery items. In the future, she plans to open another business. Annety thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To stock additional grocery items.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Mariam N. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with five children between the ages of 22 and 30. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. 

Mariam has been running a poultry business since 2007. It is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

She works at the business for six hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by one employee. Mariam currently earns about US$200 from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicks and feed. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Mariam thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purcahase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: P., 24, lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She runs a small stall behind her house where she raises ducks to lay eggs for sale. She also sells fish in the local market, and she can earn an income of approximately $3 a day. She currently cares for two children. Both of them attend school. She is married to Kol, 34, who is a local fisherman. She usually gets her fish to sell from her husband's fishing and she sells them for a profit. P. is asking for a loan in order to purchase a second-hand motorcycle. She will use it to transport the fish to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Ritha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Ritha M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 8. Ritha has been running a poultry business since 2003. 

Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. 

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, seven days per week. Ritha currently earns about US$300 from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicks and feed. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Ritha thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Mrs. Seng Torn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng T. is 36 years of age and married with three children attending the local school. She is the village bank president, and also owns a small grocery store. She is leading this group of nineteen people who plan on using the loan for various purposes. Her husband, Mr. YO. Khim, is a cow breeder. Since his cow breeding business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Seng T. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow for her husband’s cow breeding business. Mrs. Pheap O. is not asking for a loan but her husband is, so he is presented in the picture instead.

Eleven members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy one more cow for her husband’s cow breeding business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty products and hair pieces for resale

loans.name: Enhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enhtsetseg G. lives with her husband and daughter in a rental apartment. Her husband owns a second-hand car and uses it to work as a taxi driver.  Since 1998, Enhtsetseg has been renting a 10-square-meter section of a local hairdressing salon in a residential district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She cuts hair and does other beautician services in that small place.

Enhtsetseg has 11 years' experience in this line of work. Now, she wants a Kiva loan to expand her small business by buying a tattoo machine. Her dream is to have her own bigger beauty salon in the future. Now, she is accumulating savings from her own and her husband's earnings and planning to buy a condominium for her family.

loans.use: buying a tattoo machine

loans.name: Kayunga Market Group

texts.en:
Henry W. is a gentle father of 5 children, ages 15, 13, 12, 8 and 6. He is 38 years old. Henry runs a commercial farming business. After leaving school, he decided to use the piece of land he inherited to plant crops and sell them. Now he has expanded his farming business. His products are sold in Kayunga but he lives in a village nearby.

It has been 10 years that Henry's been running the business. His motivations for business success are to provide welfare for his children and family, as well as for himself. He will be using the loan to expand his business: to pay workers for his farm, clear the land, and assist in paying other expenses. Henry has had 7 loans so far. The group is one of the oldest-- about 10 or 11 years old.

loans.use: Farming expenses

loans.name: Mrs. Saruon Roth Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Saruon R. is a widow with two children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other is attending the local school.  She is a popular singer who has been hired to perform in wedding ceremonies, parties, and so on.  Aside from this career, she is a rice middleman.  Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to sell to earn more profits.  The loan will also support the eleven members of the village bank, who plan to use the loan for different purposes.  Mrs. Saruon R. has been selected by the members to be village bank president.

loans.use: Purchasing more rice to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Farida U. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with five children between the ages of 13 and 25. Farida has been running a poultry business since 1990.

Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. 

She works at the business for six hours per day, seven days per week. Farida currently earns about US$300 from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicks and feed. In the future, she plans to open another business. Farida thanks you for your support!

The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed.

loans.name: Risky

texts.en:
Risky A. is 45 years old. She’s married with two children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 12 years she has been purchasing young sheep and calves in the local market, fattening and selling them.

Risky is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. She has always looked for a way to be an important protagonist by providing extra income to her home. Risky wakes up early every morning to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. She started this occupation because of the recommendation and teaching of her beloved mother.

Thanks to this activity Risky is offering her children an education. Risky wants to keep educating them because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have laid out for themselves. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan of 800 USD to buy calves in order to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to fatten for sale

loans.name: Samuon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samuon P. is a 53-year-old widow. She sells firewood. She has two children, one of whom is a driver while the other is a firewood seller who helps her with her firewood selling business. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more firewood to earn more profits. In addition to this career, she is a Khmer noodle seller. Mrs. Samuon P. is the group leader of four members who live together in Anduong Preng village.

One member in this group is receiving an end-of-term loan while the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. They allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Purchasing more firewood to earn more profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Horun

texts.en: R. was born in 1985 and lives in Siem Reap Province. She runs a small store in front of her house. She sells groceries such as cooked ingredients, sweets, and boiled-eggs. Most of her customers are villagers. She married to Pheak, 28, who makes a living as a fisherman. The young couple has one young child who is a lovely baby. R. is asking for a loan to buy more products to sell and to buy a fishing net for her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Sobia Ejaz Hussain Group

texts.en:
Sobia baji is a 28-year-old married lady and has resided in a city called Multan, Pakistan for the past 8 years. Multan city is famous for its shrines and handmade items. Sobia baji completed her education till 8th standard; she couldn’t study further due to her family’s meager financial resources. She married a man whose name is E. H. and he is a farmer and takes care of the land. He has been in this profession for the past 5 years.

Sobia baji has two kids: one daughter and one son. Both are in kindergarten. Sobia baji helps her husband in his farming. They both get up early and go to the field to sow seeds of different crops. Sobia baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy material (seeds, fertilizer) to expand their agriculture business.

Sobia baji is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Shamim baji and Mukhtar baji each want a loan to buy buffalo for their milk-selling businesses. Haseena baji and Irshad baji each want a loan to buy fertilizer for their agriculture businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for agriculture

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel O. is single and has no children. He has received schooling through senior high. Samuel sells spare parts and also repairs electrical appliances at Akotobinsin near Elmina, a business he started not too long ago. Samuel uses his income to pay for rent, utility bills and other expenses. Samuel will use the loan to purchase more spare parts for sale and also to repair the electrical appliances to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Samuel plans to save towards the expansion of the business.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for sale and also for the repair of  electrical appliances

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira A. is 34 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cows and sheep and with the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. 

Shoira is asking for a loan of 800 USD in order to buy more calves to sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal!

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.
