To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Deo's Group

texts.en:
Deo K. is the leader of his lending group and he is now seeking his 21st loan. He is a committed married man with a retail shop in his home town that is doing well, thanks to the loans that have provided him with the necessary capital for his business.

In his shop, Deo mostly sells the basics such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc., and stocking his goods in large quantities has helped him with making enough profits and savings. Deo needs another loan to help with stocking his shop with beans, maize, books, pens, and pencils since this is the season for making the greatest sales.

loans.use: Restock his retail shop with more products

loans.name: Mr. Som Nuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
There are nineteen members of this village bank in Anhchang Rung Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They will use their loan for various purposes.

Mr. Som N. has been selected as the village bank president by its members. He is a single farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He currently earns a small income to support his family. In order to improve his income, he decided to ask for a loan to buy three piglets to start a pig breeding business.

Eighteen members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy three piglets to start a pig breeding business.

loans.name: Venilda

texts.en:
Venilda B. ventured into the sari-sari store (a community based store) business as their source of income in their village.  She is married and has children: Rovelyn – 31 years old, married and working as a high school teacher; Rex – 27 years old, high school undergraduate; Rizalyn – 23 years old, high school graduate; Raymun Joe – 19 years old, automotive technician; Renier – 15 years old, high school student and Roby – 10 years old, grade four. They are helping one another for the improvement of their living situation. 

She would like to request a loan of PHP6, 000.00 to maintain her village store business. She plans to utilize her loan to buy one can cooking oil and 3 bags of rice that she will sell at retail prices. Her store is open from 6:00 in the morning and closes at 7:00 in the evening.  

Venilda wants a simple life as long as it can support their basic needs and provide the educational needs of their children.  In order to achieve this, she and her husband must work hard for their daily living.  She is thankful for having a good and loving family that inspires her in life.

loans.use: Store maintenance

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is maintaining a village store in their village.  She came up with this kind of business so she can assist her husband in meeting the growing needs of their family.  To further improve her business, she would like to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 7,000.00 that she will use to purchase additional merchandise for her store.  She aims that somehow, she will able to develop her store into a bigger one for them to have a stable source of income and support their needs.  She knows that they should work hard and preserve to achieve their dreams to have a progressive life in their village.  

Rowena is 29 years old and married to Nicasio, a truck driver.  She and her husband are blessed with five children: Mirriam – 8 years old, grade two; Prince – 7 years old, grade one; John – 3 years old; Winimay – 2 years old and the newly born, Jaden. The couple was thankful that they were able to provide the needs of their family through their income.

loans.use: Additional Merchandise for her store

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.en:
Married and the father of two children, E. Abduvali was born on August 03, 1973 in Spitamen district of Sugd region. Coming from an area where cattle-raising is popular, Abduvali has been selling cattle since 1998. He buys them in his village from the farmers who raise them and then sells them at the markets. As his business capital is limited, he buys just a few and then after he sells those, he returns to buy more. Today he would like to expand his business by increasing his capital, so that he can then maximize his profits. For this reason, he is requesting this first loan to purchase young cattle. This will be his first loan with IMON International, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Joselyn is 50 years old and already a widow. She has three children: Evincent – 28 years old, high school graduate; Visie – 21 years old, also a high school graduate who works as a saleslady; and the youngest is Eduardo – 17 years old, a fourth year high school student.

Joselyn aims to send her youngest child to college but she worries if she can afford all his educational expenses so she decided to maintain her hog-raising business. She is thankful that her two children are supporting her financially in their household needs and an allowance for her son. Her family lives in the rural village of Paragu Tumauini, Isabela.

Joselyn would like to request a loan of PHP 4,000 to sustain her hog-raising business. She also intends to use the loan to venture into another business which is a rice-retailing business. She plans to buy one sack of rice and different kinds of vegetables and native snacks. She carefully budgets her income in order to support their family and her son's studies. She is hoping to improve her small businesses in their village. “Do not do unto others what you do not want others to do unto you”, this is the passage that motivates Joselyn to do good things for other people especially for her neighbors.

loans.use: To start a rice-retailing business

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel T. is single and has no children. He has received schooling through junior high. Emmanuel is a carpenter who is specialized in making furniture at Tatermu near Elmina, a business which he started not too long ago. Emmanuel uses his income to pay rent, utility bills and other financial expenses.

Emmanuel will use the loan to purchase more wood and carpentry tools and equipment for the enhancement of his work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Emmanuel plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land for building a house so that he can stop paying rent and also get a comfortable shelter for himself.

loans.use: to purchase more wood and carpentry tools, etc.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma has been in barangay (township) Paragu, Tumauini, Isabela since she was born. She is happily married to Mario, a corn and rice farmer. She and Mario have four children: Maritel – 26 years old, Education graduate; Carol – 28 years old, Computer Science graduate; Joy – 30 years old, Engineering graduate; and Rochelle – 33 years old, a two-year course graduate. They have an average level of living.

Thelma is thankful that through her business, she was able to send all her children to school and to finish their studies. Although her children already graduated from college, she wanted to maintain her store for them to have a stable source of income providing for their needs. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 that she will use in her store and for their farming needs. Some of the things that she intends to buy are 3 sacks of rice, cooking oil, and a sack of brown sugar. She further said that her grandchildren will also benefit from her business.

loans.use: Store improvement and farming needs

loans.name: Gladness

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Gladness N. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 19. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. 

Gladness has been running a nursery school business since 2001. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, five days per week and is assisted by two employees. Gladness currently earns about US$300 from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase books and desks. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Gladness thanks you for your support!

	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase books and desks

loans.name: Caroline's Group

texts.en:
Caroline B. is one of the executive members of her lending group in Mityana. She is a married lady and trained to run a clinic, which is her business. She treats people and sells medicine to her patients. Her clients like this type of health service because there is a personal touch attached when you visit a private clinic as compared to the big Government hospitals. This is why trained clinicians like Caroline are in business. She offers over the counter health services as well as providing first aid and minor surgeries. Caroline treats her patients well. 

Caroline is requesting a loan to help stock her clinic with medicines like tablets, syrups, cotton wool, syringes, needles, so that she can earn a reasonable profit from her business.

loans.use: To buy medicines like tablets, syrups, cotton wool, syringes,and needles .

loans.name: Nosir

texts.en:
Nosir E. is a young, married man who breeds calves, in the small village of Spitamen, in the region of Sugd.  Nosir is young, but full of energy. He works each day to improve the life of his family. Nosir started in this cattle business a year ago. He has continued the business of his father, who is a pensioner. Nosir has great experience in cattle breeding because he has observed it since his childhood. 

Nosir would like to expand his business by purchasing more calves. This would help him to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. We wish him good luck and appreciate your help!

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.en:
Ikrom is a responsible father and loving son. From the time he was a boy, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to achieve good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Ikrom hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would allow him to continue developing his business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Ibrohimjon

texts.en:
K. Ibrohimjon is a young man and single. He lives with his parents. The father of Ibrohimjon has been working as a cook for 20 years. Now, he has a small restaurant which has become a family business and Ibrohimjon helps his father. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. As their place became more popular, Ibrohimjon was able to dedicate his whole time to the business. 

Ibrohimjon wants the loan so he could invest in tables, chairs and a refrigerator. He is asking for a loan $ 800 USD with the term of 12 months. With this money, Ibrohimjon will be able to expand their family business, to earn more profit and in near future, to get married. The well being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase tables, chairs and refrigerator for expanding his cafe business.

loans.name: Mrs. Hei Kory Village Bank Group

texts.en:
There are fifteen members of this village bank in Chrok Sangke Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They will use the loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Hei K. is the village bank president. She is 47 years old and sells firewood. She is the mother of nine children; two of whom are employed in a garment factory, three help their parents work, and the others attend the local school. Her husband, Mr. Vong Khorn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Even though they try to work hard, they still do not have enough money to provide a better house for their family. Mrs. Hei K. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to build a better house.

Mr.Vuthy S. is not participating in this loan, but his wife is, so she is shown in the photo instead of him.

Nine members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of sand and gravel for re-sale and also a transport vehicle

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en: Bayasgalan M. is a married woman and a mother of three. Her family lives in "ger" ((felt-lined tent) located on her sister's property. She runs the family business with her husband. She sews several types of clothes by machine, including winter coats, that her husband sells at the Narantuul market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Narantuul is a Ulaanbaatar's biggest market. She learned sewing when she was working at the clothing factory, as a master tailor, several years ago. She decided to start her own business in clothing when the sewing factory went bankrupt. She had MNT 200,000 (about $134 USD) of capital when she began the family business. Now her savings have increased to MNT 500,000. Last year, she bought some needed electronics for her family from the profits of her family business. Bayasgalan is one of best borrowers of XacBank, the microfinance institution of Kiva in Mongolia.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for clothing business

loans.name: Hastiali

texts.en:
M. Hastiali is married with two children. Hastiali is a unique entrepreneur. He has been a market vendor for about 8 years. During that time he become very popular at the market and has many clients. The secret of his success is simple: he tries to not only let his customers know the benefits of his products, he also gives them a sense of relationship which brings them back again and again. However, he doesn’t want to stop where he is with his venture. Hastiali is seeking a loan of $ 600 USD to increase the merchandise in his store. We believe that Hastiali’s desire to excel in pleasing his customers will determine his further success and will encourage new customers to buy from him.
